function.name: PJSIP_DIAL_CONTACTS
function.synopsis: Return a dial string for dialing all contacts on an AOR.

parameter.name: endpoint
parameter.para: Name of the endpoint

parameter.name: aor
parameter.para: Name of an AOR to use, if not specified the configured AORs on the endpoint are used

parameter.name: request_user
parameter.para: Optional request user to use in the request URI

description.para: Returns a properly formatted dial string for dialing all contacts on an AOR.

function.name: PJSIP_MEDIA_OFFER
function.synopsis: Media and codec offerings to be set on an outbound SIP channel prior to dialing.

parameter.name: media
parameter.para: types of media offered

description.para: When read, returns the codecs offered based upon the media choice.
When written, sets the codecs to offer when an outbound dial attempt is made, or when a session refresh is sent using PJSIP_SEND_SESSION_REFRESH.

function.name: PJSIP_DTMF_MODE
function.synopsis: Get or change the DTMF mode for a SIP call.

description.para: When read, returns the current DTMF mode
When written, sets the current DTMF mode
This function uses the same DTMF mode naming as the dtmf_mode configuration option

function.name: PJSIP_SEND_SESSION_REFRESH
function.synopsis: W/O: Initiate a session refresh via an UPDATE or re-INVITE on an established media session

parameter.name: update_type
parameter.para: The type of update to send. Default is invite.

enum.name: invite
enum.para: Send the session refresh as a re-INVITE.

enum.name: update
enum.para: Send the session refresh as an UPDATE.

description.para: This function will cause the PJSIP stack to immediately refresh the media session for the channel. This will be done using either a re-INVITE (default) or an UPDATE request.
This is most useful when combined with the PJSIP_MEDIA_OFFER dialplan function, as it allows the formats in use on a channel to be re-negotiated after call setup.

warning.para: The formats the endpoint supports are not checked or enforced by this function. Using this function to offer formats not supported by the endpoint may result in a loss of media.

description.example: ; Within some existing extension on an answered channel same => n,Set(PJSIP_MEDIA_OFFER(audio)=!all,g722) same => n,Set(PJSIP_SEND_SESSION_REFRESH()=invite)

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Published when a malicious call ID request arrives.

description.para: There are three different transports and protocol derivatives supported by chan_motif. They are in order of preference: Jingle using ICE-UDP, Google Jingle, and Google-V1.
Jingle as defined in XEP-0166 supports the widest range of features. It is referred to as ice-udp. This is the specification that Jingle clients implement.

Google Jingle follows the Jingle specification for signaling but uses a custom transport for media. It is supported by the Google Talk Plug-in in Gmail and by some other Jingle clients. It is referred to as google in this file.

Google-V1 is the original Google Talk signaling protocol which uses an initial preliminary version of Jingle. It also uses the same custom transport as Google Jingle for media. It is supported by Google Voice, some other Jingle clients, and the Windows Google Talk client. It is referred to as google-v1 in this file.
Incoming sessions will automatically switch to the correct transport once it has been determined.

Outgoing sessions are capable of determining if the target is capable of Jingle or a Google transport if the target is in the roster. Unfortunately it is not possible to differentiate between a Google Jingle or Google-V1 capable resource until a session initiate attempt occurs. If a resource is determined to use a Google transport it will initially use Google Jingle but will fall back to Google-V1 if required.
If an outgoing session attempt fails due to failure to support the given transport chan_motif will fall back in preference order listed previously until all transports have been exhausted.
Placing a call through an endpoint can be accomplished using the following dial string:

When placing an outgoing call through an endpoint the requested target is searched for in the roster list. If present the first Jingle or Google Jingle capable resource is specifically targeted. Since the capabilities of the resource are known the outgoing session initiation will disregard the configured transport and use the determined one.

If the target is not found in the roster the target will be used as-is and a session will be initiated using the transport specified in this configuration file. If no transport has been specified the endpoint defaults to ice-udp.
Support for video does not need to be explicitly enabled. Configuring any video codec on your endpoint will automatically enable it.
The only supported method for DTMF is RFC2833. This is always enabled on audio streams and negotiated if possible.
Incoming calls will first look for the extension matching the name of the endpoint in the configured context. If no such extension exists the call will automatically fall back to the s extension.

The incoming caller id number is populated with the username of the caller and the name is populated with the full identity of the caller. If you would like to perform authentication or filtering of incoming calls it is recommended that you use these fields to do so.
Outgoing caller id can not be set.

warning.para: Multiple endpoints using the same connection is NOT supported. Doing so may result in broken calls.

enum.name: ice-udp
enum.para: The Jingle protocol, as defined in XEP 0166.

enum.name: google
enum.para: The Google Jingle protocol, which follows the Jingle specification for signaling but uses a custom transport for media.

enum.name: google-v1
enum.para: Google-V1 is the original Google Talk signaling protocol which uses an initial preliminary version of Jingle. It also uses the same custom transport as google for media.

application.synopsis: Change the dtmfmode for a SIP call.

description.para: Changes the dtmfmode for a SIP call.

application.name: SIPAddHeader
application.synopsis: Add a SIP header to the outbound call.

description.para: Adds a header to a SIP call placed with DIAL.
Remember to use the X-header if you are adding non-standard SIP headers, like X-Asterisk-Accountcode:. Use this with care. Adding the wrong headers may jeopardize the SIP dialog.
Always returns 0.

application.name: SIPRemoveHeader
application.synopsis: Remove SIP headers previously added with SIPAddHeader

description.para: SIPRemoveHeader() allows you to remove headers which were previously added with SIPAddHeader(). If no parameter is supplied, all previously added headers will be removed. If a parameter is supplied, only the matching headers will be removed.
For example you have added these 2 headers:
SIPAddHeader(P-Asserted-Identity: sip:foo@bar);
SIPAddHeader(P-Preferred-Identity: sip:bar@foo);
// remove all headers
SIPRemoveHeader();
// remove all P- headers
SIPRemoveHeader(P-);
// remove only the PAI header (note the : at the end)
SIPRemoveHeader(P-Asserted-Identity:);
Always returns 0.

application.name: SIPSendCustomINFO
application.synopsis: Send a custom INFO frame on specified channels.

description.para: SIPSendCustomINFO() allows you to send a custom INFO message on all active SIP channels or on channels with the specified User Agent. This application is only available if TEST_FRAMEWORK is defined.

function.name: SIP_HEADER
function.synopsis: Gets the specified SIP header from an incoming INVITE message.

parameter.name: number
parameter.para: If not specified, defaults to 1.

description.para: Since there are several headers (such as Via) which can occur multiple times, SIP_HEADER takes an optional second argument to specify which header with that name to retrieve. Headers start at offset 1.
Please observe that contents of the SDP (an attachment to the SIP request) can't be accessed with this function.

function.synopsis: Do a DUNDi lookup of a phone number.

option.para: Bypass the internal DUNDi cache

description.para: This will do a DUNDi lookup of the given phone number.
This function will return the Technology/Resource found in the first result in the DUNDi lookup. If no results were found, the result will be blank.

function.name: DUNDIQUERY
function.synopsis: Initiate a DUNDi query.

parameter.para: If not specified the default will be e164.

option.name: b

The result of this function will be a numeric ID that can be used to retrieve the results with the DUNDIRESULT function.

function.synopsis: Retrieve results from a DUNDIQUERY.

option.para: The total number of results that are available.

description.para: This function will retrieve results from a previous use\n" of the DUNDIQUERY function.

parameter.name: routine
parameter.para: Named subroutine to execute.

description.para: Execute the named subroutine, defined in AEL, from another dialplan language, such as extensions.conf, Realtime extensions, or Lua.
The purpose of this application is to provide a sane entry point into AEL subroutines, the implementation of which may change from time to time.

application.name: NoCDR
application.synopsis: Tell Asterisk to not maintain a CDR for this channel.

description.para: This application will tell Asterisk not to maintain a CDR for the current channel. This does NOT mean that information is not tracked; rather, if the channel is hung up no CDRs will be created for that channel.
If a subsequent call to ResetCDR occurs, all non-finalized CDRs created for the channel will be enabled.

note.para: This application is deprecated. Please use the CDR_PROP function to disable CDRs on a channel.

option.name: v
option.para: Save the CDR variables during the reset.

option.name: e
option.para: Enable the CDRs for this channel only (negate effects of NoCDR).

description.para: This application causes the Call Data Record to be reset. Depending on the flags passed in, this can have several effects. With no options, a reset does the following:
1. The start time is set to the current time.
2. If the channel is answered, the answer time is set to the current time.
3. All variables are wiped from the CDR. Note that this step can be prevented with the v option.
On the other hand, if the e option is specified, the effects of the NoCDR application will be lifted. CDRs will be re-enabled for this channel.

note.para: The e option is deprecated. Please use the CDR_PROP function instead.

argument.name: extension
argument.para: Specification of the pickup target.

argument.name: extension2
argument.para: Additional specifications of pickup targets.

description.para: This application can pickup a specified ringing channel. The channel to pickup can be specified in the following ways.
1) If no extension targets are specified, the application will pickup a channel matching the pickup group of the requesting channel.

2) If the extension is specified with a context of the special string PICKUPMARK (for example 10@PICKUPMARK), the application will pickup a channel which has defined the channel variable PICKUPMARK with the same value as extension (in this example, 10).
3) If the extension is specified with or without a context, the channel with a matching extension and context will be picked up. If no context is specified, the current context will be used.

note.para: The extension is typically set on matching channels by the dial application that created the channel. The context is set on matching channels by the channel driver for the device.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.para: List of channel names or channel uniqueids to pickup if ringing. For example, a channel name could be SIP/bob or SIP/bob-00000000 to find SIP/bob-00000000.

option.name: p
option.para: Supplied channel names are prefixes. For example, SIP/bob will match SIP/bob-00000000 and SIP/bobby-00000000.

description.para: Pickup a specified channel if ringing.

application.name: ChannelRedirect
application.synopsis: Redirects given channel to a dialplan target

description.para: Sends the specified channel to the specified extension priority
This application sets the following channel variables upon completion

variable.name: CHANNELREDIRECT_STATUS
variable.para: Are set to the result of the redirection

argument.name: Technology/Resource
argument.para: Specification of the device(s) to dial. These must be in the format of Technology/Resource, where Technology represents a particular channel driver, and Resource represents a resource available to that particular channel driver.

argument.name: Technology2/Resource2
argument.para: Optional extra devices to dial in parallel
If you need more than one, enter them as Technology2/Resource2& Technology3/Resource3&.....

option.name: b
option.para: Before initiating an outgoing call, Gosub to the specified location using the newly created channel. The Gosub will be executed for each destination channel.

option.name: B
option.para: Before initiating the outgoing call(s), Gosub to the specified location using the current channel.

option.name: d
option.para: Full duplex audio

option.name: i
option.para: Ignore attempts to forward the call

option.name: q
option.para: Quiet, do not play beep to caller

option.name: r
option.para: Record the page into a file (CONFBRIDGE(bridge,record_conference))

option.name: s
option.para: Only dial a channel if its device state says that it is NOT_INUSE

option.name: A

argument.name: x
argument.para: The announcement to playback to all devices

option.para: Play an announcement to all paged participants

option.name: n
option.para: Do not play announcement to caller (alters A(x) behavior)

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: Specify the length of time that the system will attempt to connect a call. After this duration, any page calls that have not been answered will be hung up by the system.

description.para: Places outbound calls to the given technology/resource and dumps them into a conference bridge as muted participants. The original caller is dumped into the conference as a speaker and the room is destroyed when the original caller leaves.

parameter.name: conference
parameter.para: Name of the conference bridge. You are not limited to just numbers.

parameter.name: bridge_profile
parameter.para: The bridge profile name from confbridge.conf. When left blank, a dynamically built bridge profile created by the CONFBRIDGE dialplan function is searched for on the channel and used. If no dynamic profile is present, the 'default_bridge' profile found in confbridge.conf is used.
It is important to note that while user profiles may be unique for each participant, mixing bridge profiles on a single conference is _NOT_ recommended and will produce undefined results.

parameter.name: user_profile
parameter.para: The user profile name from confbridge.conf. When left blank, a dynamically built user profile created by the CONFBRIDGE dialplan function is searched for on the channel and used. If no dynamic profile is present, the 'default_user' profile found in confbridge.conf is used.

parameter.name: menu
parameter.para: The name of the DTMF menu in confbridge.conf to be applied to this channel. When left blank, a dynamically built menu profile created by the CONFBRIDGE dialplan function is searched for on the channel and used. If no dynamic profile is present, the 'default_menu' profile found in confbridge.conf is used.

description.para: Enters the user into a specified conference bridge. The user can exit the conference by hangup or DTMF menu option.
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: CONFBRIDGE_RESULT
variable.value: The channel encountered an error and could not enter the conference.
The channel exited the conference by hanging up.
The channel was kicked from the conference.
The channel left the conference as a result of the last marked user leaving.
The channel pressed a DTMF sequence to exit the conference.
The channel reached its configured timeout.

function.name: CONFBRIDGE
function.synopsis: Set a custom dynamic bridge, user, or menu profile on a channel for the ConfBridge application using the same options available in confbridge.conf.

parameter.name: type
parameter.para: To what type of conference profile the option applies.

parameter.name: option
parameter.para: Option refers to a confbridge.conf option that is being set dynamically on this channel, or clear to remove already applied profile options from the channel.

description.para: A custom profile uses the default profile type settings defined in confbridge.conf as defaults if the profile template is not explicitly specified first.
For bridge profiles the default template is default_bridge.
For menu profiles the default template is default_menu.
For user profiles the default template is default_user.
---- Example 1 ----
In this example the custom user profile set on the channel will automatically be used by the ConfBridge application.
exten => 1,1,Answer()
; In this example the effect of the following line is
; implied:
; same => n,Set(CONFBRIDGE(user,template)=default_user)
same => n,Set(CONFBRIDGE(user,announce_join_leave)=yes)
same => n,Set(CONFBRIDGE(user,startmuted)=yes)
same => n,ConfBridge(1)
---- Example 2 ----

This example shows how to use a predefined user profile in confbridge.conf as a template for a dynamic profile. Here we make an admin/marked user out of the my_user profile that you define in confbridge.conf.
exten => 1,1,Answer()
same => n,Set(CONFBRIDGE(user,template)=my_user)
same => n,Set(CONFBRIDGE(user,admin)=yes)
same => n,Set(CONFBRIDGE(user,marked)=yes)
same => n,ConfBridge(1)

function.name: CONFBRIDGE_INFO
function.synopsis: Get information about a ConfBridge conference.

parameter.name: type
parameter.para: What conference information is requested.

enum.name: admins
enum.para: Get the number of admin users in the conference.

enum.name: locked
enum.para: Determine if the conference is locked. (0 or 1)

enum.name: marked
enum.para: Get the number of marked users in the conference.

enum.name: muted
enum.para: Determine if the conference is muted. (0 or 1)

enum.name: parties
enum.para: Get the number of users in the conference.

parameter.name: conf
parameter.para: The name of the conference being referenced.

description.para: This function returns a non-negative integer for valid conference names and an empty string for invalid conference names.

parameter.name: Conference
parameter.para: Conference number.

description.para: Lists all users in a particular ConfBridge conference. ConfbridgeList will follow as separate events, followed by a final event called ConfbridgeListComplete.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised as part of the ConfbridgeList action response list.

parameter.name: Conference
parameter.para: The name of the Confbridge conference.

parameter.name: Admin
parameter.para: Identifies this user as an admin user.

parameter.name: MarkedUser
parameter.para: Identifies this user as a marked user.

parameter.name: WaitMarked
parameter.para: Must this user wait for a marked user to join?

parameter.name: EndMarked
parameter.para: Does this user get kicked after the last marked user leaves?

parameter.name: Waiting
parameter.para: Is this user waiting for a marked user to join?

parameter.name: Muted
parameter.para: The current mute status.

parameter.name: Talking
parameter.para: Is this user talking?

parameter.name: AnsweredTime
parameter.para: The number of seconds the channel has been up.

description.para: Lists data about all active conferences. ConfbridgeListRooms will follow as separate events, followed by a final event called ConfbridgeListRoomsComplete.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: If this parameter is not a complete channel name, the first channel with this prefix will be used.
If this parameter is "all", all channels will be muted.
If this parameter is "participants", all non-admin channels will be muted.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: If this parameter is not a complete channel name, the first channel with this prefix will be used.
If this parameter is "all", all channels will be unmuted.
If this parameter is "participants", all non-admin channels will be unmuted.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: If this parameter is "all", all channels will be kicked from the conference.
If this parameter is "participants", all non-admin channels will be kicked from the conference.

description.para: Start recording a conference. If recording is already present an error will be returned. If RecordFile is not provided, the default record file specified in the conference's bridge profile will be used, if that is not present either a file will automatically be generated in the monitor directory.

manager.name: ConfbridgeSetSingleVideoSrc
manager.synopsis: Set a conference user as the single video source distributed to all other participants.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: If this parameter is not a complete channel name, the first channel with this prefix will be used.

parameter.name: options
parameter.para: Comma separated list of options

option.name: skip
option.para: Do not play if not answered

option.name: noanswer
option.para: Playback without answering, otherwise the channel will be answered before the sound is played.

note.para: Not all channel types support playing messages while still on hook.

description.para: Plays back given filenames (do not put extension of wav/alaw etc). The playback command answer the channel if no options are specified. If the file is non-existant it will fail
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: PLAYBACKSTATUS
variable.para: The status of the playback attempt as a text string.

description.para: See Also: Background (application) -- for playing sound files that are interruptible
WaitExten (application) -- wait for digits from caller, optionally play music on hold

Requests the remote caller be transferred to a given destination. If TECH (SIP, IAX2, etc) is used, only an incoming call with the same channel technology will be transferred. Note that for SIP, if you transfer before call is setup, a 302 redirect SIP message will be returned to the caller.
The result of the application will be reported in the TRANSFERSTATUS channel variable:

variable.name: TRANSFERSTATUS
variable.value: Transfer succeeded.
Transfer failed.
Transfer unsupported by channel driver.

description.para: Performs a flash on a DAHDI trunk. This can be used to access features provided on an incoming analogue circuit such as conference and call waiting. Use with SendDTMF() to perform external transfers.
Start a While Loop. Execution will return to this point when EndWhile() is called until expr is no longer true.
Return to the previous called While().
Exits a While() loop, whether or not the conditional has been satisfied.
Returns to the top of the while loop and re-evaluates the conditional.

application.name: Verbose
application.synopsis: Send arbitrary text to verbose output.

parameter.name: level
parameter.para: Must be an integer value. If not specified, defaults to 0.

parameter.name: message
parameter.para: Output text message.

description.para: Sends an arbitrary text message to verbose output.

application.name: Log
application.synopsis: Send arbitrary text to a selected log level.

parameter.name: level
parameter.para: Level must be one of ERROR, WARNING, NOTICE, DEBUG, VERBOSE or DTMF.

parameter.name: message
parameter.para: Output text message.

description.para: Sends an arbitrary text message to a selected log level.

parameter.name: passcode|filename
parameter.para: If you need to present a DISA dialtone without entering a password, simply set passcode to no-password
You may specified a filename instead of a passcode, this filename must contain individual passcodes

parameter.name: context
parameter.para: Specifies the dialplan context in which the user-entered extension will be matched. If no context is specified, the DISA application defaults to the disa context. Presumably a normal system will have a special context set up for DISA use with some or a lot of restrictions.

parameter.name: cid
parameter.para: Specifies a new (different) callerid to be used for this call.

parameter.name: mailbox
parameter.para: Will cause a stutter-dialtone (indication dialrecall) to be used, if the specified mailbox contains any new messages.

option.name: n
option.para: The DISA application will not answer initially.

option.name: p
option.para: The extension entered will be considered complete when a # is entered.

description.para: The DISA, Direct Inward System Access, application allows someone from outside the telephone switch (PBX) to obtain an internal system dialtone and to place calls from it as if they were placing a call from within the switch. DISA plays a dialtone. The user enters their numeric passcode, followed by the pound sign #. If the passcode is correct, the user is then given system dialtone within context on which a call may be placed. If the user enters an invalid extension and extension i exists in the specified context, it will be used.
Be aware that using this may compromise the security of your PBX.
The arguments to this application (in extensions.conf) allow either specification of a single global passcode (that everyone uses), or individual passcodes contained in a file (filename).

The file that contains the passcodes (if used) allows a complete specification of all of the same arguments available on the command line, with the sole exception of the options. The file may contain blank lines, or comments starting with # or ;.

parameter.name: password
parameter.para: Password the user should know

option.name: a
option.para: Set the channels' account code to the password that is entered

option.name: d
option.para: Interpret the given path as database key, not a literal file.

note.para: The value is not used at all in the authentication when using this option. If the family/key is set to /pin/100 (value does not matter) then the password field needs to be set to /pin and the pin entered by the user would be authenticated against 100.

option.name: m
option.para: Interpret the given path as a file which contains a list of account codes and password hashes delimited with :, listed one per line in the file. When one of the passwords is matched, the channel will have its account code set to the corresponding account code in the file.

option.name: r
option.para: Remove the database key upon successful entry (valid with d only)

parameter.name: maxdigits
parameter.para: maximum acceptable number of digits. Stops reading after maxdigits have been entered (without requiring the user to press the # key). Defaults to 0 - no limit - wait for the user press the # key.

parameter.name: prompt
parameter.para: Override the agent-pass prompt file.

description.para: This application asks the caller to enter a given password in order to continue dialplan execution.
If the password begins with the / character, it is interpreted as a file which contains a list of valid passwords, listed 1 password per line in the file.
When using a database key, the value associated with the key can be anything.
Users have three attempts to authenticate before the channel is hung up.

parameter.name: command
parameter.para: Command to execute

warning.para: Do not use untrusted strings such as CALLERID(num) or CALLERID(name) as part of the command parameters. You risk a command injection attack executing arbitrary commands if the untrusted strings aren't filtered to remove dangerous characters. See function FILTER().

description.para: Executes a command by using system(). If the command fails, the console should report a fallthrough.
Result of execution is returned in the SYSTEMSTATUS channel variable:

variable.name: SYSTEMSTATUS
variable.value: Could not execute the specified command.
Specified command successfully executed.

parameter.name: command
parameter.para: Command to execute

warning.para: Do not use untrusted strings such as CALLERID(num) or CALLERID(name) as part of the command parameters. You risk a command injection attack executing arbitrary commands if the untrusted strings aren't filtered to remove dangerous characters. See function FILTER().

description.para: Executes a command by using system().
Result of execution is returned in the SYSTEMSTATUS channel variable:

variable.name: SYSTEMSTATUS
variable.value: Could not execute the specified command.
Specified command successfully executed.
Specified command successfully executed, but returned error code.

application.name: DBdel
application.synopsis: Delete a key from the asterisk database.

description.para: This application will delete a key from the Asterisk database.

note.para: This application has been DEPRECATED in favor of the DB_DELETE function.

application.name: DBdeltree
application.synopsis: Delete a family or keytree from the asterisk database.

description.para: This application will delete a family or keytree from the Asterisk database.

parameter.name: digits
parameter.para: List of digits 0-9,*#,a-d,A-D to send also w for a half second pause, W for a one second pause, and f or F for a flash-hook if the channel supports flash-hook.

parameter.name: timeout_ms
parameter.para: Amount of time to wait in ms between tones. (defaults to .25s)

parameter.name: duration_ms
parameter.para: Duration of each digit

parameter.name: channel
parameter.para: Channel where digits will be played

description.para: It will send all digits or terminate if it encounters an error.

manager.name: PlayDTMF
manager.synopsis: Play DTMF signal on a specific channel.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Channel name to send digit to.

parameter.name: Digit
parameter.para: The DTMF digit to play.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.para: The duration, in milliseconds, of the digit to be played.

description.para: Plays a dtmf digit on the specified channel.

application.name: ForkCDR
application.synopsis: Forks the current Call Data Record for this channel.

option.name: a
option.para: If the channel is answered, set the answer time on the forked CDR to the current time. If this option is not used, the answer time on the forked CDR will be the answer time on the original CDR. If the channel is not answered, this option has no effect.
Note that this option is implicitly assumed if the r option is used.

option.name: e
option.para: End (finalize) the original CDR.

option.name: r
option.para: Reset the start and answer times on the forked CDR. This will set the start and answer times (if the channel is answered) to be set to the current time.
Note that this option implicitly assumes the a option.

option.name: v
option.para: Do not copy CDR variables and attributes from the original CDR to the forked CDR.

warning.para: This option has changed. Previously, the variables were removed from the original CDR. This no longer occurs - this option now controls whether or not a forked CDR inherits the variables from the original CDR.

description.para: Causes the Call Data Record engine to fork a new CDR starting from the time the application is executed. The forked CDR will be linked to the end of the CDRs associated with the channel.

parameter.name: confno
parameter.para: The conference number

option.name: a
option.para: Set admin mode.

option.name: A
option.para: Set marked mode.

option.name: b
option.para: Run AGI script specified in MEETME_AGI_BACKGROUND Default: conf-background.agi.

note.para: This does not work with non-DAHDI channels in the same conference).

option.name: c
option.para: Announce user(s) count on joining a conference.

option.name: C
option.para: Continue in dialplan when kicked out of conference.

option.name: d
option.para: Dynamically add conference.

option.name: D
option.para: Dynamically add conference, prompting for a PIN.

option.name: e
option.para: Select an empty conference.

option.name: E
option.para: Select an empty pinless conference.

option.name: F
option.para: Pass DTMF through the conference.

option.name: G

argument.name: x
argument.para: The file to playback

option.para: Play an intro announcement in conference.

option.name: i
option.para: Announce user join/leave with review.

option.name: I
option.para: Announce user join/leave without review.

option.name: k
option.para: Close the conference if there's only one active participant left at exit.

option.name: l
option.para: Set listen only mode (Listen only, no talking).

option.name: m
option.para: Set initially muted.

option.name: M
option.para: Enable music on hold when the conference has a single caller. Optionally, specify a musiconhold class to use. If one is not provided, it will use the channel's currently set music class, or default.

option.name: n
option.para: Disable the denoiser. By default, if func_speex is loaded, Asterisk will apply a denoiser to channels in the MeetMe conference. However, channel drivers that present audio with a varying rate will experience degraded performance with a denoiser attached. This parameter allows a channel joining the conference to choose not to have a denoiser attached without having to unload func_speex.

option.name: o
option.para: Set talker optimization - treats talkers who aren't speaking as being muted, meaning (a) No encode is done on transmission and (b) Received audio that is not registered as talking is omitted causing no buildup in background noise.

option.name: p
option.para: Allow user to exit the conference by pressing # (default) or any of the defined keys. Dial plan execution will continue at the next priority following MeetMe. The key used is set to channel variable MEETME_EXIT_KEY.

note.para: Option s has priority for * since it cannot change its activation code.

option.name: P
option.para: Always prompt for the pin even if it is specified.

option.name: q
option.para: Quiet mode (don't play enter/leave sounds).

option.name: r
option.para: Record conference (records as MEETME_RECORDINGFILE using format MEETME_RECORDINGFORMAT. Default filename is meetme-conf-rec-${CONFNO}-${UNIQUEID} and the default format is wav.

option.name: s
option.para: Present menu (user or admin) when * is received (send to menu).

option.name: t
option.para: Set talk only mode. (Talk only, no listening).

option.name: T
option.para: Set talker detection (sent to manager interface and meetme list).

option.name: v
option.para: Announce when a user is joining or leaving the conference. Use the voicemail greeting as the announcement. If the i or I options are set, the application will fall back to them if no voicemail greeting can be found.

argument.name: mailbox@[context]
argument.para: The mailbox and voicemail context to play from. If no context provided, assumed context is default.

option.name: w
option.para: Wait until the marked user enters the conference.

option.name: x
option.para: Leave the conference when the last marked user leaves.

option.name: X
option.para: Allow user to exit the conference by entering a valid single digit extension MEETME_EXIT_CONTEXT or the current context if that variable is not defined.

note.para: Option s has priority for * since it cannot change its activation code.

option.para: Do not play message when first person enters

option.name: S
option.para: Kick the user x seconds after he entered into the conference.

option.name: L
option.para: Limit the conference to x ms. Play a warning when y ms are left. Repeat the warning every z ms. The following special variables can be used with this option:

variable.name: CONF_LIMIT_TIMEOUT_FILE
variable.para: File to play when time is up.

variable.name: CONF_LIMIT_WARNING_FILE
variable.para: File to play as warning if y is defined. The default is to say the time remaining.

description.para: Enters the user into a specified MeetMe conference. If the confno is omitted, the user will be prompted to enter one. User can exit the conference by hangup, or if the p option is specified, by pressing #.

note.para: The DAHDI kernel modules and a functional DAHDI timing source (see dahdi_test) must be present for conferencing to operate properly. In addition, the chan_dahdi channel driver must be loaded for the i and r options to operate at all.

parameter.name: confno
parameter.para: Conference number.

description.para: Plays back the number of users in the specified MeetMe conference. If var is specified, playback will be skipped and the value will be returned in the variable. Upon application completion, MeetMeCount will hangup the channel, unless priority n+1 exists, in which case priority progress will continue.

option.name: e
option.para: Eject last user that joined.

option.name: E
option.para: Extend conference end time, if scheduled.

option.name: k
option.para: Kick one user out of conference.

option.name: K
option.para: Kick all users out of conference.

option.name: l
option.para: Unlock conference.

option.name: L
option.para: Lock conference.

option.name: m
option.para: Unmute one user.

option.name: M
option.para: Mute one user.

option.name: n
option.para: Unmute all users in the conference.

option.name: N
option.para: Mute all non-admin users in the conference.

option.name: r
option.para: Reset one user's volume settings.

option.name: R
option.para: Reset all users volume settings.

option.name: s
option.para: Lower entire conference speaking volume.

option.name: S
option.para: Raise entire conference speaking volume.

option.name: t
option.para: Lower one user's talk volume.

option.name: T
option.para: Raise one user's talk volume.

option.name: u
option.para: Lower one user's listen volume.

option.name: U
option.para: Raise one user's listen volume.

option.name: v
option.para: Lower entire conference listening volume.

option.name: V
option.para: Raise entire conference listening volume.

description.para: Run admin command for conference confno.
Will additionally set the variable MEETMEADMINSTATUS with one of the following values:

variable.name: MEETMEADMINSTATUS
variable.value: Invalid arguments.
User specified was not found.
Another failure occurred.
The operation was completed successfully.

option.name: k
option.para: Kick the specified user out of the conference he is in.

option.name: m
option.para: Unmute the specified user.

option.name: M
option.para: Mute the specified user.

description.para: Run admin command for a specific channel in any conference.

parameter.name: station
parameter.para: Station name

description.para: This application should be executed by an SLA station. The argument depends on how the call was initiated. If the phone was just taken off hook, then the argument station should be just the station name. If the call was initiated by pressing a line key, then the station name should be preceded by an underscore and the trunk name associated with that line button.
For example: station1_line1
On exit, this application will set the variable SLASTATION_STATUS to one of the following values:

parameter.name: trunk
parameter.para: Trunk name

option.name: M
option.para: Play back the specified MOH class instead of ringing

description.para: This application should be executed by an SLA trunk on an inbound call. The channel calling this application should correspond to the SLA trunk with the name trunk that is being passed as an argument.
On exit, this application will set the variable SLATRUNK_STATUS to one of the following values:

function.name: MEETME_INFO

enum.name: dynamic

parameter.para: Conference number.

description.para: Lists all users in a particular MeetMe conference. MeetmeList will follow as separate events, followed by a final event called MeetmeListComplete.
Lists data about all active conferences. MeetmeListRooms will follow as separate events, followed by a final event called MeetmeListRoomsComplete.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a user joins a MeetMe conference.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a MeetMe conference ends.
Raised when a MeetMe user has started talking.

parameter.para: The length of time in seconds that the Meetme user has been in the conference at the time of this event.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a MeetMe user begins or ends talking.
Raised when a MeetMe user is muted or unmuted.

application.name: WaitForSilence
application.synopsis: Waits for a specified amount of silence.

parameter.name: silencerequired
parameter.para: If not specified, defaults to 1000 milliseconds.

parameter.name: iterations
parameter.para: If not specified, defaults to 1.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: Is specified only to avoid an infinite loop in cases where silence is never achieved.

description.para: Waits for up to silencerequired milliseconds of silence, iterations times. An optional timeout specified the number of seconds to return after, even if we do not receive the specified amount of silence. Use timeout with caution, as it may defeat the purpose of this application, which is to wait indefinitely until silence is detected on the line. This is particularly useful for reverse-911-type call broadcast applications where you need to wait for an answering machine to complete its spiel before playing a message.
Typically you will want to include two or more calls to WaitForSilence when dealing with an answering machine; first waiting for the spiel to finish, then waiting for the beep, etc.
Examples:
WaitForSilence(500,2) will wait for 1/2 second of silence, twice
WaitForSilence(1000) will wait for 1 second of silence, once
WaitForSilence(300,3,10) will wait for 300ms silence, 3 times, and returns after 10 sec, even if silence is not detected
Sets the channel variable WAITSTATUS to one of these values:

variable.name: WAITSTATUS
variable.value: if exited with silence detected.
if exited without silence detected after timeout.

application.name: WaitForNoise
application.synopsis: Waits for a specified amount of noise.

parameter.name: noiserequired
parameter.para: If not specified, defaults to 1000 milliseconds.

parameter.name: iterations
parameter.para: If not specified, defaults to 1.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: Is specified only to avoid an infinite loop in cases where silence is never achieved.

description.para: Waits for up to noiserequired milliseconds of noise, iterations times. An optional timeout specified the number of seconds to return after, even if we do not receive the specified amount of noise. Use timeout with caution, as it may defeat the purpose of this application, which is to wait indefinitely until noise is detected on the line.

application.name: StreamEcho
application.synopsis: Echo media, up to 'N' streams of a type, and DTMF back to the calling party

parameter.name: num
parameter.para: The number of streams of a type to echo back. If '0' is specified then all streams of a type are removed.

parameter.name: type
parameter.para: The media type of the stream(s) to add or remove (in the case of "num" being '0'). This can be set to either "audio" or "video" (default). If "num" is empty (i.e. not specified) then this parameter is ignored.

description.para: If a "num" (the number of streams) is not given then this simply echos back any media or DTMF frames (note, however if '#' is detected then the application exits) read from the calling channel back to itself. This means for any relevant frame read from a particular stream it is written back out to the associated write stream in a one to one fashion.

However if a "num" is specified, and if the calling channel allows it (a new offer is made requesting the allowance of additional streams) then any any media received, like before, is echoed back onto each stream. However, in this case a relevant frame received on a stream of the given "type" is also echoed back out to the other streams of that same type. It should be noted that when operating in this mode only the first stream found of the given "type" is allowed from the original offer. And this first stream found is also the only stream of that "type" granted read (send/receive) capabilities in the new offer whereas the additional ones are set to receive only.

note.para: This does not echo CONTROL, MODEM, or NULL frames.

application.name: UserEvent
application.synopsis: Send an arbitrary user-defined event to parties interested in a channel (AMI users and relevant res_stasis applications).

description.para: Sends an arbitrary event to interested parties, with an optional body representing additional arguments. The body may be specified as a , delimited list of key:value pairs.
For AMI, each additional argument will be placed on a new line in the event and the format of the event will be:
Event: UserEvent
UserEvent: <specified event name>
[body]
If no body is specified, only Event and UserEvent headers will be present.
For res_stasis applications, the event will be provided as a JSON blob with additional arguments appearing as keys in the object and the eventname under the eventname key.

option.name: a
option.para: Hang up all channels on a specified device instead of a single resource

description.para: Hangs up the requested channel. If there are no channels to hangup, the application will report it.
Executes nbscat to listen to the local NBS stream. User can exit by pressing any key.

application.name: BackgroundDetect
application.synopsis: Background a file with talk detect.

parameter.name: sil
parameter.para: If not specified, defaults to 1000.

parameter.name: min
parameter.para: If not specified, defaults to 100.

parameter.name: max
parameter.para: If not specified, defaults to infinity.

parameter.name: analysistime
parameter.para: If not specified, defaults to infinity.

description.para: Plays back filename, waiting for interruption from a given digit (the digit must start the beginning of a valid extension, or it will be ignored). During the playback of the file, audio is monitored in the receive direction, and if a period of non-silence which is greater than min ms yet less than max ms is followed by silence for at least sil ms, which occurs during the first analysistime ms, then the audio playback is aborted and processing jumps to the talk extension, if available.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.para: Path of the filename (image) to send.

description.para: Send an image file on a channel supporting it.
Result of transmission will be stored in SENDIMAGESTATUS

variable.name: SENDIMAGESTATUS
variable.value: Transmission succeeded.
Transmission failed.
Image transmission not supported by channel.

parameter.name: options
parameter.para: Comma delimited list of options.

option.name: answer
option.para: Causes the line to be answered before playing the tone.

option.name: nocallerid
option.para: Causes Zapateller to only play the tone if there is no callerid information available.

description.para: Generates special information tone to block telemarketers from calling you.
This application will set the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: ZAPATELLERSTATUS
variable.para: This will contain the last action accomplished by the Zapateller application. Possible values include:

application.name: Echo
application.synopsis: Echo media, DTMF back to the calling party

description.para: Echos back any media or DTMF frames read from the calling channel back to itself. This will not echo CONTROL, MODEM, or NULL frames. Note: If '#' detected application exits.
This application does not automatically answer and should be preceeded by an application such as Answer() or Progress().

application.name: ReadExten
application.synopsis: Read an extension into a variable.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.para: File to play before reading digits or tone with option i

parameter.name: context
parameter.para: Context in which to match extensions.

option.name: s
option.para: Return immediately if the channel is not answered.

option.name: i
option.para: Play filename as an indication tone from your indications.conf or a directly specified list of frequencies and durations.

option.name: n
option.para: Read digits even if the channel is not answered.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: An integer number of seconds to wait for a digit response. If greater than 0, that value will override the default timeout.

description.para: Reads a # terminated string of digits from the user into the given variable.
Will set READEXTENSTATUS on exit with one of the following statuses:

variable.name: READEXTENSTATUS
variable.value: A valid extension exists in ${variable}.
No extension was entered in the specified time. Also sets ${variable} to "t".
An invalid extension, ${INVALID_EXTEN}, was entered. Also sets ${variable} to "i".
Line was not up and the option 's' was specified.
Invalid arguments were passed.

application.name: Gosub
application.synopsis: Jump to label, saving return address.

description.para: Jumps to the label specified, saving the return address.

application.name: GosubIf
application.synopsis: Conditionally jump to label, saving return address.

argument.name: labeliftrue
argument.para: Continue at labeliftrue if the condition is true. Takes the form similar to Goto() of [[context,]extension,]priority.

argument.name: labeliffalse
argument.para: Continue at labeliffalse if the condition is false. Takes the form similar to Goto() of [[context,]extension,]priority.

description.para: If the condition is true, then jump to labeliftrue. If false, jumps to labeliffalse, if specified. In either case, a jump saves the return point in the dialplan, to be returned to with a Return.

parameter.name: value
parameter.para: Return value.

description.para: Jumps to the last label on the stack, removing it. The return value, if any, is saved in the channel variable GOSUB_RETVAL.

application.name: StackPop
application.synopsis: Remove one address from gosub stack.

description.para: Removes last label on the stack, discarding it.

function.name: LOCAL
function.synopsis: Manage variables local to the gosub stack frame.

description.para: Read and write a variable local to the gosub stack frame, once we Return() it will be lost (or it will go back to whatever value it had before the Gosub()).

function.name: LOCAL_PEEK
function.synopsis: Retrieve variables hidden by the local gosub stack frame.

description.para: Read a variable varname hidden by n levels of gosub stack frames. Note that ${LOCAL_PEEK(0,foo)} is the same as foo, since the value of n peeks under 0 levels of stack frames; in other words, 0 is the current level. If n exceeds the available number of stack frames, then an empty string is returned.

function.name: STACK_PEEK
function.synopsis: View info about the location which called Gosub

description.para: Read the calling context, extension, priority, or label, as specified by which, by going up n frames in the Gosub stack. If suppress is true, then if the number of available stack frames is exceeded, then no error message will be printed.

agi.name: gosub
agi.synopsis: Cause the channel to execute the specified dialplan subroutine.

description.para: Cause the channel to execute the specified dialplan subroutine, returning to the dialplan with execution of a Return().

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a variable local to the gosub stack frame is set due to a subroutine call.

parameter.name: Variable
parameter.para: The LOCAL variable being set.

note.para: The variable name will always be enclosed with LOCAL()

parameter.name: Value
parameter.para: The new value of the variable.

application.name: BridgeAdd
application.synopsis: Join a bridge that contains the specified channel.

parameter.name: name
parameter.para: Name of the channel in an existing bridge

description.para: This application places the incoming channel into the bridge containing the specified channel. The specified channel only needs to be the prefix of a full channel name IE. 'SIP/cisco0001'.

option.name: b
option.para: Play the busy greeting to the calling party.

option.name: d
option.para: Accept digits for a new extension in context c, if played during the greeting. Context defaults to the current context.

option.name: g
option.para: Use the specified amount of gain when recording the voicemail message. The units are whole-number decibels (dB). Only works on supported technologies, which is DAHDI only.

option.name: s
option.para: Skip the playback of instructions for leaving a message to the calling party.

option.name: u
option.para: Play the unavailable greeting.

option.name: U
option.para: Mark message as URGENT.

option.name: P
option.para: Mark message as PRIORITY.

description.para: This application allows the calling party to leave a message for the specified list of mailboxes. When multiple mailboxes are specified, the greeting will be taken from the first mailbox specified. Dialplan execution will stop if the specified mailbox does not exist.
The Voicemail application will exit if any of the following DTMF digits are received:

enum.para: Jump to the o extension in the current dialplan context.
Jump to the a extension in the current dialplan context.

description.para: This application will set the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: VMSTATUS
variable.para: This indicates the status of the execution of the VoiceMail application.

option.name: p
option.para: Consider the mailbox parameter as a prefix to the mailbox that is entered by the caller.

option.name: g
option.para: Use the specified amount of gain when recording a voicemail message. The units are whole-number decibels (dB).

option.name: s
option.para: Skip checking the passcode for the mailbox.

option.name: a
option.para: Skip folder prompt and go directly to folder specified. Defaults to INBOX (or 0).

description.para: This application allows the calling party to check voicemail messages. A specific mailbox, and optional corresponding context, may be specified. If a mailbox is not provided, the calling party will be prompted to enter one. If a context is not specified, the default context will be used.
The VoiceMailMain application will exit if the following DTMF digit is entered as Mailbox or Password, and the extension exists:

enum.para: Jump to the a extension in the current dialplan context.

parameter.name: options

note.para: DEPRECATED. Use VM_INFO(mailbox[@context],exists) instead.

This application will set the following channel variable upon completion:

If the mailbox is specified, only that mailbox's password will be considered valid. If the mailbox is not specified, the channel variable AUTH_MAILBOX will be set with the authenticated mailbox.
The VMAuthenticate application will exit if the following DTMF digit is entered as Mailbox or Password, and the extension exists:

enum.para: Jump to the a extension in the current dialplan context.

function.name: MAILBOX_EXISTS

note.para: DEPRECATED. Use VM_INFO(mailbox[@context],exists) instead.

description.para: Returns a boolean of whether the corresponding mailbox exists. If context is not specified, defaults to the default context.

function.name: VM_INFO
function.synopsis: Returns the selected attribute from a mailbox.

option.name: count
option.para: Count of messages in specified folder. If folder is not specified, defaults to INBOX.

option.name: email
option.para: E-mail address associated with the mailbox.

option.name: exists
option.para: Returns a boolean of whether the corresponding mailbox exists.

option.name: fullname
option.para: Full name associated with the mailbox.

option.name: language
option.para: Mailbox language if overridden, otherwise the language of the channel.

option.name: locale
option.para: Mailbox locale if overridden, otherwise global locale.

option.name: pager

option.name: password
option.para: Mailbox access password.

option.name: tz
option.para: Mailbox timezone if overridden, otherwise global timezone

parameter.name: folder
parameter.para: If not specified, INBOX is assumed.

description.para: Returns the selected attribute from the specified mailbox. If context is not specified, defaults to the default context. Where the folder can be specified, common folders include INBOX, Old, Work, Family and Friends.

manager.name: VoicemailRefresh
manager.synopsis: Tell Asterisk to poll mailboxes for a change

description.para: Normally, MWI indicators are only sent when Asterisk itself changes a mailbox. With external programs that modify the content of a mailbox from outside the application, an option exists called pollmailboxes that will cause voicemail to continually scan all mailboxes on a system for changes. This can cause a large amount of load on a system. This command allows external applications to signal when a particular mailbox has changed, thus permitting external applications to modify mailboxes and MWI to work without introducing considerable CPU load.

If Context is not specified, all mailboxes on the system will be polled for changes. If Context is specified, but Mailbox is omitted, then all mailboxes within Context will be polled. Otherwise, only a single mailbox will be polled for changes.

application.name: AlarmReceiver
application.synopsis: Provide support for receiving alarm reports from a burglar or fire alarm panel.

description.para: This application should be called whenever there is an alarm panel calling in to dump its events. The application will handshake with the alarm panel, and receive events, validate them, handshake them, and store them until the panel hangs up. Once the panel hangs up, the application will run the system command specified by the eventcmd setting in alarmreceiver.conf and pipe the events to the standard input of the application. The configuration file also contains settings for DTMF timing, and for the loudness of the acknowledgement tones.

note.para: Few Ademco DTMF signalling formats are detected automaticaly: Contact ID, Express 4+1, Express 4+2, High Speed and Super Fast.

description.para: The application is affected by the following variables:

variable.name: ALARMRECEIVER_CALL_LIMIT
variable.para: Maximum call time, in milliseconds.
If set, this variable causes application to exit after the specified time.

variable.name: ALARMRECEIVER_RETRIES_LIMIT
variable.para: Maximum number of retries per call.
If set, this variable causes application to exit after the specified number of messages.

application.name: MinivmRecord
application.synopsis: Receive Mini-Voicemail and forward via e-mail.

argument.name: username
argument.para: Voicemail username

argument.name: domain
argument.para: Voicemail domain

option.para: Jump to the o extension in the current dialplan context.
Jump to the a extension in the current dialplan context.

option.name: g

argument.name: gain
argument.para: Amount of gain to use

option.para: Use the specified amount of gain when recording the voicemail message. The units are whole-number decibels (dB).

description.para: This application is part of the Mini-Voicemail system, configured in minivm.conf
MiniVM records audio file in configured format and forwards message to e-mail and pager.
If there's no user account for that address, a temporary account will be used with default options.
The recorded file name and path will be stored in MVM_FILENAME and the duration of the message will be stored in MVM_DURATION

note.para: If the caller hangs up after the recording, the only way to send the message and clean up is to execute in the h extension. The application will exit if any of the following DTMF digits are received and the requested extension exist in the current context.

variable.name: MVM_RECORD_STATUS
variable.para: This is the status of the record operation

argument.para: Voicemail username

argument.name: domain

description.para: This application is part of the Mini-Voicemail system, configured in minivm.conf.
MinivmGreet() plays default prompts or user specific prompts for an account.
Busy and unavailable messages can be choosen, but will be overridden if a temporary message exists for the account.

variable.name: MVM_GREET_STATUS
variable.para: This is the status of the greeting playback.

application.name: MinivmNotify
application.synopsis: Notify voicemail owner about new messages.

argument.name: username
argument.para: Voicemail username

argument.name: domain
argument.para: Voicemail domain

option.name: template
option.para: E-mail template to use for voicemail notification

description.para: This application is part of the Mini-Voicemail system, configured in minivm.conf.
MiniVMnotify forwards messages about new voicemail to e-mail and pager. If there's no user account for that address, a temporary account will be used with default options (set in minivm.conf).
If the channel variable MVM_COUNTER is set, this will be used in the message file name and available in the template for the message.
If no template is given, the default email template will be used to send email and default pager template to send paging message (if the user account is configured with a paging address.

variable.name: MVM_NOTIFY_STATUS
variable.para: This is the status of the notification attempt

parameter.name: filename
parameter.para: File to delete

description.para: This application is part of the Mini-Voicemail system, configured in minivm.conf.
It deletes voicemail file set in MVM_FILENAME or given filename.

variable.name: MVM_DELETE_STATUS
variable.para: This is the status of the delete operation.

argument.name: username
argument.para: Voicemail username

argument.name: domain
argument.para: Voicemail domain

option.name: u
option.para: Record the unavailable greeting.

option.name: b
option.para: Record the busy greeting.

option.name: t
option.para: Record the temporary greeting.

option.name: n
option.para: Account name.

description.para: This application is part of the Mini-Voicemail system, configured in minivm.conf.
Use this application to record account specific audio/video messages for busy, unavailable and temporary messages.
Account specific directories will be created if they do not exist.

variable.name: MVM_ACCMESS_STATUS
variable.para: This is the result of the attempt to record the specified greeting.
FAILED is set if the file can't be created.

application.name: MinivmMWI
application.synopsis: Send Message Waiting Notification to subscriber(s) of mailbox.

argument.name: username

argument.name: domain
argument.para: Voicemail domain

parameter.name: urgent

parameter.name: new

parameter.name: old
parameter.para: Number of old messages in mailbox.

description.para: This application is part of the Mini-Voicemail system, configured in minivm.conf.
MinivmMWI is used to send message waiting indication to any devices whose channels have subscribed to the mailbox passed in the first parameter.

function.name: MINIVMCOUNTER
function.synopsis: Reads or sets counters for MiniVoicemail message.

parameter.name: account
parameter.para: If account is given and it exists, the counter is specific for the account.
If account is a domain and the domain directory exists, counters are specific for a domain.

parameter.name: name
parameter.para: The name of the counter is a string, up to 10 characters.

parameter.name: operand
parameter.para: The counters never goes below zero. Valid operands for changing the value of a counter when assigning a value are:

description.para: The operation is atomic and the counter is locked while changing the value. The counters are stored as text files in the minivm account directories. It might be better to use realtime functions if you are using a database to operate your Asterisk.

function.name: MINIVMACCOUNT
function.synopsis: Gets MiniVoicemail account information.

parameter.name: item
parameter.para: Valid items are:

enum.name: path
enum.para: Path to account mailbox (if account exists, otherwise temporary mailbox).

enum.name: hasaccount
enum.para: 1 is static Minivm account exists, 0 otherwise.

enum.name: etemplate
enum.para: Email template for account (default template if none is configured).

enum.name: ptemplate
enum.para: Pager template for account (default template if none is configured).

enum.name: accountcode
enum.para: Account code for the voicemail account.

enum.name: <channel variable name>
enum.para: Channel variable value (set in configuration for account).

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a notification is sent out by a MiniVoiceMail application

parameter.name: Action
parameter.para: What action was taken. Currently, this will always be SentNotification

parameter.name: Mailbox
parameter.para: The mailbox that the notification was about, specified as mailbox@context

parameter.name: Counter
parameter.para: A message counter derived from the MVM_COUNTER channel variable.

parameter.name: args
parameter.para: A list of parameters to pass to the pppd daemon, separated by , characters.

description.para: Executes a RAS server using pppd on the given channel. The channel must be a clear channel (i.e. PRI source) and a DAHDI channel to be able to use this function (No modem emulation is included).
Your pppd must be patched to be DAHDI aware.
Perform test server function and write call report. Results stored in /var/log/asterisk/testreports/<testid>-server.txt

parameter.name: testid
parameter.para: An ID to identify this test.

description.para: Executes test client with given testid. Results stored in /var/log/asterisk/testreports/<testid>-client.txt
This is a skeleton application that shows you the basic structure to create your own asterisk applications and demonstrates the IVR demo.

application.name: ExternalIVR
application.synopsis: Interfaces with an external IVR application.

option.name: n
option.para: Tells ExternalIVR() not to answer the channel.

option.name: i
option.para: Tells ExternalIVR() not to send a hangup and exit when the channel receives a hangup, instead it sends an I informative message meaning that the external application MUST hang up the call with an H command.

option.name: d
option.para: Tells ExternalIVR() to run on a channel that has been hung up and will not look for hangups. The external application must exit with an E command.

description.para: Either forks a process to run given command or makes a socket to connect to given host and starts a generator on the channel. The generator's play list is controlled by the external application, which can add and clear entries via simple commands issued over its stdout. The external application will receive all DTMF events received on the channel, and notification if the channel is hung up. The received on the channel, and notification if the channel is hung up. The application will not be forcibly terminated when the channel is hung up. For more information see doc/AST.pdf.

option.name: s
option.para: silent login - do not announce the login ok segment after agent logged on.

description.para: Login an agent to the system. Any agent authentication is assumed to already be done by dialplan. While logged in, the agent can receive calls and will hear the sound file specified by the config option custom_beep when a new call comes in for the agent. Login failures will continue in the dialplan with AGENT_STATUS set.

Before logging in, you can setup on the real agent channel the CHANNEL(dtmf_features) an agent will have when talking to a caller and you can setup on the channel running this application the CONNECTEDLINE() information the agent will see while waiting for a caller.
AGENT_STATUS enumeration values:

enum.name: ALREADY_LOGGED_IN
enum.para: The agent is already logged in.

note.para: The Agent:AgentId device state is available to monitor the status of the agent.

application.name: AgentRequest
application.synopsis: Request an agent to connect with the channel.

description.para: Request an agent to connect with the channel. Failure to find, alert the agent, or acknowledge the call will continue in the dialplan with AGENT_STATUS set.
AGENT_STATUS enumeration values:

enum.name: BUSY
enum.para: The agent is on another call.

enum.name: NOT_CONNECTED
enum.para: The agent did not connect with the call. The agent most likely did not acknowledge the call.

function.name: AGENT
function.synopsis: Gets information about an Agent

parameter.name: item
parameter.para: The valid items to retrieve are:

enum.name: status
enum.para: (default) The status of the agent (LOGGEDIN | LOGGEDOUT)

enum.name: password
enum.para: Deprecated. The dialplan handles any agent authentication.

enum.name: channel
enum.para: The name of the active channel for the Agent (AgentLogin)

enum.name: fullchannel
enum.para: The untruncated name of the active channel for the Agent (AgentLogin)

description.para: Will list info about all defined agents.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Response event in a series to the Agents AMI action containing information about a defined agent.

parameter.name: Agent
parameter.para: Agent ID of the agent.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.para: User friendly name of the agent.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.para: Current status of the agent.
The valid values are:

parameter.name: TalkingToChan
parameter.para: BRIDGEPEER value on agent channel.
Present if Status value is AGENT_ONCALL.

parameter.name: CallStarted
parameter.para: Epoche time when the agent started talking with the caller.
Present if Status value is AGENT_ONCALL.

parameter.name: LoggedInTime
parameter.para: Epoche time when the agent logged in.
Present if Status value is AGENT_IDLE or AGENT_ONCALL.

description.para: The channel snapshot is present if the Status value is AGENT_IDLE or AGENT_ONCALL.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Final response event in a series of events to the Agents AMI action.

manager.name: AgentLogoff
manager.synopsis: Sets an agent as no longer logged in.

parameter.name: Agent
parameter.para: Agent ID of the agent to log off.

parameter.name: Soft
parameter.para: Set to true to not hangup existing calls.

description.para: Sets an agent as no longer logged in.

note.para: Option changes take effect on agent login or after an agent disconnects from a call.

configObject.name: agent-id
configObject.synopsis: Configure an agent for the pool.

configOption.name: ackcall
configOption.synopsis: Enable to require the agent to acknowledge a call.

description.para: Enable to require the agent to give a DTMF acknowledgement when the agent receives a call.

note.para: The option is overridden by AGENTACKCALL on agent login.

configOption.name: acceptdtmf
configOption.synopsis: DTMF key sequence the agent uses to acknowledge a call.

note.para: The option is overridden by AGENTACCEPTDTMF on agent login.
The option is ignored unless the ackcall option is enabled.

configOption.name: autologoff
configOption.synopsis: Time the agent has to acknowledge a call before being logged off.

description.para: Set how many seconds a call for the agent has to wait for the agent to acknowledge the call before the agent is automatically logged off. If set to zero then the call will wait forever for the agent to acknowledge.

note.para: The option is overridden by AGENTAUTOLOGOFF on agent login.
The option is ignored unless the ackcall option is enabled.

configOption.name: wrapuptime
configOption.synopsis: Minimum time the agent has between calls.

description.para: Set the minimum amount of time in milliseconds after disconnecting a call before the agent can receive a new call.

note.para: The option is overridden by AGENTWRAPUPTIME on agent login.

configOption.name: musiconhold
configOption.synopsis: Music on hold class the agent listens to between calls.

configOption.name: recordagentcalls
configOption.synopsis: Enable to automatically record calls the agent takes.

description.para: Enable recording calls the agent takes automatically by invoking the automixmon DTMF feature when the agent connects to a caller. See features.conf.sample for information about the automixmon feature.

configOption.name: custom_beep
configOption.synopsis: Sound file played to alert the agent when a call is present.

configOption.name: fullname
configOption.synopsis: A friendly name for the agent used in log messages.

parameter.name: arg
parameter.para: Arg is either the tone name defined in the indications.conf configuration file, or a directly specified list of frequencies and durations.

description.para: Plays a tone list. Execution will continue with the next step in the dialplan immediately while the tones continue to play.
See the sample indications.conf for a description of the specification of a tonelist.
Stop playing a tone list, initiated by PlayTones().

application.name: SayCountedNoun
application.synopsis: Say a noun in declined form in order to count things

parameter.name: number
parameter.para: The number of things

parameter.name: filename
parameter.para: File name stem for the noun that is the name of the things

description.para: Selects and plays the proper singular or plural form of a noun when saying things such as "five calls". English has simple rules for deciding when to say "call" and when to say "calls", but other languages have complicated rules which would be extremely difficult to implement in the Asterisk dialplan language.

The correct sound file is selected by examining the number and adding the appropriate suffix to filename. If the channel language is English, then the suffix will be either empty or "s". If the channel language is Russian or some other Slavic language, then the suffix will be empty for nominative, "x1" for genative singular, and "x2" for genative plural.

Note that combining filename with a suffix will not necessarily produce a correctly spelled plural form. For example, SayCountedNoun(2,man) will play the sound file "mans" rather than "men". This behavior is intentional. Since the file name is never seen by the end user, there is no need to implement complicated spelling rules. We simply record the word "men" in the sound file named "mans".
This application does not automatically answer and should be preceeded by an application such as Answer() or Progress.

application.name: SayCountedAdj
application.synopsis: Say a adjective in declined form in order to count things

parameter.name: number
parameter.para: The number of things

parameter.name: filename
parameter.para: File name stem for the adjective

parameter.name: gender
parameter.para: The gender of the noun modified, one of 'm', 'f', 'n', or 'c'

description.para: Selects and plays the proper form of an adjective according to the gender and of the noun which it modifies and the number of objects named by the noun-verb combination which have been counted. Used when saying things such as "5 new messages". The various singular and plural forms of the adjective are selected by adding suffixes to filename.

If the channel language is English, then no suffix will ever be added (since, in English, adjectives are not declined). If the channel language is Russian or some other slavic language, then the suffix will the specified gender for nominative, and "x" for genative plural. (The genative singular is not used when counting things.) For example, SayCountedAdj(1,new,f) will play sound file "newa" (containing the word "novaya"), but SayCountedAdj(5,new,f) will play sound file "newx" (containing the word "novikh").
This application does not automatically answer and should be preceeded by an application such as Answer(), Progress(), or Proceeding().

application.name: ControlPlayback
application.synopsis: Play a file with fast forward and rewind.

parameter.name: skipms
parameter.para: This is number of milliseconds to skip when rewinding or fast-forwarding.

parameter.name: ff
parameter.para: Fast-forward when this DTMF digit is received. (defaults to #)

parameter.name: rew
parameter.para: Rewind when this DTMF digit is received. (defaults to *)

parameter.name: stop
parameter.para: Stop playback when this DTMF digit is received.

parameter.name: pause
parameter.para: Pause playback when this DTMF digit is received.

parameter.name: restart
parameter.para: Restart playback when this DTMF digit is received.

argument.name: time
argument.para: Start at time ms from the beginning of the file.

description.para: This application will play back the given filename.
It sets the following channel variables upon completion:

variable.name: CPLAYBACKSTATUS
variable.para: Contains the status of the attempt as a text string

variable.name: CPLAYBACKOFFSET
variable.para: Contains the offset in ms into the file where playback was at when it stopped. -1 is end of file.

variable.name: CPLAYBACKSTOPKEY
variable.para: If the playback is stopped by the user this variable contains the key that was pressed.

manager.name: ControlPlayback
manager.synopsis: Control the playback of a file being played to a channel.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: The name of the channel that currently has a file being played back to it.

enum.name: forward
enum.para: Move the current position in the media forward. The amount of time that the stream moves forward is determined by the skipms value passed to the application that initiated the playback.

note.para: The default skipms value is 3000 ms.

enum.name: reverse
enum.para: Move the current position in the media backward. The amount of time that the stream moves backward is determined by the skipms value passed to the application that initiated the playback.

note.para: The default skipms value is 3000 ms.

enum.name: pause
enum.para: Pause/unpause the playback operation, if supported. If not supported, stop the playback.

enum.name: restart
enum.para: Restart the playback operation, if supported. If not supported, stop the playback.

description.para: Control the operation of a media file being played back to a channel. Note that this AMI action does not initiate playback of media to channel, but rather controls the operation of a media operation that was already initiated on the channel.

note.para: The pause and restart Control options will stop a playback operation if that operation was not initiated from the ControlPlayback application or the control stream file AGI command.

option.name: c
option.para: The computer should cheat

option.name: n
option.para: How many games to play before hanging up

description.para: This simple number guessing application is a template to build other applications from. It shows you the basic structure to create your own Asterisk applications.

configObject.name: globals
configObject.synopsis: Options that apply globally to app_skel

configOption.name: games
configOption.synopsis: The number of games a single execution of SkelGuessNumber will play

configOption.name: cheat
configOption.synopsis: Should the computer cheat?

description.para: If enabled, the computer will ignore winning guesses.

configOption.name: prompt
configOption.synopsis: A prompt directing the user to enter a number less than the max number

configOption.name: wrong_guess
configOption.synopsis: The sound file to play when a wrong guess is made

configOption.name: right_guess
configOption.synopsis: The sound file to play when a correct guess is made

configOption.name: too_low
configOption.synopsis: The sound file to play when a guess is too low

configOption.name: too_high
configOption.synopsis: The sound file to play when a guess is too high

configOption.name: lose
configOption.synopsis: The sound file to play when a player loses

configObject.name: level
configObject.synopsis: Defined levels for the SkelGuessNumber game

configOption.name: max_number
configOption.synopsis: The maximum in the range of numbers to guess (1 is the implied minimum)

configOption.name: max_guesses
