configOption.synopsis: The maximum number of guesses before a game is considered lost

application.name: MP3Player
application.synopsis: Play an MP3 file or M3U playlist file or stream.

parameter.name: Location
parameter.para: Location of the file to be played. (argument passed to mpg123)

description.para: Executes mpg123 to play the given location, which typically would be a mp3 filename or m3u playlist filename or a URL. Please read http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M3U to see how M3U playlist file format is like, Example usage would be exten => 1234,1,MP3Player(/var/lib/asterisk/playlist.m3u) User can exit by pressing any key on the dialpad, or by hanging up.
This application does not automatically answer and should be preceeded by an application such as Answer() or Progress().

application.name: DumpChan
application.synopsis: Dump Info About The Calling Channel.

parameter.name: level
parameter.para: Minimum verbose level

description.para: Displays information on channel and listing of all channel variables. If level is specified, output is only displayed when the verbose level is currently set to that number or greater.

argument.name: name
argument.para: Connect to the specified jack server name

argument.name: name
argument.para: Connect the output port that gets created to the specified jack input port

argument.name: name
argument.para: Connect the input port that gets created to the specified jack output port

argument.name: name
argument.para: By default, Asterisk will use the channel name for the jack client name.
Use this option to specify a custom client name.

application.name: CELGenUserEvent
application.synopsis: Generates a CEL User Defined Event.

argument.name: extra
argument.para: Extra text to be included with the event.

description.para: A CEL event will be immediately generated by this channel, with the supplied name for a type.

parameter.name: Technology/Resource

argument.name: Technology2/Resource2
argument.para: Optional extra devices to check
If you need more than one enter them as Technology2/Resource2&Technology3/Resource3&.....

parameter.para: Specification of the device(s) to check. These must be in the format of Technology/Resource, where Technology represents a particular channel driver, and Resource represents a resource available to that particular channel driver.

option.name: a
option.para: Check for all available channels, not only the first one

option.name: s
option.para: Consider the channel unavailable if the channel is in use at all

option.name: t
option.para: Simply checks if specified channels exist in the channel list

description.para: This application will check to see if any of the specified channels are available.
This application sets the following channel variables:

variable.name: AVAILCHAN
variable.para: The name of the available channel, if one exists

variable.name: AVAILORIGCHAN
variable.para: The canonical channel name that was used to create the channel

variable.name: AVAILSTATUS
variable.para: The device state for the device

variable.name: AVAILCAUSECODE
variable.para: The cause code returned when requesting the channel

application.name: StatsD
application.synopsis: Allow statistics to be passed to the StatsD server from the dialplan.

parameter.name: metric_type
parameter.para: The metric type to be sent to StatsD. Valid metric types are 'g' for gauge, 'c' for counter, 'ms' for timer, and 's' for sets.

parameter.name: statistic_name
parameter.para: The name of the variable to be sent to StatsD. Statistic names cannot contain the pipe (|) character.

parameter.name: value
parameter.para: The value of the variable to be sent to StatsD. Values must be numeric. Values for gauge and counter metrics can be sent with a '+' or '-' to update a value after the value has been initialized. Only counters can be initialized as negative. Sets can send a string as the value parameter, but the string cannot contain the pipe character.

parameter.name: sample_rate
parameter.para: The value of the sample rate to be sent to StatsD. Sample rates less than or equal to 0 will never be sent and sample rates greater than or equal to 1 will always be sent. Any rate between 1 and 0 will be compared to a randomly generated value, and if it is greater than the random value, it will be sent.

description.para: This dialplan application sends statistics to the StatsD server specified inside of statsd.conf.

application.name: Dial
application.synopsis: Attempt to connect to another device or endpoint and bridge the call.

argument.name: Technology/Resource
argument.para: Specification of the device(s) to dial. These must be in the format of Technology/Resource, where Technology represents a particular channel driver, and Resource represents a resource available to that particular channel driver.

argument.name: Technology2/Resource2
argument.para: Optional extra devices to dial in parallel
If you need more than one enter them as Technology2/Resource2&Technology3/Resource3&.....

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: Specifies the number of seconds we attempt to dial the specified devices.
If not specified, this defaults to 136 years.

option.name: A

argument.name: x
argument.para: The file to play to the called party

option.para: Play an announcement to the called party, where x is the prompt to be played

option.name: a
option.para: Immediately answer the calling channel when the called channel answers in all cases. Normally, the calling channel is answered when the called channel answers, but when options such as A() and M() are used, the calling channel is not answered until all actions on the called channel (such as playing an announcement) are completed. This option can be used to answer the calling channel before doing anything on the called channel. You will rarely need to use this option, the default behavior is adequate in most cases.

option.name: b
option.para: Before initiating an outgoing call, Gosub to the specified location using the newly created channel. The Gosub will be executed for each destination channel.

option.name: B
option.para: Before initiating the outgoing call(s), Gosub to the specified location using the current channel.

option.name: C
option.para: Reset the call detail record (CDR) for this call.

option.name: c
option.para: If the Dial() application cancels this call, always set HANGUPCAUSE to 'answered elsewhere'

option.name: d
option.para: Allow the calling user to dial a 1 digit extension while waiting for a call to be answered. Exit to that extension if it exists in the current context, or the context defined in the EXITCONTEXT variable, if it exists.

note.para: Many SIP and ISDN phones cannot send DTMF digits until the call is connected. If you wish to use this option with these phones, you can use the Answer application before dialing.

option.name: D
option.para: Send the specified DTMF strings after the called party has answered, but before the call gets bridged. The called DTMF string is sent to the called party, and the calling DTMF string is sent to the calling party. Both arguments can be used alone. If progress is specified, its DTMF is sent to the called party immediately after receiving a PROGRESS message.
See SendDTMF for valid digits.

option.name: e
option.para: Execute the h extension for peer after the call ends

option.name: f
option.para: If x is not provided, force the CallerID sent on a call-forward or deflection to the dialplan extension of this Dial() using a dialplan hint. For example, some PSTNs do not allow CallerID to be set to anything other than the numbers assigned to you. If x is provided, force the CallerID sent to x.

option.name: F
option.para: When the caller hangs up, transfer the called party to the specified destination and start execution at that location.

note.para: Any channel variables you want the called channel to inherit from the caller channel must be prefixed with one or two underbars ('_').

option.name: F
option.para: When the caller hangs up, transfer the called party to the next priority of the current extension and start execution at that location.

note.para: Any channel variables you want the called channel to inherit from the caller channel must be prefixed with one or two underbars ('_').
Using this option from a Macro() or GoSub() might not make sense as there would be no return points.

option.name: g
option.para: Proceed with dialplan execution at the next priority in the current extension if the destination channel hangs up.

option.name: G
option.para: If the call is answered, transfer the calling party to the specified priority and the called party to the specified priority plus one.

note.para: You cannot use any additional action post answer options in conjunction with this option.

option.name: h
option.para: Allow the called party to hang up by sending the DTMF sequence defined for disconnect in features.conf.

option.name: H
option.para: Allow the calling party to hang up by sending the DTMF sequence defined for disconnect in features.conf.

note.para: Many SIP and ISDN phones cannot send DTMF digits until the call is connected. If you wish to allow DTMF disconnect before the dialed party answers with these phones, you can use the Answer application before dialing.

option.name: i
option.para: Asterisk will ignore any forwarding requests it may receive on this dial attempt.

option.name: I
option.para: Asterisk will ignore any connected line update requests or any redirecting party update requests it may receive on this dial attempt.

option.name: k
option.para: Allow the called party to enable parking of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for call parking in features.conf.

option.name: K
option.para: Allow the calling party to enable parking of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for call parking in features.conf.

option.name: L

argument.name: x
argument.para: Maximum call time, in milliseconds

argument.name: y
argument.para: Warning time, in milliseconds

argument.name: z
argument.para: Repeat time, in milliseconds

option.para: Limit the call to x milliseconds. Play a warning when y milliseconds are left. Repeat the warning every z milliseconds until time expires.
This option is affected by the following variables:

variable.name: LIMIT_PLAYAUDIO_CALLER
variable.para: If set, this variable causes Asterisk to play the prompts to the caller.

variable.name: LIMIT_PLAYAUDIO_CALLEE
variable.para: If set, this variable causes Asterisk to play the prompts to the callee.

variable.name: LIMIT_TIMEOUT_FILE
variable.para: If specified, filename specifies the sound prompt to play when the timeout is reached. If not set, the time remaining will be announced.

variable.name: LIMIT_CONNECT_FILE
variable.para: If specified, filename specifies the sound prompt to play when the call begins. If not set, the time remaining will be announced.

variable.name: LIMIT_WARNING_FILE
variable.para: If specified, filename specifies the sound prompt to play as a warning when time x is reached. If not set, the time remaining will be announced.

option.name: m
option.para: Provide hold music to the calling party until a requested channel answers. A specific music on hold class (as defined in musiconhold.conf) can be specified.

option.name: M

argument.name: macro
argument.para: Name of the macro that should be executed.

argument.name: arg
argument.para: Macro arguments

option.para: Execute the specified macro for the called channel before connecting to the calling channel. Arguments can be specified to the Macro using ^ as a delimiter. The macro can set the variable MACRO_RESULT to specify the following actions after the macro is finished executing:

variable.name: MACRO_RESULT
variable.para: If set, this action will be taken after the macro finished executing.
variable.value: Hangup both legs of the call
Behave as if line congestion was encountered
Behave as if a busy signal was encountered
Hangup the called party and allow the calling party to continue dialplan execution at the next priority
Transfer the call to the specified destination.

note.para: You cannot use any additional action post answer options in conjunction with this option. Also, pbx services are run on the peer (called) channel, so you will not be able to set timeouts via the TIMEOUT() function in this macro.

warning.para: Be aware of the limitations that macros have, specifically with regards to use of the WaitExten application. For more information, see the documentation for Macro().

option.name: n

argument.name: delete
argument.para: With delete either not specified or set to 0, the recorded introduction will not be deleted if the caller hangs up while the remote party has not yet answered.
With delete set to 1, the introduction will always be deleted.

option.para: This option is a modifier for the call screening/privacy mode. (See the p and P options.) It specifies that no introductions are to be saved in the priv-callerintros directory.

option.name: N
option.para: This option is a modifier for the call screening/privacy mode. It specifies that if CallerID is present, do not screen the call.

option.name: o
option.para: If x is not provided, specify that the CallerID that was present on the calling channel be stored as the CallerID on the called channel. This was the behavior of Asterisk 1.0 and earlier. If x is provided, specify the CallerID stored on the called channel. Note that o(${CALLERID(all)}) is similar to option o without the parameter.

option.name: O

argument.name: mode
argument.para: With mode either not specified or set to 1, the originator hanging up will cause the phone to ring back immediately.
With mode set to 2, when the operator flashes the trunk, it will ring their phone back.

option.para: Enables operator services mode. This option only works when bridging a DAHDI channel to another DAHDI channel only. if specified on non-DAHDI interfaces, it will be ignored. When the destination answers (presumably an operator services station), the originator no longer has control of their line. They may hang up, but the switch will not release their line until the destination party (the operator) hangs up.

option.name: p
option.para: This option enables screening mode. This is basically Privacy mode without memory.

option.name: P
option.para: Enable privacy mode. Use x as the family/key in the AstDB database if it is provided. The current extension is used if a database family/key is not specified.

option.name: Q
option.para: Specify the Q.850/Q.931 cause to send on unanswered channels when another channel answers the call. As with Hangup(), cause can be a numeric cause code or a name such as NO_ANSWER, USER_BUSY, CALL_REJECTED or ANSWERED_ELSEWHERE (the default if Q isn't specified). You can also specify 0 or NONE to send no cause. See the causes.h file for the full list of valid causes and names.

note.para: chan_sip does not support setting the cause on a CANCEL to anything other than ANSWERED_ELSEWHERE.

option.name: r
option.para: Default: Indicate ringing to the calling party, even if the called party isn't actually ringing. Pass no audio to the calling party until the called channel has answered.

argument.name: tone
argument.para: Indicate progress to calling party. Send audio 'tone' from the indications.conf tonezone currently in use.

option.name: R
option.para: Default: Indicate ringing to the calling party, even if the called party isn't actually ringing. Allow interruption of the ringback if early media is received on the channel.

option.name: S
option.para: Hang up the call x seconds after the called party has answered the call.

option.name: s
option.para: Force the outgoing CallerID tag parameter to be set to the string x.
Works with the f option.

option.name: t
option.para: Allow the called party to transfer the calling party by sending the DTMF sequence defined in features.conf. This setting does not perform policy enforcement on transfers initiated by other methods.

option.name: T
option.para: Allow the calling party to transfer the called party by sending the DTMF sequence defined in features.conf. This setting does not perform policy enforcement on transfers initiated by other methods.

option.name: U

argument.name: x
argument.para: Name of the subroutine to execute via Gosub

argument.name: arg
argument.para: Arguments for the Gosub routine

option.para: Execute via Gosub the routine x for the called channel before connecting to the calling channel. Arguments can be specified to the Gosub using ^ as a delimiter. The Gosub routine can set the variable GOSUB_RESULT to specify the following actions after the Gosub returns.

variable.name: GOSUB_RESULT
variable.value: Hangup both legs of the call.
Behave as if line congestion was encountered.
Behave as if a busy signal was encountered.
Hangup the called party and allow the calling party to continue dialplan execution at the next priority.
Transfer the call to the specified destination.

note.para: You cannot use any additional action post answer options in conjunction with this option. Also, pbx services are run on the peer (called) channel, so you will not be able to set timeouts via the TIMEOUT() function in this routine.

option.name: u

argument.name: x
argument.para: Force the outgoing callerid presentation indicator parameter to be set to one of the values passed in x: allowed_not_screened allowed_passed_screen allowed_failed_screen allowed prohib_not_screened prohib_passed_screen prohib_failed_screen prohib unavailable

option.para: Works with the f option.

option.name: w
option.para: Allow the called party to enable recording of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for one-touch recording in features.conf.

option.name: W
option.para: Allow the calling party to enable recording of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for one-touch recording in features.conf.

option.name: x
option.para: Allow the called party to enable recording of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for one-touch automixmonitor in features.conf.

option.name: X
option.para: Allow the calling party to enable recording of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for one-touch automixmonitor in features.conf.

option.name: z
option.para: On a call forward, cancel any dial timeout which has been set for this call.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.para: The optional URL will be sent to the called party if the channel driver supports it.

description.para: This application will place calls to one or more specified channels. As soon as one of the requested channels answers, the originating channel will be answered, if it has not already been answered. These two channels will then be active in a bridged call. All other channels that were requested will then be hung up.

Unless there is a timeout specified, the Dial application will wait indefinitely until one of the called channels answers, the user hangs up, or if all of the called channels are busy or unavailable. Dialplan execution will continue if no requested channels can be called, or if the timeout expires. This application will report normal termination if the originating channel hangs up, or if the call is bridged and either of the parties in the bridge ends the call.

If the OUTBOUND_GROUP variable is set, all peer channels created by this application will be put into that group (as in Set(GROUP()=...). If the OUTBOUND_GROUP_ONCE variable is set, all peer channels created by this application will be put into that group (as in Set(GROUP()=...). Unlike OUTBOUND_GROUP, however, the variable will be unset after use.
description.example: same => n,Dial(PJSIP/alice,,g) same => n,Log(NOTICE, Alice call result: ${DIALSTATUS})

example.title: Dial with transfer/recording features for calling party
Dial alice and bob and send NO_ANSWER to bob instead of ANSWERED_ELSEWHERE when alice answers

description.example:
[default]
exten => callee_channel,1,NoOp() same => n,Log(NOTICE, I'm called on channel ${CHANNEL} prior to it starting the dial attempt) same => n,Return()
exten => called_channel,1,NoOp() same => n,Log(NOTICE, I'm called on outbound channel ${CHANNEL} prior to it being used to dial someone) same => n,Return()
exten => _X.,1,NoOp() same => n,Dial(PJSIP/alice,,b(default^called_channel^1)B(default^callee_channel^1)) same => n,Hangup()

example.title: Dial with post-answer subroutine executed on outbound channel

description.example:
[default]
exten => called_channel,1,NoOp() same => n,Playback(hello) same => n,Return()
exten => _X.,1,NoOp() same => n,Dial(PJSIP/alice,,U(default^called_channel^1)) same => n,Hangup()
same => n,Dial(PJSIP/alice,,G(jump_to_here)) same => n(jump_to_here),Goto(confbridge) same => n,Goto(confbridge) same => n(confbridge),ConfBridge(${EXTEN})
description.para: This application sets the following channel variables:

variable.name: DIALEDTIME
variable.para: This is the time from dialing a channel until when it is disconnected.

variable.name: ANSWEREDTIME
variable.para: This is the amount of time for actual call.

variable.name: DIALEDPEERNAME
variable.para: The name of the outbound channel that answered the call.

variable.name: DIALEDPEERNUMBER
variable.para: The number that was dialed for the answered outbound channel.

variable.name: FORWARDERNAME
variable.para: If a call forward occurred, the name of the forwarded channel.

variable.name: DIALSTATUS
variable.para: This is the status of the call
variable.value: For the Privacy and Screening Modes. Will be set if the called party chooses to send the calling party to the 'Go Away' script.
For the Privacy and Screening Modes. Will be set if the called party chooses to send the calling party to the 'torture' script.

application.name: RetryDial
application.synopsis: Place a call, retrying on failure allowing an optional exit extension.

parameter.name: announce
parameter.para: Filename of sound that will be played when no channel can be reached

parameter.name: sleep
parameter.para: Number of seconds to wait after a dial attempt failed before a new attempt is made

parameter.name: retries
parameter.para: Number of retries
When this is reached flow will continue at the next priority in the dialplan

parameter.name: dialargs
parameter.para: Same format as arguments provided to the Dial application

description.para: This application will attempt to place a call using the normal Dial application. If no channel can be reached, the announce file will be played. Then, it will wait sleep number of seconds before retrying the call. After retries number of attempts, the calling channel will continue at the next priority in the dialplan. If the retries setting is set to 0, this application will retry endlessly. While waiting to retry a call, a 1 digit extension may be dialed. If that extension exists in either the context defined in EXITCONTEXT or the current one, The call will jump to that extension immediately. The dialargs are specified in the same format that arguments are provided to the Dial application.

application.name: SayUnixTime
application.synopsis: Says a specified time in a custom format.

parameter.name: unixtime
parameter.para: time, in seconds since Jan 1, 1970. May be negative. Defaults to now.

parameter.name: timezone
parameter.para: timezone, see /usr/share/zoneinfo for a list. Defaults to machine default.

parameter.name: format
parameter.para: a format the time is to be said in. See voicemail.conf. Defaults to ABdY "digits/at" IMp

option.name: j
option.para: Allow the calling user to dial digits to jump to that extension. This option is automatically enabled if SAY_DTMF_INTERRUPT is present on the channel and set to 'true' (case insensitive)

description.para: Uses some of the sound files stored in /var/lib/asterisk/sounds to construct a phrase saying the specified date and/or time in the specified format.

application.name: DateTime
application.synopsis: Says a specified time in a custom format.

parameter.name: unixtime
parameter.para: time, in seconds since Jan 1, 1970. May be negative. Defaults to now.

parameter.name: timezone
parameter.para: timezone, see /usr/share/zoneinfo for a list. Defaults to machine default.

parameter.name: format
parameter.para: a format the time is to be said in. See voicemail.conf. Defaults to ABdY "digits/at" IMp

description.para: Say the date and time in a specified format.

application.name: SendText
application.synopsis: Send a Text Message on a channel.

description.para: Sends text to the current channel.

note.para: current channel could be the caller or callee depending on the context in which this application is called.

description.para: The following variables can be set:

variable.name: SENDTEXT_FROM_DISPLAYNAME
variable.para: If set and this channel supports enhanced messaging, this value will be used as the From display name.

variable.name: SENDTEXT_TO_DISPLAYNAME
variable.para: If set and this channel supports enhanced messaging, this value will be used as the To display name.

variable.name: SENDTEXT_CONTENT_TYPE
variable.para: If set and this channel supports enhanced messaging, this value will be used as the message Content-Type. If not specified, the default of text/plain will be used.

Warning: Messages of types other than text/* cannot be sent via channel drivers that do not support Enhanced Messaging. An attempt to do so will be ignored and will result in the SENDTEXTSTATUS variable being set to UNSUPPORTED.

variable.name: SENDTEXT_BODY
variable.para: If set this value will be used as the message body and any text supplied as a function parameter will be ignored.

description.para: Result of transmission will be stored in the following variables:

variable.name: SENDTEXTTYPE
variable.value: No message sent.
Message body sent without attributes because the channel driver doesn't support enhanced messaging.
The message was sent using enhanced messaging.

variable.name: SENDTEXTSTATUS
variable.value: Transmission succeeded.
Transmission failed.
Text transmission not supported by channel.

note.para: The text encoding and transmission method is completely at the discretion of the channel driver. chan_pjsip will use in-dialog SIP MESSAGE messages always. chan_sip will use T.140 via RTP if a text media type was negotiated and in-dialog SIP MESSAGE messages otherwise.

description.para: Examples:
If the channel driver supports enhanced messaging (currently only chan_pjsip), you can set additional variables:
description.example: same => n,Set(SENDTEXT_FROM_DISPLAYNAME=Really From Bob) same => n,SendText(Your Text Here)
same => n,Set(SENDTEXT_CONTENT_TYPE=text/json) same => n,Set(SENDTEXT_BODY={"foo":a, "bar":23}) same => n,SendText()

argument.name: format
argument.para: Is the format of the file type to be recorded (wav, gsm, etc).

parameter.name: silence
parameter.para: Is the number of seconds of silence to allow before returning.

parameter.name: maxduration
parameter.para: Is the maximum recording duration in seconds. If missing or 0 there is no maximum.

option.name: a
option.para: Append to existing recording rather than replacing.

option.name: n
option.para: Do not answer, but record anyway if line not yet answered.

option.name: o
option.para: Exit when 0 is pressed, setting the variable RECORD_STATUS to OPERATOR instead of DTMF

option.name: q
option.para: quiet (do not play a beep tone).

option.name: s
option.para: skip recording if the line is not yet answered.

option.name: t
option.para: use alternate '*' terminator key (DTMF) instead of default '#'

option.name: u
option.para: Don't truncate recorded silence.

option.name: x
option.para: Ignore all terminator keys (DTMF) and keep recording until hangup.

option.name: k
option.para: Keep recorded file upon hangup.

option.name: y
option.para: Terminate recording if *any* DTMF digit is received.

description.para: If filename contains %d, these characters will be replaced with a number incremented by one each time the file is recorded. Use core show file formats to see the available formats on your system User can press # to terminate the recording and continue to the next priority. If the user hangs up during a recording, all data will be lost and the application will terminate.

variable.name: RECORDED_FILE
variable.para: Will be set to the final filename of the recording, without an extension.

variable.name: RECORD_STATUS
variable.para: This is the final status of the command
variable.value: A terminating DTMF was received ('#' or '*', depending upon option 't')
The maximum silence occurred in the recording.
The line was not yet answered and the 's' option was specified.
The maximum length was reached.
The channel was hung up.
An unrecoverable error occurred, which resulted in a WARNING to the logs.

option.name: o
option.para: Generate the tone at 1000Hz like previous version.

description.para: Previous versions of this application generated the tone at 1000Hz. If for some reason you would prefer that behavior, supply the o option to get the old behavior.

option.name: w
option.para: Execution will wait for an acknowledgement that the URL has been loaded before continuing.

description.para: Requests client go to URL (IAX2) or sends the URL to the client (other channels).
Result is returned in the SENDURLSTATUS channel variable:

variable.name: SENDURLSTATUS
variable.value: URL successfully sent to client.
Failed to send URL.
Client failed to load URL (wait enabled).
Channel does not support URL transport.

description.para: SendURL continues normally if the URL was sent correctly or if the channel does not support HTML transport. Otherwise, the channel is hung up.
Set Caller*ID presentation on a call.

application.name: WaitUntil
application.synopsis: Wait (sleep) until the current time is the given epoch.

description.para: Waits until the given epoch.
Sets WAITUNTILSTATUS to one of the following values:

variable.name: WAITUNTILSTATUS
variable.value: Wait succeeded.
Invalid argument.
Channel hungup before time elapsed.
Time specified had already past.

parameter.name: vm-context
parameter.para: This is the context within voicemail.conf to use for the Directory. If not specified and searchcontexts=no in voicemail.conf, then default will be assumed.

parameter.name: dial-context
parameter.para: This is the dialplan context to use when looking for an extension that the user has selected, or when jumping to the o or a extension. If not specified, the current context will be used.

option.name: e
option.para: In addition to the name, also read the extension number to the caller before presenting dialing options.

option.name: f
option.para: Allow the caller to enter the first name of a user in the directory instead of using the last name. If specified, the optional number argument will be used for the number of characters the user should enter.

option.name: l
option.para: Allow the caller to enter the last name of a user in the directory. This is the default. If specified, the optional number argument will be used for the number of characters the user should enter.

option.name: b
option.para: Allow the caller to enter either the first or the last name of a user in the directory. If specified, the optional number argument will be used for the number of characters the user should enter.

option.name: a
option.para: Allow the caller to additionally enter an alias for a user in the directory. This option must be specified in addition to the f, l, or b option.

option.name: m
option.para: Instead of reading each name sequentially and asking for confirmation, create a menu of up to 8 names.

option.name: n
option.para: Read digits even if the channel is not answered.

option.name: p
option.para: Pause for n milliseconds after the digits are typed. This is helpful for people with cellphones, who are not holding the receiver to their ear while entering DTMF.

note.para: Only one of the f, l, or b options may be specified. If more than one is specified, then Directory will act as if b was specified. The number of characters for the user to type defaults to 3.

description.para: This application will present the calling channel with a directory of extensions from which they can search by name. The list of names and corresponding extensions is retrieved from the voicemail configuration file, voicemail.conf.
This application will immediately exit if one of the following DTMF digits are received and the extension to jump to exists:
0 - Jump to the 'o' extension, if it exists.
* - Jump to the 'a' extension, if it exists.
This application will set the following channel variable before completion:

variable.name: DIRECTORY_RESULT
variable.para: Reason Directory application exited.
variable.value: User requested operator
User requested assistant
User allowed DTMF wait duration to pass without sending DTMF
The channel hung up before the application finished
User selected a user to call from the directory
User exited with '#' during selection
The application failed

parameter.name: filename
parameter.para: Filename of TIFF file to fax

parameter.name: a
parameter.para: Makes the application behave as the answering machine
(Default behavior is as calling machine)

description.para: Send a given TIFF file to the channel as a FAX.
This application sets the following channel variables:

variable.name: LOCALSTATIONID
variable.para: To identify itself to the remote end

variable.name: LOCALHEADERINFO
variable.para: To generate a header line on each page

variable.name: FAXERROR
variable.para: Cause of failure

variable.name: REMOTESTATIONID
variable.para: The CSID of the remote side

variable.name: FAXPAGES
variable.para: Number of pages sent

variable.name: FAXBITRATE
variable.para: Transmission rate

variable.name: FAXRESOLUTION
variable.para: Resolution of sent fax

parameter.name: filename
parameter.para: Filename of TIFF file save incoming fax

parameter.name: c
parameter.para: Makes the application behave as the calling machine
(Default behavior is as answering machine)

description.para: Receives a FAX from the channel into the given filename overwriting the file if it already exists.
File created will be in TIFF format.
This application sets the following channel variables:

variable.name: LOCALSTATIONID
variable.para: To identify itself to the remote end

variable.name: LOCALHEADERINFO
variable.para: To generate a header line on each page

variable.name: FAXERROR
variable.para: Cause of failure

variable.name: REMOTESTATIONID
variable.para: The CSID of the remote side

variable.name: FAXPAGES
variable.para: Number of pages sent

variable.name: FAXBITRATE
variable.para: Transmission rate

variable.name: FAXRESOLUTION
variable.para: Resolution of sent fax

application.name: ChanSpy
application.synopsis: Listen to a channel, and optionally whisper into it.

option.name: b
option.para: Only spy on channels involved in a bridged call.

option.name: B
option.para: Instead of whispering on a single channel barge in on both channels involved in the call.

argument.name: digit
argument.para: Specify a DTMF digit that can be used to spy on the next available channel.

option.name: d
option.para: Override the typical numeric DTMF functionality and instead use DTMF to switch between spy modes.

option.name: e
option.para: Enable enforced mode, so the spying channel can only monitor extensions whose name is in the ext : delimited list.

option.name: E
option.para: Exit when the spied-on channel hangs up.

argument.name: grp
argument.para: Only spy on channels in which one or more of the groups listed in grp matches one or more groups from the SPYGROUP variable set on the channel to be spied upon.

note.para: both grp and SPYGROUP can contain either a single group or a colon-delimited list of groups, such as sales:support:accounting.

option.name: l
option.para: Allow usage of a long queue to store audio frames.

note.para: This may introduce some delay in the received audio feed, but will improve the audio quality.

option.name: n
option.para: Say the name of the person being spied on if that person has recorded his/her name. If a context is specified, then that voicemail context will be searched when retrieving the name, otherwise the default context be used when searching for the name (i.e. if SIP/1000 is the channel being spied on and no mailbox is specified, then 1000 will be used when searching for the name).

option.name: o
option.para: Only listen to audio coming from this channel.

option.name: q
option.para: Don't play a beep when beginning to spy on a channel, or speak the selected channel name.

option.name: r
option.para: Record the session to the monitor spool directory. An optional base for the filename may be specified. The default is chanspy.

option.name: s
option.para: Skip the playback of the channel type (i.e. SIP, IAX, etc) when speaking the selected channel name.

option.name: S
option.para: Stop when no more channels are left to spy on.

option.name: u
option.para: The chanprefix parameter is a channel uniqueid or fully specified channel name.

option.name: v
option.para: Adjust the initial volume in the range from -4 to 4. A negative value refers to a quieter setting.

option.name: w
option.para: Enable whisper mode, so the spying channel can talk to the spied-on channel.

option.name: W
option.para: Enable private whisper mode, so the spying channel can talk to the spied-on channel but cannot listen to that channel.

argument.name: digit
argument.para: Specify a DTMF digit that can be used to exit the application while actively spying on a channel. If there is no channel being spied on, the DTMF digit will be ignored.

option.name: X
option.para: Allow the user to exit ChanSpy to a valid single digit numeric extension in the current context or the context specified by the SPY_EXIT_CONTEXT channel variable. The name of the last channel that was spied on will be stored in the SPY_CHANNEL variable.

description.para: This application is used to listen to the audio from an Asterisk channel. This includes the audio coming in and out of the channel being spied on. If the chanprefix parameter is specified, only channels beginning with this string will be spied upon.
While spying, the following actions may be performed:
- Dialing # cycles the volume level.
- Dialing * will stop spying and look for another channel to spy on.

- Dialing a series of digits followed by # builds a channel name to append to chanprefix. For example, executing ChanSpy(Agent) and then dialing the digits '1234#' while spying will begin spying on the channel 'Agent/1234'. Note that this feature will be overridden if the 'd' or 'u' options are used.

note.para: The X option supersedes the three features above in that if a valid single digit extension exists in the correct context ChanSpy will exit to it. This also disables choosing a channel based on chanprefix and a digit sequence.

application.name: ExtenSpy
application.synopsis: Listen to a channel, and optionally whisper into it.

argument.name: exten
argument.para: Specify extension.

argument.name: context
argument.para: Optionally specify a context, defaults to default.

option.name: b
option.para: Only spy on channels involved in a bridged call.

option.name: B
option.para: Instead of whispering on a single channel barge in on both channels involved in the call.

argument.name: digit
argument.para: Specify a DTMF digit that can be used to spy on the next available channel.

option.name: d
option.para: Override the typical numeric DTMF functionality and instead use DTMF to switch between spy modes.

option.name: e
option.para: Enable enforced mode, so the spying channel can only monitor extensions whose name is in the ext : delimited list.

option.name: E
option.para: Exit when the spied-on channel hangs up.

argument.name: grp
argument.para: Only spy on channels in which one or more of the groups listed in grp matches one or more groups from the SPYGROUP variable set on the channel to be spied upon.

note.para: both grp and SPYGROUP can contain either a single group or a colon-delimited list of groups, such as sales:support:accounting.

option.name: l
option.para: Allow usage of a long queue to store audio frames.

note.para: This may introduce some delay in the received audio feed, but will improve the audio quality.

option.name: n
option.para: Say the name of the person being spied on if that person has recorded his/her name. If a context is specified, then that voicemail context will be searched when retrieving the name, otherwise the default context be used when searching for the name (i.e. if SIP/1000 is the channel being spied on and no mailbox is specified, then 1000 will be used when searching for the name).

option.name: o
option.para: Only listen to audio coming from this channel.

option.name: q
option.para: Don't play a beep when beginning to spy on a channel, or speak the selected channel name.

option.name: r
option.para: Record the session to the monitor spool directory. An optional base for the filename may be specified. The default is chanspy.

option.name: s
option.para: Skip the playback of the channel type (i.e. SIP, IAX, etc) when speaking the selected channel name.

option.name: S
option.para: Stop when there are no more extensions left to spy on.

option.name: v
option.para: Adjust the initial volume in the range from -4 to 4. A negative value refers to a quieter setting.

option.name: w
option.para: Enable whisper mode, so the spying channel can talk to the spied-on channel.

option.name: W
option.para: Enable private whisper mode, so the spying channel can talk to the spied-on channel but cannot listen to that channel.

argument.name: digit
argument.para: Specify a DTMF digit that can be used to exit the application while actively spying on a channel. If there is no channel being spied on, the DTMF digit will be ignored.

option.name: X
option.para: Allow the user to exit ChanSpy to a valid single digit numeric extension in the current context or the context specified by the SPY_EXIT_CONTEXT channel variable. The name of the last channel that was spied on will be stored in the SPY_CHANNEL variable.

description.para: This application is used to listen to the audio from an Asterisk channel. This includes the audio coming in and out of the channel being spied on. Only channels created by outgoing calls for the specified extension will be selected for spying. If the optional context is not supplied, the current channel's context will be used.
While spying, the following actions may be performed:
- Dialing # cycles the volume level.
- Dialing * will stop spying and look for another channel to spy on.

note.para: The X option supersedes the three features above in that if a valid single digit extension exists in the correct context ChanSpy will exit to it. This also disables choosing a channel based on chanprefix and a digit sequence.

application.name: DAHDIScan
application.synopsis: Scan DAHDI channels to monitor calls.

parameter.name: group
parameter.para: Limit scanning to a channel group by setting this option.

description.para: Allows a call center manager to monitor DAHDI channels in a convenient way. Use # to select the next channel and use * to exit.

application.name: BridgeWait
application.synopsis: Put a call into the holding bridge.

parameter.name: name
parameter.para: Name of the holding bridge to join. This is a handle for BridgeWait only and does not affect the actual bridges that are created. If not provided, the reserved name default will be used.

parameter.name: role
parameter.para: Defines the channel's purpose for entering the holding bridge. Values are case sensitive.

enum.name: participant
enum.para: The channel will enter the holding bridge to be placed on hold until it is removed from the bridge for some reason. (default)

enum.name: announcer
enum.para: The channel will enter the holding bridge to make announcements to channels that are currently in the holding bridge. While an announcer is present, holding for the participants will be suspended.

option.name: m
option.para: The specified MOH class will be used/suggested for music on hold operations. This option will only be useful for entertainment modes that use it (m and h).

option.name: e
option.para: Which entertainment mechanism should be used while on hold in the holding bridge. Only the first letter is read.

option.name: S
option.para: Automatically exit the bridge and return to the PBX after duration seconds.

description.para: This application places the incoming channel into a holding bridge. The channel will then wait in the holding bridge until some event occurs which removes it from the holding bridge.

note.para: This application will answer calls which haven't already been answered.

parameter.name: appname
parameter.para: Application name and arguments of the dialplan application to execute.

description.para: Allows an arbitrary application to be invoked even when not hard coded into the dialplan. If the underlying application terminates the dialplan, or if the application cannot be found, Exec will terminate the dialplan.
To invoke external applications, see the application System. If you would like to catch any error instead, see TryExec.

Allows an arbitrary application to be invoked even when not hard coded into the dialplan. To invoke external applications see the application System. Always returns to the dialplan. The channel variable TRYSTATUS will be set to one of:

variable.name: TRYSTATUS
variable.value: If the application returned zero.
If the application returned non-zero.
If the application was not found or was not specified.

description.para: If expr is true, execute and return the result of appiftrue(args).
If expr is true, but appiftrue is not found, then the application will return a non-zero value.

parameter.name: app_name
parameter.para: Name of the application to invoke.

parameter.name: args
parameter.para: Optional comma-delimited arguments for the application invocation.

description.para: Invoke a Stasis application.
This application will set the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: STASISSTATUS
variable.para: This indicates the status of the execution of the Stasis application.
variable.value: The channel has exited Stasis without any failures in Stasis.

A failure occurred when executing the Stasis The app registry is not instantiated; The app application. Some (not all) possible reasons for this: requested is not registered; The app requested is not active; Stasis couldn't send a start message.

application.name: PrivacyManager
application.synopsis: Require phone number to be entered, if no CallerID sent

parameter.name: maxretries
parameter.para: Total tries caller is allowed to input a callerid. Defaults to 3.

parameter.name: minlength
parameter.para: Minimum allowable digits in the input callerid number. Defaults to 10.

parameter.name: options
parameter.para: Position reserved for options.

parameter.name: context
parameter.para: Context to check the given callerid against patterns.

description.para: If no Caller*ID is sent, PrivacyManager answers the channel and asks the caller to enter their phone number. The caller is given maxretries attempts to do so. The application does nothing if Caller*ID was received on the channel.
The application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: PRIVACYMGRSTATUS
variable.para: The status of the privacy manager's attempt to collect a phone number from the user.

option.name: a
option.para: Record the caller's name so it can be announced to the callee on each step.

option.name: B
option.para: Before initiating the outgoing call(s), Gosub to the specified location using the current channel.

option.name: b
option.para: Before initiating an outgoing call, Gosub to the specified location using the newly created channel. The Gosub will be executed for each destination channel.

option.name: d
option.para: Disable the 'Please hold while we try to connect your call' announcement.

option.name: I
option.para: Asterisk will ignore any connected line update requests it may receive on this dial attempt.

option.name: l
option.para: Disable local call optimization so that applications with audio hooks between the local bridge don't get dropped when the calls get joined directly.

option.name: N
option.para: Don't answer the incoming call until we're ready to connect the caller or give up.

note.para: This option is ignored if the call is already answered.
If the call is not already answered, the 'a' and 's' options are ignored while the 'd' option is implicitly enabled.

option.name: n
option.para: Playback the unreachable status message if we've run out of steps or the callee has elected not to be reachable.

option.name: s
option.para: Playback the incoming status message prior to starting the follow-me step(s)

description.para: This application performs Find-Me/Follow-Me functionality for the caller as defined in the profile matching the followmeid parameter in followme.conf. If the specified followmeid profile doesn't exist in followme.conf, execution will be returned to the dialplan and call execution will continue at the next priority.
Returns -1 on hangup.
Start dictation machine using optional base_dir for files.

parameter.name: tech_data
parameter.para: Channel technology and data for creating the outbound channel. For example, SIP/1234.

parameter.name: type
parameter.para: This should be app or exten, depending on whether the outbound channel should be connected to an application or extension.

parameter.name: arg1
parameter.para: If the type is app, then this is the application name. If the type is exten, then this is the context that the channel will be sent to.

parameter.name: arg2
parameter.para: If the type is app, then this is the data passed as arguments to the application. If the type is exten, then this is the extension that the channel will be sent to.

parameter.name: arg3
parameter.para: If the type is exten, then this is the priority that the channel is sent to. If the type is app, then this parameter is ignored.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: Timeout in seconds. Default is 30 seconds.

option.name: b
option.para: Before originating the outgoing call, Gosub to the specified location using the newly created channel.

option.name: B
option.para: Before originating the outgoing call, Gosub to the specified location using the current channel.

description.para: This application originates an outbound call and connects it to a specified extension or application. This application will block until the outgoing call fails or gets answered. At that point, this application will exit with the status variable set and dialplan processing will continue.
This application sets the following channel variable before exiting:

variable.name: ORIGINATE_STATUS
variable.para: This indicates the result of the call origination.
variable.value: In practice, you should never see this value. Please report it to the issue tracker if you ever see it.

parameter.name: string
parameter.para: String to playback as morse code to channel

description.para: Plays the Morse code equivalent of the passed string.
This application does not automatically answer and should be preceeded by an application such as Answer() or Progress().
This application uses the following variables:

variable.name: MORSEDITLEN
variable.para: Use this value in (ms) for length of dit

variable.name: MORSETONE
variable.para: The pitch of the tone in (Hz), default is 800

description.para: Returns 0 after waiting at least timeout seconds, and only after the next ring has completed. Returns 0 on success or -1 on hangup.

parameter.name: config
parameter.para: ICES configuration file.

description.para: Streams to an icecast server using ices (available separately). A configuration file must be supplied for ices (see contrib/asterisk-ices.xml).

note.para: ICES version 2 client and server required.

application.name: MixMonitor
application.synopsis: Record a call and mix the audio during the recording. Use of StopMixMonitor is required to guarantee the audio file is available for processing during dialplan execution.

argument.name: filename
argument.para: If filename is an absolute path, uses that path, otherwise creates the file in the configured monitoring directory from asterisk.conf.

option.name: a
option.para: Append to the file instead of overwriting it.

option.name: b
option.para: Only save audio to the file while the channel is bridged.

note.para: If you utilize this option inside a Local channel, you must make sure the Local channel is not optimized away. To do this, be sure to call your Local channel with the /n option. For example: Dial(Local/start@mycontext/n)

option.name: B
option.para: Play a periodic beep while this call is being recorded.

argument.name: interval
argument.para: Interval, in seconds. Default is 15.

option.name: v
option.para: Adjust the heard volume by a factor of x (range -4 to 4)

option.name: V
option.para: Adjust the spoken volume by a factor of x (range -4 to 4)

option.name: W
option.para: Adjust both, heard and spoken volumes by a factor of x (range -4 to 4)

option.name: r
option.para: Use the specified file to record the receive audio feed. Like with the basic filename argument, if an absolute path isn't given, it will create the file in the configured monitoring directory.

option.name: t
option.para: Use the specified file to record the transmit audio feed. Like with the basic filename argument, if an absolute path isn't given, it will create the file in the configured monitoring directory.

option.name: i
option.para: Stores the MixMonitor's ID on this channel variable.

option.name: p
option.para: Play a beep on the channel that starts the recording.

option.name: P
option.para: Play a beep on the channel that stops the recording.

option.name: m
option.para: Create a copy of the recording as a voicemail in the indicated mailbox(es) separated by commas eg. m(1111@default,2222@default,...). Folders can be optionally specified using the syntax: mailbox@context/folder

parameter.name: command
parameter.para: Will be executed when the recording is over.
Any strings matching ^{X} will be unescaped to X.
All variables will be evaluated at the time MixMonitor is called.

warning.para: Do not use untrusted strings such as CALLERID(num) or CALLERID(name) as part of the command parameters. You risk a command injection attack executing arbitrary commands if the untrusted strings aren't filtered to remove dangerous characters. See function FILTER().

description.para: Records the audio on the current channel to the specified file.
This application does not automatically answer and should be preceeded by an application such as Answer or Progress().

note.para: MixMonitor runs as an audiohook.

variable.name: MIXMONITOR_FILENAME
variable.para: Will contain the filename used to record.

warning.para: Do not use untrusted strings such as CALLERID(num) or CALLERID(name) as part of ANY of the application's parameters. You risk a command injection attack executing arbitrary commands if the untrusted strings aren't filtered to remove dangerous characters. See function FILTER().

application.name: StopMixMonitor
application.synopsis: Stop recording a call through MixMonitor, and free the recording's file handle.

parameter.name: MixMonitorID
parameter.para: If a valid ID is provided, then this command will stop only that specific MixMonitor.

description.para: Stops the audio recording that was started with a call to MixMonitor() on the current channel.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Used to specify the channel to mute.

parameter.name: Direction
parameter.para: Which part of the recording to mute: read, write or both (from channel, to channel or both channels).

parameter.name: State
parameter.para: Turn mute on or off : 1 to turn on, 0 to turn off.

description.para: This action may be used to mute a MixMonitor recording.

manager.name: MixMonitor
manager.synopsis: Record a call and mix the audio during the recording. Use of StopMixMonitor is required to guarantee the audio file is available for processing during dialplan execution.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Used to specify the channel to record.

parameter.name: File
parameter.para: Is the name of the file created in the monitor spool directory. Defaults to the same name as the channel (with slashes replaced with dashes). This argument is optional if you specify to record unidirectional audio with either the r(filename) or t(filename) options in the options field. If neither MIXMONITOR_FILENAME or this parameter is set, the mixed stream won't be recorded.

parameter.name: options
parameter.para: Options that apply to the MixMonitor in the same way as they would apply if invoked from the MixMonitor application. For a list of available options, see the documentation for the mixmonitor application.

parameter.name: Command
parameter.para: Will be executed when the recording is over. Any strings matching ^{X} will be unescaped to X. All variables will be evaluated at the time MixMonitor is called.

warning.para: Do not use untrusted strings such as CALLERID(num) or CALLERID(name) as part of the command parameters. You risk a command injection attack executing arbitrary commands if the untrusted strings aren't filtered to remove dangerous characters. See function FILTER().

description.para: This action records the audio on the current channel to the specified file.

variable.name: MIXMONITOR_FILENAME
variable.para: Will contain the filename used to record the mixed stream.

manager.name: StopMixMonitor
manager.synopsis: Stop recording a call through MixMonitor, and free the recording's file handle.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: The name of the channel monitored.

parameter.name: MixMonitorID
parameter.para: If a valid ID is provided, then this command will stop only that specific MixMonitor.

description.para: This action stops the audio recording that was started with the MixMonitor action on the current channel.

function.name: MIXMONITOR
function.synopsis: Retrieve data pertaining to specific instances of MixMonitor on a channel.

parameter.name: id
parameter.para: The unique ID of the MixMonitor instance. The unique ID can be retrieved through the channel variable used as an argument to the i option to MixMonitor.

parameter.name: key
parameter.para: The piece of data to retrieve from the MixMonitor.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.para: The input digits will be stored in the given variable name.

argument.name: filename
argument.para: file(s) to play before reading digits or tone with option i

parameter.name: maxdigits
parameter.para: Maximum acceptable number of digits. Stops reading after maxdigits have been entered (without requiring the user to press the # key).
Defaults to 0 - no limit - wait for the user press the # key. Any value below 0 means the same. Max accepted value is 255.

option.name: s
option.para: to return immediately if the line is not up.

option.name: i
option.para: to play filename as an indication tone from your indications.conf.

option.name: n
option.para: to read digits even if the line is not up.

parameter.name: attempts
parameter.para: If greater than 1, that many attempts will be made in the event no data is entered.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: The number of seconds to wait for a digit response. If greater than 0, that value will override the default timeout. Can be floating point.

description.para: Reads a #-terminated string of digits a certain number of times from the user in to the given variable.
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: READSTATUS
variable.para: This is the status of the read operation.

parameter.name: initialSilence
parameter.para: Is maximum initial silence duration before greeting.
If this is exceeded, the result is detection as a MACHINE

parameter.name: greeting
parameter.para: is the maximum length of a greeting.
If this is exceeded, the result is detection as a MACHINE

parameter.name: afterGreetingSilence
parameter.para: Is the silence after detecting a greeting.
If this is exceeded, the result is detection as a HUMAN

parameter.name: totalAnalysis Time
parameter.para: Is the maximum time allowed for the algorithm
to decide on whether the audio represents a HUMAN, or a MACHINE

parameter.name: miniumWordLength
parameter.para: Is the minimum duration of Voice considered to be a word

parameter.name: betweenWordSilence
parameter.para: Is the minimum duration of silence after a word to consider the audio that follows to be a new word

parameter.name: maximumNumberOfWords
parameter.para: Is the maximum number of words in a greeting
If this is exceeded, then the result is detection as a MACHINE

parameter.name: silenceThreshold
parameter.para: What is the average level of noise from 0 to 32767 which if not exceeded, should be considered silence?

parameter.name: maximumWordLength
parameter.para: Is the maximum duration of a word to accept.
If exceeded, then the result is detection as a MACHINE

description.para: This application attempts to detect answering machines at the beginning of outbound calls. Simply call this application after the call has been answered (outbound only, of course).
When loaded, AMD reads amd.conf and uses the parameters specified as default values. Those default values get overwritten when the calling AMD with parameters.
This application sets the following channel variables:

variable.name: AMDSTATUS
variable.para: This is the status of the answering machine detection

variable.name: AMDCAUSE
variable.para: Indicates the cause that led to the conclusion
variable.value: Total Time.
Silence Duration - Initial Silence.
Silence Duration - afterGreetingSilence.
Voice Duration - Greeting.
Word Length - max length of a single word.
Word Count - maximum number of words.

application.name: ADSIProg
application.synopsis: Load Asterisk ADSI Scripts into phone

parameter.name: script
parameter.para: adsi script to use. If not given uses the default script asterisk.adsi

description.para: This application programs an ADSI Phone with the given script

This application creates information to be used by all the other applications. It must be called before doing any speech recognition activities such as activating a grammar. It takes the engine name to use as the argument, if not specified the default engine will be used.
Sets the ERROR channel variable to 1 if the engine cannot be used.

This activates the specified grammar to be recognized by the engine. A grammar tells the speech recognition engine what to recognize, and how to portray it back to you in the dialplan. The grammar name is the only argument to this application.
Hangs up the channel on failure. If this is not desired, use TryExec.

application.name: SpeechStart
application.synopsis: Start recognizing voice in the audio stream.

description.para: Tell the speech recognition engine that it should start trying to get results from audio being fed to it.
Hangs up the channel on failure. If this is not desired, use TryExec.

application.name: SpeechBackground
application.synopsis: Play a sound file and wait for speech to be recognized.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: Timeout integer in seconds. Note the timeout will only start once the sound file has stopped playing.

option.name: n
option.para: Don't answer the channel if it has not already been answered.

description.para: This application plays a sound file and waits for the person to speak. Once they start speaking playback of the file stops, and silence is heard. Once they stop talking the processing sound is played to indicate the speech recognition engine is working. Once results are available the application returns and results (score and text) are available using dialplan functions.
The first text and score are ${SPEECH_TEXT(0)} AND ${SPEECH_SCORE(0)} while the second are ${SPEECH_TEXT(1)} and ${SPEECH_SCORE(1)}.
The first argument is the sound file and the second is the timeout integer in seconds.
Hangs up the channel on failure. If this is not desired, use TryExec.

parameter.name: grammar_name
parameter.para: The grammar name to deactivate

description.para: This deactivates the specified grammar so that it is no longer recognized.
Hangs up the channel on failure. If this is not desired, use TryExec.
This changes the processing sound that SpeechBackground plays back when the speech recognition engine is processing and working to get results.
Hangs up the channel on failure. If this is not desired, use TryExec.

This destroys the information used by all the other speech recognition applications. If you call this application but end up wanting to recognize more speech, you must call SpeechCreate() again before calling any other application.
Hangs up the channel on failure. If this is not desired, use TryExec.
Load a grammar only on the channel, not globally.
Hangs up the channel on failure. If this is not desired, use TryExec.
Unload a grammar.
Hangs up the channel on failure. If this is not desired, use TryExec.

function.name: SPEECH_SCORE
function.synopsis: Gets the confidence score of a result.

description.para: Gets the confidence score of a result.

function.name: SPEECH_TEXT
function.synopsis: Gets the recognized text of a result.

description.para: Gets the recognized text of a result.

function.name: SPEECH_GRAMMAR
function.synopsis: Gets the matched grammar of a result if available.

description.para: Gets the matched grammar of a result if available.

function.name: SPEECH_ENGINE
function.synopsis: Get or change a speech engine specific attribute.

description.para: Changes a speech engine specific attribute.

function.name: SPEECH_RESULTS_TYPE
function.synopsis: Sets the type of results that will be returned.

description.para: Sets the type of results that will be returned. Valid options are normal or nbest.

function.name: SPEECH
function.synopsis: Gets information about speech recognition results.

enum.name: status
enum.para: Returns 1 upon speech object existing, or 0 if not

enum.name: spoke
enum.para: Returns 1 if spoker spoke, or 0 if not

enum.name: results
enum.para: Returns number of results that were recognized.

description.para: Gets information about speech recognition results.
Obtains and displays ADSI CPE ID and other information in order to properly setup dahdi.conf for on-hook operations.

application.name: SMS
application.synopsis: Communicates with SMS service centres and SMS capable analogue phones.

parameter.name: name
parameter.para: The name of the queue used in /var/spool/asterisk/sms

option.name: a
option.para: Answer, i.e. send initial FSK packet.

option.name: s
option.para: Act as service centre talking to a phone.

option.name: t
option.para: Use protocol 2 (default used is protocol 1).

option.name: p
option.para: Set the initial delay to N ms (default is 300). addr and body are a deprecated format to send messages out.

option.name: r
option.para: Set the Status Report Request (SRR) bit.

option.name: o
option.para: The body should be coded as octets not 7-bit symbols.

option.name: n
option.para: Do not log any SMS content to log file (privacy).

description.para: SMS handles exchange of SMS data with a call to/from SMS capable phone or SMS PSTN service center. Can send and/or receive SMS messages. Works to ETSI ES 201 912; compatible with BT SMS PSTN service in UK and Telecom Italia in Italy.
Typical usage is to use to handle calls from the SMS service centre CLI, or to set up a call using outgoing or manager interface to connect service centre to SMS().
"Messages are processed as per text file message queues. smsq (a separate software) is a command to generate message queues and send messages.

note.para: The protocol has tight delay bounds. Please use short frames and disable/keep short the jitter buffer on the ATA to make sure that respones (ACK etc.) are received in time.

parameter.name: name
parameter.para: The name of the macro

description.para: Executes a macro using the context macro-name, jumping to the s extension of that context and executing each step, then returning when the steps end.
The calling extension, context, and priority are stored in MACRO_EXTEN, MACRO_CONTEXT and MACRO_PRIORITY respectively. Arguments become ARG1, ARG2, etc in the macro context.
If you Goto out of the Macro context, the Macro will terminate and control will be returned at the location of the Goto.
If MACRO_OFFSET is set at termination, Macro will attempt to continue at priority MACRO_OFFSET + N + 1 if such a step exists, and N + 1 otherwise.

warning.para: Because of the way Macro is implemented (it executes the priorities contained within it via sub-engine), and a fixed per-thread memory stack allowance, macros are limited to 7 levels of nesting (macro calling macro calling macro, etc.); It may be possible that stack-intensive applications in deeply nested macros could cause asterisk to crash earlier than this limit. It is advised that if you need to deeply nest macro calls, that you use the Gosub application (now allows arguments like a Macro) with explict Return() calls instead.
Use of the application WaitExten within a macro will not function as expected. Please use the Read application in order to read DTMF from a channel currently executing a macro.

description.para: Arguments and return values as in application Macro()

parameter.name: name
parameter.para: The name of the macro

description.para: Executes macro defined in the context macro-name. Only one call at a time may run the macro. (we'll wait if another call is busy executing in the Macro)
Arguments and return values as in application Macro()
Causes the currently running macro to exit as if it had ended normally by running out of priorities to execute. If used outside a macro, will likely cause unexpected behavior.
