parameter.name: Admin
parameter.para: Identifies this user as an admin user.

configObject.name: user_profile
configObject.synopsis: A named profile to apply to specific callers.

description.para: Callers in a ConfBridge have a profile associated with them that determine their options. A configuration section is determined to be a user_profile when the type parameter has a value of user.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Define this configuration category as a user profile.

description.para: The type parameter determines how a context in the configuration file is interpreted.

enum.name: user
enum.para: Configure the context as a user_profile

enum.name: bridge
enum.para: Configure the context as a bridge_profile

enum.name: menu
enum.para: Configure the context as a menu

configOption.name: admin
configOption.synopsis: Sets if the user is an admin or not

configOption.name: send_events
configOption.synopsis: Sets if events are send to the user

description.para: If events are enabled for this bridge and this option is set, users will receive events like join, leave, talking, etc. via text messages. For users accessing the bridge via chan_pjsip, this means in-dialog MESSAGE messages. This is most useful for WebRTC participants where the browser application can use the messages to alter the user interface.

configOption.name: echo_events
configOption.synopsis: Sets if events are echoed back to the user that triggered them

description.para: If events are enabled for this user and this option is set, the user will receive events they trigger, talking, mute, etc. If not set, they will not receive their own events.

configOption.name: marked
configOption.synopsis: Sets if this is a marked user or not

configOption.name: startmuted
configOption.synopsis: Sets if all users should start out muted

configOption.name: music_on_hold_when_empty
configOption.synopsis: Play MOH when user is alone or waiting on a marked user

configOption.name: quiet
configOption.synopsis: Silence enter/leave prompts and user intros for this user

configOption.name: announce_user_count
configOption.synopsis: Sets if the number of users should be announced to the user

configOption.name: announce_user_count_all
configOption.synopsis: Announce user count to all the other users when this user joins

description.para: Sets if the number of users should be announced to all the other users in the conference when this user joins. This option can be either set to 'yes' or a number. When set to a number, the announcement will only occur once the user count is above the specified number.

configOption.name: announce_only_user
configOption.synopsis: Announce to a user when they join an empty conference

configOption.name: wait_marked
configOption.synopsis: Sets if the user must wait for a marked user to enter before joining a conference

configOption.name: end_marked
configOption.synopsis: Kick the user from the conference when the last marked user leaves

configOption.name: talk_detection_events
configOption.synopsis: Set whether or not notifications of when a user begins and ends talking should be sent out as events over AMI

configOption.name: dtmf_passthrough
configOption.synopsis: Sets whether or not DTMF should pass through the conference

configOption.name: announce_join_leave
configOption.synopsis: Prompt user for their name when joining a conference and play it to the conference when they enter

configOption.name: announce_join_leave_review
configOption.synopsis: Prompt user for their name when joining a conference and play it to the conference when they enter. The user will be asked to review the recording of their name before entering the conference.

configOption.name: pin
configOption.synopsis: Sets a PIN the user must enter before joining the conference

configOption.name: music_on_hold_class
configOption.synopsis: The MOH class to use for this user

configOption.name: announcement
configOption.synopsis: Sound file to play to the user when they join a conference

configOption.name: denoise
configOption.synopsis: Apply a denoise filter to the audio before mixing

description.para: Sets whether or not a denoise filter should be applied to the audio before mixing or not. Off by default. Requires codec_speex to be built and installed. Do not confuse this option with drop_silence. Denoise is useful if there is a lot of background noise for a user as it attempts to remove the noise while preserving the speech. This option does NOT remove silence from being mixed into the conference and does come at the cost of a slight performance hit.

configOption.name: dsp_drop_silence
configOption.synopsis: Drop what Asterisk detects as silence from audio sent to the bridge

description.para: This option drops what Asterisk detects as silence from entering into the bridge. Enabling this option will drastically improve performance and help remove the buildup of background noise from the conference. Highly recommended for large conferences due to its performance enhancements.

configOption.name: dsp_silence_threshold
configOption.synopsis: The number of milliseconds of silence necessary to declare talking stopped.

description.para: The time in milliseconds of sound falling below the dsp_talking_threshold option when a user is considered to stop talking. This value affects several operations and should not be changed unless the impact on call quality is fully understood.
What this value affects internally:

1. When talk detection AMI events are enabled, this value determines when the user has stopped talking after a period of talking. If this value is set too low AMI events indicating the user has stopped talking may get falsely sent out when the user briefly pauses during mid sentence.

2. The drop_silence option depends on this value to determine when the user's audio should begin to be dropped from the conference bridge after the user stops talking. If this value is set too low the user's audio stream may sound choppy to the other participants. This is caused by the user transitioning constantly from silence to talking during mid sentence.
The best way to approach this option is to set it slightly above the maximum amount of milliseconds of silence a user may generate during natural speech.
Valid values are 1 through 2^31.

configOption.name: dsp_talking_threshold
configOption.synopsis: Average magnitude threshold to determine talking.

description.para: The minimum average magnitude per sample in a frame for the DSP to consider talking/noise present. A value below this level is considered silence. This value affects several operations and should not be changed unless the impact on call quality is fully understood.
What this value affects internally:
1. Audio is only mixed out of a user's incoming audio stream if talking is detected. If this value is set too high the user will hear himself talking.

2. When talk detection AMI events are enabled, this value determines when talking has begun which results in an AMI event to fire. If this value is set too low AMI events may be falsely triggered by variants in room noise.

3. The drop_silence option depends on this value to determine when the user's audio should be mixed into the bridge after periods of silence. If this value is too high the user's speech will get discarded as they will be considered silent.
Valid values are 1 through 2^15.

configOption.name: jitterbuffer
configOption.synopsis: Place a jitter buffer on the user's audio stream before audio mixing is performed

description.para: Enabling this option places a jitterbuffer on the user's audio stream before audio mixing is performed. This is highly recommended but will add a slight delay to the audio. This option is using the JITTERBUFFER dialplan function's default adaptive jitterbuffer. For a more fine tuned jitterbuffer, disable this option and use the JITTERBUFFER dialplan function on the user before entering the ConfBridge application.

configOption.name: template
configOption.synopsis: When using the CONFBRIDGE dialplan function, use a user profile as a template for creating a new temporary profile

configOption.name: timeout
configOption.synopsis: Kick the user out of the conference after this many seconds. 0 means there is no timeout for the user.

configObject.name: bridge_profile
configObject.synopsis: A named profile to apply to specific bridges.

description.para: ConfBridge bridges have a profile associated with them that determine their options. A configuration section is determined to be a bridge_profile when the type parameter has a value of bridge.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Define this configuration category as a bridge profile

description.para: The type parameter determines how a context in the configuration file is interpreted.

enum.name: user
enum.para: Configure the context as a user_profile

enum.name: bridge
enum.para: Configure the context as a bridge_profile

enum.name: menu
enum.para: Configure the context as a menu

configOption.name: jitterbuffer
configOption.synopsis: Place a jitter buffer on the conference's audio stream

configOption.name: internal_sample_rate
configOption.synopsis: Set the internal native sample rate for mixing the conference

description.para: Sets the internal native sample rate the conference is mixed at. This is set to automatically adjust the sample rate to the best quality by default. Other values can be anything from 8000-192000. If a sample rate is set that Asterisk does not support, the closest sample rate Asterisk does support to the one requested will be used.

configOption.name: language
configOption.synopsis: The language used for announcements to the conference.

description.para: By default, announcements to a conference use English. Which means the prompts played to all users within the conference will be English. By changing the language of a bridge, this will change the language of the prompts played to all users.

configOption.name: mixing_interval
configOption.synopsis: Sets the internal mixing interval in milliseconds for the bridge

description.para: Sets the internal mixing interval in milliseconds for the bridge. This number reflects how tight or loose the mixing will be for the conference. In order to improve performance a larger mixing interval such as 40ms may be chosen. Using a larger mixing interval comes at the cost of introducing larger amounts of delay into the bridge. Valid values here are 10, 20, 40, or 80.

configOption.name: binaural_active
configOption.synopsis: If true binaural conferencing with stereo audio is active

description.para: Activates binaural mixing for a conference bridge. Binaural features are disabled by default.

configOption.name: record_conference
configOption.synopsis: Record the conference starting with the first active user's entrance and ending with the last active user's exit

description.para: Records the conference call starting when the first user enters the room, and ending when the last user exits the room. The default recorded filename is 'confbridge-${name of conference bridge}-${start time}.wav' and the default format is 8khz slinear. This file will be located in the configured monitoring directory in asterisk.conf.

configOption.name: record_file
configOption.synopsis: The filename of the conference recording

description.para: When record_conference is set to yes, the specific name of the record file can be set using this option. Note that since multiple conferences may use the same bridge profile, this may cause issues depending on the configuration. It is recommended to only use this option dynamically with the CONFBRIDGE() dialplan function. This allows the record name to be specified and a unique name to be chosen. By default, the record_file is stored in Asterisk's spool/monitor directory with a unique filename starting with the 'confbridge' prefix.

configOption.name: record_file_append
configOption.synopsis: Append to record file when starting/stopping on same conference recording

description.para: When record_file_append is set to yes, stopping and starting recording on a conference adds the new portion to end of current record_file. When this is set to no, a new record_file is generated every time you start then stop recording on a conference.

configOption.name: record_file_timestamp
configOption.synopsis: Append the start time to the record_file name so that it is unique.

description.para: When record_file_timestamp is set to yes, the start time is appended to record_file so that the filename is unique. This allows you to specify a record_file but not overwrite existing recordings.

configOption.name: record_options
configOption.synopsis: Pass additional options to MixMonitor when recording

description.para: Pass additional options to MixMonitor when record_conference is set to yes. See MixMonitor for available options.

configOption.name: record_command
configOption.synopsis: Execute a command after recording ends

description.para: Executes the specified command when recording ends. Any strings matching ^{X} will be unescaped to X. All variables will be evaluated at the time ConfBridge is called.

configOption.name: regcontext
configOption.synopsis: The name of the context into which to register the name of the conference bridge as NoOP() at priority 1

description.para: When set this will cause the name of the created conference to be registered into the named context at priority 1 with an operation of NoOP(). This can then be used in other parts of the dialplan to test for the existence of a specific conference bridge. You should be aware that there are potential races between testing for the existence of a bridge, and taking action upon that information, consider for example two callers executing the check simultaniously, and then taking special action as "first caller" into the bridge. The same for exiting, directly after the check the bridge can be destroyed before the new caller enters (creating a new bridge), for example, and the "first member" actions could thus be missed.

configOption.name: video_mode
configOption.synopsis: Sets how confbridge handles video distribution to the conference participants

description.para: Sets how confbridge handles video distribution to the conference participants. Note that participants wanting to view and be the source of a video feed MUST be sharing the same video codec. Also, using video in conjunction with with the jitterbuffer currently results in the audio being slightly out of sync with the video. This is a result of the jitterbuffer only working on the audio stream. It is recommended to disable the jitterbuffer when video is used.

enum.name: none
enum.para: No video sources are set by default in the conference. It is still possible for a user to be set as a video source via AMI or DTMF action at any time.

enum.name: follow_talker
enum.para: The video feed will follow whoever is talking and providing video.

enum.name: last_marked
enum.para: The last marked user to join the conference with video capabilities will be the single source of video distributed to all participants. If multiple marked users are capable of video, the last one to join is always the source, when that user leaves it goes to the one who joined before them.

enum.name: first_marked
enum.para: The first marked user to join the conference with video capabilities is the single source of video distribution among all participants. If that user leaves, the marked user to join after them becomes the source.

enum.name: sfu
enum.para: Selective Forwarding Unit - Sets multi-stream operation for a multi-party video conference.

configOption.name: max_members
configOption.synopsis: Limit the maximum number of participants for a single conference

description.para: This option limits the number of participants for a single conference to a specific number. By default conferences have no participant limit. After the limit is reached, the conference will be locked until someone leaves. Note however that an Admin user will always be alowed to join the conference regardless if this limit is reached or not.

configOption.name: sound_
configOption.synopsis: Override the various conference bridge sound files

description.para: All sounds in the conference are customizable using the bridge profile options below. Simply state the option followed by the filename or full path of the filename after the option. Example: sound_had_joined=conf-hasjoin This will play the conf-hasjoin sound file found in the sounds directory when announcing someone's name is joining the conference.

enum.name: sound_join
enum.para: The sound played to everyone when someone enters the conference.

enum.name: sound_leave
enum.para: The sound played to everyone when someone leaves the conference.

enum.name: sound_has_joined
enum.para: The sound played before announcing someone's name has joined the conference. This is used for user intros. Example "_____ has joined the conference"

enum.name: sound_has_left
enum.para: The sound played when announcing someone's name has left the conference. This is used for user intros. Example "_____ has left the conference"

enum.name: sound_kicked
enum.para: The sound played to a user who has been kicked from the conference.

enum.name: sound_muted
enum.para: The sound played when the mute option it toggled on.

enum.name: sound_unmuted
enum.para: The sound played when the mute option it toggled off.

enum.name: sound_binaural_on
enum.para: The sound played when binaural auudio is turned on.

enum.name: sound_binaural_off
enum.para: The sound played when the binaural audio is turned off.

enum.name: sound_only_person
enum.para: The sound played when the user is the only person in the conference.

enum.name: sound_only_one
enum.para: The sound played to a user when there is only one other person is in the conference.

enum.name: sound_there_are
enum.para: The sound played when announcing how many users there are in a conference.

enum.name: sound_other_in_party
enum.para: This file is used in conjunction with sound_there_are when announcing how many users there are in the conference. The sounds are stringed together like this. "sound_there_are" ${number of participants} "sound_other_in_party"

enum.name: sound_place_into_conference
enum.para: The sound played when someone is placed into the conference after waiting for a marked user.

enum.name: sound_wait_for_leader
enum.para: The sound played when a user is placed into a conference that can not start until a marked user enters.

enum.name: sound_leader_has_left
enum.para: The sound played when the last marked user leaves the conference.

enum.name: sound_get_pin
enum.para: The sound played when prompting for a conference pin number.

enum.name: sound_invalid_pin
enum.para: The sound played when an invalid pin is entered too many times.

enum.name: sound_locked
enum.para: The sound played to a user trying to join a locked conference.

enum.name: sound_locked_now
enum.para: The sound played to an admin after toggling the conference to locked mode.

enum.name: sound_unlocked_now
enum.para: The sound played to an admin after toggling the conference to unlocked mode.

enum.name: sound_error_menu
enum.para: The sound played when an invalid menu option is entered.

configOption.name: video_update_discard
configOption.synopsis: Sets the amount of time in milliseconds after sending a video update to discard subsequent video updates

description.para: Sets the amount of time in milliseconds after sending a video update request that subsequent video updates should be discarded. This means that if we send a video update we will discard any other video update requests until after the configured amount of time has elapsed. This prevents flooding of video update requests from clients.

configOption.name: remb_send_interval
configOption.synopsis: Sets the interval in milliseconds that a combined REMB frame will be sent to video sources

description.para: Sets the interval in milliseconds that a combined REMB frame will be sent to video sources. This is done by taking all REMB frames that have been received since the last REMB frame was sent, making a combined value, and sending it to the source. A REMB frame contains receiver estimated maximum bitrate information. By creating a combined REMB frame the sender of video can be influenced on the bitrate they choose, allowing better quality for all receivers.

configOption.name: remb_behavior
configOption.synopsis: Sets how REMB reports are generated from multiple sources

description.para: Sets how REMB reports are combined from multiple sources to form one. A REMB report consists of information about the receiver estimated maximum bitrate. As a source stream may be forwarded to multiple receivers the reports must be combined into a single one which is sent to the sender.

enum.name: average
enum.para: The average of all estimated maximum bitrates is taken and sent to the sender.

enum.name: lowest
enum.para: The lowest estimated maximum bitrate is forwarded to the sender.

enum.name: highest
enum.para: The highest estimated maximum bitrate is forwarded to the sender.

configOption.name: enable_events
configOption.synopsis: Enables events for this bridge

description.para: If enabled, recipients who joined the bridge via a channel driver that supports Enhanced Messaging (currently only chan_pjsip) will receive in-dialog messages containing a JSON body describing the event. The Content-Type header will be text/x-ast-confbridge-event. This feature must also be enabled in user profiles.

configOption.name: template
configOption.synopsis: When using the CONFBRIDGE dialplan function, use a bridge profile as a template for creating a new temporary profile

description.para: Conference users, as defined by a conf_user, can have a DTMF menu assigned to their profile when they enter the ConfBridge application.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Define this configuration category as a menu

description.para: The type parameter determines how a context in the configuration file is interpreted.

enum.name: user
enum.para: Configure the context as a user_profile

enum.name: bridge
enum.para: Configure the context as a bridge_profile

enum.name: menu
enum.para: Configure the context as a menu

configOption.name: template
configOption.synopsis: When using the CONFBRIDGE dialplan function, use a menu profile as a template for creating a new temporary profile

configOption.name: ^[0-9A-D*#]+$
configOption.synopsis: DTMF sequences to assign various confbridge actions to

description.para: The ConfBridge application also has the ability to apply custom DTMF menus to each channel using the application. Like the User and Bridge profiles a menu is passed in to ConfBridge as an argument in the dialplan.
Below is a list of menu actions that can be assigned to a DTMF sequence.

note.para: To have the first DTMF digit in a sequence be the '#' character, you need to escape it. If it is not escaped then normal config file processing will think it is a directive like #include. For example: The mute setting is toggled when #1 is pressed.

A single DTMF sequence can have multiple actions associated with it. This is accomplished by stringing the actions together and using a , as the delimiter. Example: Both listening and talking volume is reset when 5 is pressed. 5=reset_talking_volume, reset_listening_volume

enum.name: playback(filename&filename2&...)
enum.para: playback will play back an audio file to a channel and then immediately return to the conference. This file can not be interupted by DTMF. Multiple files can be chained together using the & character.

enum.name: playback_and_continue(filename&filename2&...)
enum.para: playback_and_continue will play back a prompt while continuing to collect the dtmf sequence. This is useful when using a menu prompt that describes all the menu options. Note however that any DTMF during this action will terminate the prompts playback. Prompt files can be chained together using the & character as a delimiter.

enum.name: toggle_mute
enum.para: Toggle turning on and off mute. Mute will make the user silent to everyone else, but the user will still be able to listen in.

enum.name: toggle_binaural
enum.para: Toggle turning on and off binaural audio processing.

enum.name: no_op
enum.para: This action does nothing (No Operation). Its only real purpose exists for being able to reserve a sequence in the config as a menu exit sequence.

enum.name: reset_listening_volume
enum.para: Reset channel's listening volume to default level.

enum.name: reset_talking_volume
enum.para: Reset channel's talking volume to default level.

enum.name: dialplan_exec(context,exten,priority)
enum.para: The dialplan_exec action allows a user to escape from the conference and execute commands in the dialplan. Once the dialplan exits the user will be put back into the conference. The possibilities are endless!

enum.name: leave_conference
enum.para: This action allows a user to exit the conference and continue execution in the dialplan.

enum.name: admin_kick_last
enum.para: This action allows an Admin to kick the last participant from the conference. This action will only work for admins which allows a single menu to be used for both users and admins.

enum.name: admin_toggle_conference_lock
enum.para: This action allows an Admin to toggle locking and unlocking the conference. Non admins can not use this action even if it is in their menu.

enum.name: set_as_single_video_src
enum.para: This action allows any user to set themselves as the single video source distributed to all participants. This will make the video feed stick to them regardless of what the video_mode is set to.

enum.name: release_as_single_video_src
enum.para: This action allows a user to release themselves as the video source. If video_mode is not set to none this action will result in the conference returning to whatever video mode the bridge profile is using.

Note that this action will have no effect if the user is not currently the video source. Also, the user is not guaranteed by using this action that they will not become the video source again. The bridge will return to whatever operation the video_mode option is set to upon release of the video src.

enum.name: admin_toggle_mute_participants
enum.para: This action allows an administrator to toggle the mute state for all non-admins within a conference. All admin users are unaffected by this option. Note that all users, regardless of their admin status, are notified that the conference is muted.

enum.name: participant_count
enum.para: This action plays back the number of participants currently in a conference

application.name: Queue
application.synopsis: Queue a call for a call queue.

option.name: C
option.para: Mark all calls as "answered elsewhere" when cancelled.

option.name: c
option.para: Continue in the dialplan if the callee hangs up.

option.name: d
option.para: data-quality (modem) call (minimum delay).

option.name: F
option.para: When the caller hangs up, transfer the called member to the specified destination and start execution at that location.

note.para: Any channel variables you want the called channel to inherit from the caller channel must be prefixed with one or two underbars ('_').

option.name: F
option.para: When the caller hangs up, transfer the called member to the next priority of the current extension and start execution at that location.

note.para: Any channel variables you want the called channel to inherit from the caller channel must be prefixed with one or two underbars ('_').
Using this option from a Macro() or GoSub() might not make sense as there would be no return points.

option.name: h
option.para: Allow callee to hang up by pressing *.

option.name: H
option.para: Allow caller to hang up by pressing *.

option.name: n
option.para: No retries on the timeout; will exit this application and go to the next step.

option.name: i
option.para: Ignore call forward requests from queue members and do nothing when they are requested.

option.name: I
option.para: Asterisk will ignore any connected line update requests or any redirecting party update requests it may receive on this dial attempt.

option.name: r
option.para: Ring instead of playing MOH. Periodic Announcements are still made, if applicable.

option.name: R
option.para: Ring instead of playing MOH when a member channel is actually ringing.

option.name: t
option.para: Allow the called user to transfer the calling user.

option.name: T
option.para: Allow the calling user to transfer the call.

option.name: w
option.para: Allow the called user to write the conversation to disk via Monitor.

option.name: W
option.para: Allow the calling user to write the conversation to disk via Monitor.

option.name: k
option.para: Allow the called party to enable parking of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for call parking in features.conf.

option.name: K
option.para: Allow the calling party to enable parking of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for call parking in features.conf.

option.name: x
option.para: Allow the called user to write the conversation to disk via MixMonitor.

option.name: X
option.para: Allow the calling user to write the conversation to disk via MixMonitor.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.para: URL will be sent to the called party if the channel supports it.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: Will cause the queue to fail out after a specified number of seconds, checked between each queues.conf timeout and retry cycle.

parameter.name: AGI
parameter.para: Will setup an AGI script to be executed on the calling party's channel once they are connected to a queue member.

parameter.name: macro
parameter.para: Will run a macro on the called party's channel (the queue member) once the parties are connected.

parameter.name: gosub
parameter.para: Will run a gosub on the called party's channel (the queue member) once the parties are connected.

parameter.name: rule
parameter.para: Will cause the queue's defaultrule to be overridden by the rule specified.

parameter.name: position
parameter.para: Attempt to enter the caller into the queue at the numerical position specified. 1 would attempt to enter the caller at the head of the queue, and 3 would attempt to place the caller third in the queue.

description.para: In addition to transferring the call, a call may be parked and then picked up by another user.
This application will return to the dialplan if the queue does not exist, or any of the join options cause the caller to not enter the queue.
This application does not automatically answer and should be preceeded by an application such as Answer(), Progress(), or Ringing().
This application sets the following channel variables upon completion:

variable.name: QUEUESTATUS
variable.para: The status of the call as a text string.

variable.name: ABANDONED
variable.para: If the call was not answered by an agent this variable will be TRUE.

description.para: Dynamically adds interface to an existing queue. If the interface is already in the queue it will return an error.
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: AQMSTATUS
variable.para: The status of the attempt to add a queue member as a text string.

description.para: If the interface is NOT in the queue it will return an error.
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:
Example: RemoveQueueMember(techsupport,SIP/3000)

parameter.name: reason
parameter.para: Is used to add extra information to the appropriate queue_log entries and manager events.

description.para: Pauses (blocks calls for) a queue member. The given interface will be paused in the given queue. This prevents any calls from being sent from the queue to the interface until it is unpaused with UnpauseQueueMember or the manager interface. If no queuename is given, the interface is paused in every queue it is a member of. The application will fail if the interface is not found.
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: PQMSTATUS
variable.para: The status of the attempt to pause a queue member as a text string.

description.para: Example: PauseQueueMember(,SIP/3000)

parameter.name: reason
parameter.para: Is used to add extra information to the appropriate queue_log entries and manager events.

description.para: Unpauses (resumes calls to) a queue member. This is the counterpart to PauseQueueMember() and operates exactly the same way, except it unpauses instead of pausing the given interface.
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: UPQMSTATUS
variable.para: The status of the attempt to unpause a queue member as a text string.

description.para: Example: UnpauseQueueMember(,SIP/3000)
Allows you to write your own events into the queue log.
Example: QueueLog(101,${UNIQUEID},${AGENT},WENTONBREAK,600)

application.name: QueueUpdate
application.synopsis: Writes to the queue_log file for OutBound calls and updates Realtime Data. Is used at h extension to be able to have all the parameters.

description.para: Allows you to write Outbound events into the queue log.
Example: exten => h,1,QueueUpdate(${QUEUE}, ${UNIQUEID}, ${AGENT}, ${DIALSTATUS}, ${ANSWEREDTIME}, ${DIALEDTIME} | ${DIALEDNUMBER})

function.name: QUEUE_VARIABLES
function.synopsis: Return Queue information in variables.

enum.name: QUEUECALLS
enum.para: Number of calls currently in the queue.

enum.name: QUEUECOMPLETED
enum.para: Number of completed calls for the queue.

description.para: Makes the following queue variables available.
Returns 0 if queue is found and setqueuevar is defined, -1 otherwise.

function.name: QUEUE_MEMBER
function.synopsis: Count number of members answering a queue.

enum.name: logged
enum.para: Returns the number of logged-in members for the specified queue.

enum.name: free
enum.para: Returns the number of logged-in members for the specified queue that either can take calls or are currently wrapping up after a previous call.

enum.name: ready
enum.para: Returns the number of logged-in members for the specified queue that are immediately available to answer a call.

enum.name: count
enum.para: Returns the total number of members for the specified queue.

enum.name: penalty
enum.para: Gets or sets queue member penalty. If queuename is not specified when setting the penalty then the penalty is set in all queues the interface is a member.

enum.name: paused
enum.para: Gets or sets queue member paused status. If queuename is not specified when setting the paused status then the paused status is set in all queues the interface is a member.

enum.name: ringinuse
enum.para: Gets or sets queue member ringinuse. If queuename is not specified when setting ringinuse then ringinuse is set in all queues the interface is a member.

description.para: Allows access to queue counts [R] and member information [R/W].
queuename is required for all read operations.
interface is required for all member operations.

function.name: QUEUE_MEMBER_COUNT
function.synopsis: Count number of members answering a queue.

description.para: Returns the number of members currently associated with the specified queuename.

warning.para: This function has been deprecated in favor of the QUEUE_MEMBER() function

function.name: QUEUE_EXISTS
function.synopsis: Check if a named queue exists on this server

description.para: Returns 1 if the specified queue exists, 0 if it does not

function.name: QUEUE_GET_CHANNEL
function.synopsis: Return caller at the specified position in a queue.

description.para: Returns the caller channel at position in the specified queuename.
If position is unspecified the first channel is returned.

function.name: QUEUE_WAITING_COUNT
function.synopsis: Count number of calls currently waiting in a queue.

description.para: Returns the number of callers currently waiting in the specified queuename.

function.name: QUEUE_MEMBER_LIST
function.synopsis: Returns a list of interfaces on a queue.

description.para: Returns a comma-separated list of members associated with the specified queuename.

function.name: QUEUE_MEMBER_PENALTY
function.synopsis: Gets or sets queue members penalty.

description.para: Gets or sets queue members penalty.

warning.para: This function has been deprecated in favor of the QUEUE_MEMBER() function

parameter.name: Queue
parameter.para: Limit the response to the status of the specified queue.

parameter.name: Member
parameter.para: Limit the response to the status of the specified member.

description.para: Check the status of one or more queues.

parameter.name: Queue
parameter.para: Queue for which the summary is requested.

description.para: Request the manager to send a QueueSummary event.

parameter.name: Queue
parameter.para: Queue's name.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.para: The name of the interface (tech/name) to add to the queue.

parameter.name: Penalty
parameter.para: A penalty (number) to apply to this member. Asterisk will distribute calls to members with higher penalties only after attempting to distribute calls to those with lower penalty.

parameter.name: Paused
parameter.para: To pause or not the member initially (true/false or 1/0).

parameter.name: MemberName
parameter.para: Text alias for the interface.

parameter.name: Queue
parameter.para: The name of the queue to take action on.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.para: The interface (tech/name) to remove from queue.

manager.name: QueuePause
manager.synopsis: Makes a queue member temporarily unavailable.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.para: The name of the interface (tech/name) to pause or unpause.

parameter.name: Paused
parameter.para: Pause or unpause the interface. Set to 'true' to pause the member or 'false' to unpause.

parameter.name: Queue
parameter.para: The name of the queue in which to pause or unpause this member. If not specified, the member will be paused or unpaused in all the queues it is a member of.

parameter.name: Reason
parameter.para: Text description, returned in the event QueueMemberPaused.

description.para: Pause or unpause a member in a queue.

manager.name: QueuePenalty
manager.synopsis: Set the penalty for a queue member.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.para: The interface (tech/name) of the member whose penalty to change.

parameter.name: Penalty
parameter.para: The new penalty (number) for the member. Must be nonnegative.

parameter.name: Queue

parameter.name: Queue

parameter.name: LastPause

parameter.name: InCall
parameter.para: Set to 1 if member is in call. Set to 0 after LastCall time is updated.

parameter.name: Status

parameter.name: PausedReason

Raised when a member's ringinuse setting is changed.

description.para: Connect to Festival, send the argument, get back the waveform, play it to the user, allowing any given interrupt keys to immediately terminate and return the value, or any to allow any number back (useful in dialplan).

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a CDR is generated.

parameter.name: AccountCode
parameter.para: The account code of the Party A channel.

parameter.name: Source
parameter.para: The Caller ID number associated with the Party A in the CDR.

parameter.name: Destination
parameter.para: The dialplan extension the Party A was executing.

parameter.name: DestinationContext
parameter.para: The dialplan context the Party A was executing.

parameter.name: CallerID
parameter.para: The Caller ID name associated with the Party A in the CDR.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: The channel name of the Party A.

parameter.name: DestinationChannel
parameter.para: The channel name of the Party B.

parameter.name: LastApplication
parameter.para: The last dialplan application the Party A executed.

parameter.name: LastData
parameter.para: The parameters passed to the last dialplan application the Party A executed.

parameter.name: StartTime
parameter.para: The time the CDR was created.

parameter.name: AnswerTime
parameter.para: The earliest of either the time when Party A answered, or the start time of this CDR.

parameter.name: EndTime
parameter.para: The time when the CDR was finished. This occurs when the Party A hangs up or when the bridge between Party A and Party B is broken.

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.para: The time, in seconds, of EndTime - StartTime.

parameter.name: BillableSeconds
parameter.para: The time, in seconds, of AnswerTime - StartTime.

parameter.name: Disposition
parameter.para: The final known disposition of the CDR.

enum.name: NO ANSWER
enum.para: The channel was not answered. This is the default disposition.

enum.name: FAILED
enum.para: The channel attempted to dial but the call failed.

note.para: The congestion setting in cdr.conf can result in the AST_CAUSE_CONGESTION hang up cause or the CONGESTION dial status to map to this disposition.

enum.name: BUSY
enum.para: The channel attempted to dial but the remote party was busy.

enum.name: ANSWERED
enum.para: The channel was answered. The hang up cause will no longer impact the disposition of the CDR.

enum.name: CONGESTION
enum.para: The channel attempted to dial but the remote party was congested.

parameter.name: AMAFlags
parameter.para: A flag that informs a billing system how to treat the CDR.

enum.name: BILLING
enum.para: This CDR contains valid billing data.

enum.name: DOCUMENTATION
enum.para: This CDR is for documentation purposes.

parameter.name: UniqueID
parameter.para: A unique identifier for the Party A channel.

parameter.name: UserField
parameter.para: A user defined field set on the channels. If set on both the Party A and Party B channel, the userfields of both are concatenated and separated by a ;.

description.para: The Cdr event is only raised when the cdr_manager backend is loaded and registered with the CDR engine.

note.para: This event can contain additional fields depending on the configuration provided by cdr_manager.conf.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a Channel Event Log is generated for a channel.

parameter.name: EventName
parameter.para: The name of the CEL event being raised. This can include both the system defined CEL events, as well as user defined events.

note.para: All events listed here may not be raised, depending on the configuration in cel.conf.

enum.name: APP_START
enum.para: A channel entered into a tracked application.

enum.name: APP_END
enum.para: A channel left a tracked application.

enum.name: BLINDTRANSFER
enum.para: A channel initiated a blind transfer.

enum.name: ATTENDEDTRANSFER
enum.para: A channel initiated an attended transfer.

enum.name: PICKUP
enum.para: A channel initated a call pickup.

enum.name: FORWARD
enum.para: A channel is being forwarded to another destination.

enum.name: LINKEDID_END
enum.para: The linked ID associated with this channel is being retired.

enum.name: LOCAL_OPTIMIZE
enum.para: A Local channel optimization has occurred.

note.para: This event is only present if show_user_defined in cel.conf is True. Otherwise, the user defined event will be placed directly in the EventName field.

parameter.name: AccountCode
parameter.para: The channel's account code.

parameter.name: CallerIDnum
parameter.para: The Caller ID number.

parameter.name: CallerIDname
parameter.para: The Caller ID name.

parameter.name: CallerIDani
parameter.para: The Caller ID Automatic Number Identification.

parameter.name: CallerIDrdnis
parameter.para: The Caller ID Redirected Dialed Number Identification Service.

parameter.name: CallerIDdnid
parameter.para: The Caller ID Dialed Number Identifier.

parameter.name: Exten
parameter.para: The dialplan extension the channel is currently executing in.

parameter.name: Context
parameter.para: The dialplan context the channel is currently executing in.

parameter.name: Application
parameter.para: The dialplan application the channel is currently executing.

parameter.name: AppData
parameter.para: The arguments passed to the dialplan Application.

parameter.name: EventTime
parameter.para: The time the CEL event occurred.

parameter.name: AMAFlags
parameter.para: A flag that informs a billing system how to treat the CEL.

enum.name: BILLING
enum.para: This event contains valid billing data.

enum.name: DOCUMENTATION
enum.para: This event is for documentation purposes.

parameter.name: UniqueID
parameter.para: The unique ID of the channel.

parameter.name: LinkedID
parameter.para: The linked ID of the channel, which ties this event to other related channel's events.

parameter.name: UserField
parameter.para: A user defined field set on a channel, containing arbitrary application specific data.

parameter.name: Peer
parameter.para: If this channel is in a bridge, the channel that it is in a bridge with.

parameter.name: PeerAccount
parameter.para: If this channel is in a bridge, the accountcode of the channel it is in a bridge with.

parameter.name: Extra
parameter.para: Some events will have event specific data that accompanies the CEL record. This extra data is JSON encoded, and is dependent on the event in question.

function.name: ODBC_FETCH
function.synopsis: Fetch a row from a multirow query.

description.para: For queries which are marked as mode=multirow, the original query returns a result-id from which results may be fetched. This function implements the actual fetch of the results.
This also sets ODBC_FETCH_STATUS.

variable.name: ODBC_FETCH_STATUS
variable.value: If rows are available.
If no rows are available.

application.name: ODBCFinish
application.synopsis: Clear the resultset of a sucessful multirow query.

description.para: For queries which are marked as mode=multirow, this will clear any remaining rows of the specified resultset.

function.name: SQL_ESC
function.synopsis: Escapes single ticks for use in SQL statements.

description.para: Used in SQL templates to escape data which may contain single ticks ' which are otherwise used to delimit data.
Example: SELECT foo FROM bar WHERE baz='${SQL_ESC(${ARG1})}'

function.name: PERIODIC_HOOK
function.synopsis: Execute a periodic dialplan hook into the audio of a call.

parameter.name: context
parameter.para: (On Read Only) Context for the hook extension.

parameter.name: extension
parameter.para: (On Read Only) The hook extension.

parameter.name: interval
parameter.para: (On Read Only) Number of seconds in between hook runs. Whole seconds only.

parameter.name: hook_id
parameter.para: (On Write Only) The hook ID.

description.para: For example, you could use this function to enable playing a periodic beep sound in a call.
To turn on:
Set(BEEPID=${PERIODIC_HOOK(hooks,beep,180)})
To turn off:
Set(PERIODIC_HOOK(${BEEPID})=off)
To turn back on again later:
Set(PERIODIC_HOOK(${BEEPID})=on)

It is important to note that the hook does not actually run on the channel itself. It runs asynchronously on a new channel. Any audio generated by the hook gets injected into the call for the channel PERIODIC_HOOK() was set on.
The hook dialplan will have two variables available. HOOK_CHANNEL is the channel the hook is enabled on. HOOK_ID is the hook ID for enabling or disabling the hook.

function.name: ICONV
function.synopsis: Converts charsets of strings.

parameter.name: in-charset

parameter.name: out-charset
parameter.para: Output charset

parameter.name: string
parameter.para: String to convert, from in-charset to out-charset

description.para: Converts string from in-charset into out-charset. For available charsets, use iconv -l on your shell command line.

note.para: Due to limitations within the API, ICONV will not currently work with charsets with embedded NULLs. If found, the string will terminate.

function.name: RAND

description.para: Choose a random number between min and max. min defaults to 0, if not specified, while max defaults to RAND_MAX (2147483647 on many systems).
Example: Set(junky=${RAND(1,8)}); Sets junky to a random number between 1 and 8, inclusive.

function.name: SORT
function.synopsis: Sorts a list of key/vals into a list of keys, based upon the vals.

description.para: Takes a comma-separated list of keys and values, each separated by a colon, and returns a comma-separated list of the keys, sorted by their values. Values will be evaluated as floating-point numbers.

parameter.name: range-spec

description.para: Cut out information from a string (varname), based upon a named delimiter.

function.name: GROUP_MATCH_COUNT
function.synopsis: Counts the number of channels in the groups matching the specified pattern.

parameter.name: groupmatch
parameter.para: A standard regular expression used to match a group name.

parameter.name: category
parameter.para: A standard regular expression used to match a category name.

description.para: Calculates the group count for all groups that match the specified pattern. Note: category matching is applied after matching based on group. Uses standard regular expression matching on both (see regex(7)).

function.synopsis: Computes an MD5 digest.

function.name: TALK_DETECT
function.synopsis: Raises notifications when Asterisk detects silence or talking on a channel.

option.name: remove
option.para: W/O. Remove talk detection from the channel.

option.name: set
option.para: W/O. Enable TALK_DETECT and/or configure talk detection parameters. Can be called multiple times to change parameters on a channel with talk detection already enabled.

argument.name: dsp_silence_threshold
argument.para: The time in milliseconds before which a user is considered silent.

argument.name: dsp_talking_threshold
argument.para: The time in milliseconds after which a user is considered talking.

description.para: The TALK_DETECT function enables events on the channel it is applied to. These events can be emited over AMI, ARI, and potentially other Asterisk modules that listen for the internal notification.
The function has two parameters that can optionally be passed when set on a channel: dsp_talking_threshold and dsp_silence_threshold.

dsp_talking_threshold is the time in milliseconds of sound above what the dsp has established as base line silence for a user before a user is considered to be talking. By default, the value of silencethreshold from dsp.conf is used. If this value is set too tight events may be falsely triggered by variants in room noise.
Valid values are 1 through 2^31.

dsp_silence_threshold is the time in milliseconds of sound falling within what the dsp has established as baseline silence before a user is considered be silent. If this value is set too low events indicating the user has stopped talking may get falsely sent out when the user briefly pauses during mid sentence.
The best way to approach this option is to set it slightly above the maximum amount of ms of silence a user may generate during natural speech.
By default this value is 2500ms. Valid values are 1 through 2^31.
Example:
same => n,Set(TALK_DETECT(set)=) ; Enable talk detection
same => n,Set(TALK_DETECT(set)=1200) ; Update existing talk detection's silence threshold to 1200 ms
same => n,Set(TALK_DETECT(remove)=) ; Remove talk detection
same => n,Set(TALK_DETECT(set)=,128) ; Enable and set talk threshold to 128
This function will set the following variables:

note.para: The TALK_DETECT function uses an audiohook to inspect the voice media frames on a channel. Other functions, such as JITTERBUFFER, DENOISE, and AGC use a similar mechanism. Audiohooks are processed in the order in which they are placed on the channel. As such, it typically makes sense to place functions that modify the voice media data prior to placing the TALK_DETECT function, as this will yield better results.
Example:
same => n,Set(DENOISE(rx)=on) ; Denoise received audio
same => n,Set(TALK_DETECT(set)=) ; Perform talk detection on the denoised received audio

function.name: SHA1
function.synopsis: Computes a SHA1 digest.

parameter.name: data
parameter.para: Input string

description.para: Generate a SHA1 digest via the SHA1 algorythm.
Example: Set(sha1hash=${SHA1(junky)})
Sets the asterisk variable sha1hash to the string 60fa5675b9303eb62f99a9cd47f9f5837d18f9a0 which is known as his hash

function.name: FRAME_TRACE
function.synopsis: View internal ast_frames as they are read and written on a channel.

parameter.name: filter list type
parameter.para: A filter can be applied to the trace to limit what frames are viewed. This filter can either be a white or black list of frame types. When no filter type is present, white is used. If no arguments are provided at all, all frames will be output.
Below are the different types of frames that can be filtered.

description.para: Examples:
exten => 1,1,Set(FRAME_TRACE(white)=DTMF_BEGIN,DTMF_END); view only DTMF frames.
exten => 1,1,Set(FRAME_TRACE()=DTMF_BEGIN,DTMF_END); view only DTMF frames.
exten => 1,1,Set(FRAME_TRACE(black)=DTMF_BEGIN,DTMF_END); view everything except DTMF frames.

function.name: ENV
function.synopsis: Gets or sets the environment variable specified.

parameter.name: varname
parameter.para: Environment variable name

description.para: Variables starting with AST_ are reserved to the system and may not be set.

function.name: STAT
function.synopsis: Does a check on the specified file.

parameter.name: flag
parameter.para: Flag may be one of the following:
d - Checks if the file is a directory.
e - Checks if the file exists.
f - Checks if the file is a regular file.
m - Returns the file mode (in octal)
s - Returns the size (in bytes) of the file
A - Returns the epoch at which the file was last accessed.
C - Returns the epoch at which the inode was last changed.
M - Returns the epoch at which the file was last modified.

note.para: If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be executed from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols.

function.name: FILE
function.synopsis: Read or write text file.

parameter.name: offset
parameter.para: Maybe specified as any number. If negative, offset specifies the number of bytes back from the end of the file.

parameter.name: length
parameter.para: If specified, will limit the length of the data read to that size. If negative, trims length bytes from the end of the file.

option.name: l
option.para: Line mode: offset and length are assumed to be measured in lines, instead of byte offsets.

option.name: a
option.para: In write mode only, the append option is used to append to the end of the file, instead of overwriting the existing file.

option.name: d
option.para: In write mode and line mode only, this option does not automatically append a newline string to the end of a value. This is useful for deleting lines, instead of setting them to blank.

parameter.name: format
parameter.para: The format parameter may be used to delimit the type of line terminators in line mode.

option.name: u
option.para: Unix newline format.

option.name: d
option.para: DOS newline format.

option.name: m
option.para: Macintosh newline format.

description.para: Read and write text file in character and line mode.
Examples:
Read mode (byte):
;reads the entire content of the file.
Set(foo=${FILE(/tmp/test.txt)})
;reads from the 11th byte to the end of the file (i.e. skips the first 10).
Set(foo=${FILE(/tmp/test.txt,10)})
;reads from the 11th to 20th byte in the file (i.e. skip the first 10, then read 10 bytes).
Set(foo=${FILE(/tmp/test.txt,10,10)})
Read mode (line):
; reads the 3rd line of the file.
Set(foo=${FILE(/tmp/test.txt,3,1,l)})
; reads the 3rd and 4th lines of the file.
Set(foo=${FILE(/tmp/test.txt,3,2,l)})
; reads from the third line to the end of the file.
Set(foo=${FILE(/tmp/test.txt,3,,l)})
; reads the last three lines of the file.
Set(foo=${FILE(/tmp/test.txt,-3,,l)})
; reads the 3rd line of a DOS-formatted file.
Set(foo=${FILE(/tmp/test.txt,3,1,l,d)})
Write mode (byte):
; truncate the file and write "bar"
Set(FILE(/tmp/test.txt)=bar)
; Append "bar"
Set(FILE(/tmp/test.txt,,,a)=bar)
; Replace the first byte with "bar" (replaces 1 character with 3)
Set(FILE(/tmp/test.txt,0,1)=bar)
; Replace 10 bytes beginning at the 21st byte of the file with "bar"
Set(FILE(/tmp/test.txt,20,10)=bar)
; Replace all bytes from the 21st with "bar"
Set(FILE(/tmp/test.txt,20)=bar)
; Insert "bar" after the 4th character
Set(FILE(/tmp/test.txt,4,0)=bar)
Write mode (line):
; Replace the first line of the file with "bar"
Set(FILE(/tmp/foo.txt,0,1,l)=bar)
; Replace the last line of the file with "bar"
Set(FILE(/tmp/foo.txt,-1,,l)=bar)
; Append "bar" to the file with a newline
Set(FILE(/tmp/foo.txt,,,al)=bar)

note.para: If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be executed from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols.

function.name: FILE_COUNT_LINE
function.synopsis: Obtains the number of lines of a text file.

parameter.name: format
parameter.para: Format may be one of the following:

option.name: u
option.para: Unix newline format.

option.name: d
option.para: DOS newline format.

option.name: m
option.para: Macintosh newline format.

note.para: If not specified, an attempt will be made to determine the newline format type.

description.para: Returns the number of lines, or -1 on error.

note.para: If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be executed from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols.

function.name: FILE_FORMAT
function.synopsis: Return the newline format of a text file.

description.para: Return the line terminator type:
'u' - Unix "\n" format
'd' - DOS "\r\n" format
'm' - Macintosh "\r" format
'x' - Cannot be determined

note.para: If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be executed from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols.

function.name: DIALGROUP
function.synopsis: Manages a group of users for dialing.

parameter.name: op
parameter.para: The operation name, possible values are:
add - add a channel name or interface (write-only)
del - remove a channel name or interface (write-only)

description.para: Presents an interface meant to be used in concert with the Dial application, by presenting a list of channels which should be dialled when referenced.

When DIALGROUP is read from, the argument is interpreted as the particular group for which a dial should be attempted. When DIALGROUP is written to with no arguments, the entire list is replaced with the argument specified.

Functionality is similar to a queue, except that when no interfaces are available, execution may continue in the dialplan. This is useful when you want certain people to be the first to answer any calls, with immediate fallback to a queue when the front line people are busy or unavailable, but you still want front line people to log in and out of that group, just like a queue.
Example:
exten => 1,1,Set(DIALGROUP(mygroup,add)=SIP/10)
exten => 1,n,Set(DIALGROUP(mygroup,add)=SIP/20)
exten => 1,n,Dial(${DIALGROUP(mygroup)})
