function.name: AST_SORCERY
function.synopsis: Get a field from a sorcery object

parameter.name: module_name
parameter.para: The name of the module owning the sorcery instance.

parameter.name: object_type
parameter.para: The type of object to query.

parameter.name: object_id
parameter.para: The id of the object to query.

parameter.name: field_name
parameter.para: The name of the field.

parameter.name: retrieval_method
parameter.para: Fields that have multiple occurrences may be retrieved in two ways.

enum.name: concat
enum.para: Returns all matching fields concatenated in a single string separated by separator which defaults to ,.

enum.name: single
enum.para: Returns the nth occurrence of the field as specified by occurrence_number which defaults to 1.

parameter.para: The default is concat with separator ,.

parameter.name: retrieval_details
parameter.para: Specifies either the separator for concat or the occurrence number for single.

function.name: BLACKLIST
function.synopsis: Check if the callerid is on the blacklist.

description.para: Uses astdb to check if the Caller*ID is in family blacklist. Returns 1 or 0.

function.name: AGC
function.synopsis: Apply automatic gain control to audio on a channel.

parameter.name: channeldirection
parameter.para: This can be either rx or tx

description.para: The AGC function will apply automatic gain control to the audio on the channel that it is executed on. Using rx for audio received and tx for audio transmitted to the channel. When using this function you set a target audio level. It is primarily intended for use with analog lines, but could be useful for other channels as well. The target volume is set with a number between 1-32768. The larger the number the louder (more gain) the channel will receive.
Examples:
exten => 1,1,Set(AGC(rx)=8000)
exten => 1,2,Set(AGC(tx)=off)

function.name: DENOISE
function.synopsis: Apply noise reduction to audio on a channel.

parameter.name: channeldirection
parameter.para: This can be either rx or tx the values that can be set to this are either on and off

description.para: The DENOISE function will apply noise reduction to audio on the channel that it is executed on. It is very useful for noisy analog lines, especially when adjusting gains or using AGC. Use rx for audio received from the channel and tx to apply the filter to the audio being sent to the channel.
Examples:
exten => 1,1,Set(DENOISE(rx)=on)
exten => 1,2,Set(DENOISE(tx)=off)

function.name: CALLERID
function.synopsis: Gets or sets Caller*ID data on the channel.

parameter.name: datatype
parameter.para: The allowable datatypes are:

parameter.name: CID
parameter.para: Optional Caller*ID to parse instead of using the Caller*ID from the channel. This parameter is only optional when reading the Caller*ID.

description.para: Gets or sets Caller*ID data on the channel. Uses channel callerid by default or optional callerid, if specified.
The pres field gets/sets a combined value for name-pres and num-pres.
The allowable values for the name-charset field are the following:

function.name: CALLERPRES
function.synopsis: Gets or sets Caller*ID presentation on the channel.

description.para: Gets or sets Caller*ID presentation on the channel. This function is deprecated in favor of CALLERID(num-pres) and CALLERID(name-pres) or CALLERID(pres) to get/set both at once. The following values are valid:

function.name: CONNECTEDLINE
function.synopsis: Gets or sets Connected Line data on the channel.

parameter.name: datatype
parameter.para: The allowable datatypes are:

parameter.name: i
parameter.para: If set, this will prevent the channel from sending out protocol messages because of the value being set

description.para: Gets or sets Connected Line data on the channel.
The pres field gets/sets a combined value for name-pres and num-pres.
The allowable values for the name-charset field are the following:

function.name: REDIRECTING
function.synopsis: Gets or sets Redirecting data on the channel.

parameter.name: datatype
parameter.para: The allowable datatypes are:

parameter.name: i
parameter.para: If set, this will prevent the channel from sending out protocol messages because of the value being set

description.para: Gets or sets Redirecting data on the channel.
The orig-pres, from-pres and to-pres fields get/set a combined value for the corresponding ...-name-pres and ...-num-pres fields.
The recognized values for the reason and orig-reason fields are the following:

enum.name: cf_dte
enum.para: Call Forwarding By The Called DTE

note.para: You can set a user defined reason string that SIP can send/receive instead. The user defined reason string my need to be quoted depending upon SIP or the peer's requirements. These strings are treated as unknown by the non-SIP channel drivers.

description.para: The allowable values for the xxx-name-charset field are the following:

function.name: CDR
function.synopsis: Gets or sets a CDR variable.

parameter.name: name
parameter.para: CDR field name:

enum.name: disposition
enum.para: The final state of the CDR.

enum.name: amaflags
enum.para: R/W the Automatic Message Accounting (AMA) flags on the channel. When read from a channel, the integer value will always be returned. When written to a channel, both the string format or integer value is accepted.

warning.para: Accessing this setting is deprecated in CDR. Please use the CHANNEL function instead.
Accessing this setting is deprecated in CDR. Please use the CHANNEL function instead.

enum.name: billsec
enum.para: Duration of the call once it was answered.

option.name: f
option.para: Returns billsec or duration fields as floating point values.

option.name: u
option.para: Retrieves the raw, unprocessed value.

For example, 'start', 'answer', and 'end' will be retrieved as epoch values, when the u option is passed, but formatted as YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS otherwise. Similarly, disposition and amaflags will return their raw integral values.

description.para: All of the CDR field names are read-only, except for accountcode, userfield, and amaflags. You may, however, supply a name not on the above list, and create your own variable, whose value can be changed with this function, and this variable will be stored on the CDR.

note.para: CDRs can only be modified before the bridge between two channels is torn down. For example, CDRs may not be modified after the Dial application has returned.

description.para: Example: exten => 1,1,Set(CDR(userfield)=test)

function.name: CDR_PROP
function.synopsis: Set a property on a channel's CDR.

parameter.name: name
parameter.para: The property to set on the CDR.

enum.name: party_a
enum.para: Set this channel as the preferred Party A when channels are associated together.

enum.name: disable
enum.para: Setting to 1 will disable CDRs for this channel. Setting to 0 will enable CDRs for this channel.

description.para: This function sets a property on a channel's CDR. Properties alter the behavior of how the CDR operates for that channel.

function.name: CHANNELS
function.synopsis: Gets the list of channels, optionally filtering by a regular expression.

description.para: Gets the list of channels, optionally filtering by a regular_expression. If no argument is provided, all known channels are returned. The regular_expression must correspond to the POSIX.2 specification, as shown in regex(7). The list returned will be space-delimited.

function.name: MASTER_CHANNEL
function.synopsis: Gets or sets variables on the master channel

description.para: Allows access to the oldest channel associated with the current channel if it still exists. If the channel is the master channel or the master channel no longer exists then access local channel variables instead. In other words, the master channel is the channel identified by the channel's linkedid.

function.name: CHANNEL
function.synopsis: Gets/sets various pieces of information about the channel.

parameter.name: item
parameter.para: Standard items (provided by all channel technologies) are:

enum.name: amaflags
enum.para: R/W the Automatic Message Accounting (AMA) flags on the channel. When read from a channel, the integer value will always be returned. When written to a channel, both the string format or integer value is accepted.

enum.name: audionativeformat
enum.para: R/O format used natively for audio.

enum.name: dtmf_features
enum.para: R/W The channel's DTMF bridge features. May include one or more of 'T' 'K' 'H' 'W' and 'X' in a similar manner to options in the Dial application. When setting it, the features string must be all upper case.

enum.name: callgroup
enum.para: R/W numeric call pickup groups that this channel is a member.

enum.name: pickupgroup
enum.para: R/W numeric call pickup groups this channel can pickup.

enum.name: namedcallgroup
enum.para: R/W named call pickup groups that this channel is a member.

enum.name: namedpickupgroup
enum.para: R/W named call pickup groups this channel can pickup.

enum.name: checkhangup
enum.para: R/O Whether the channel is hanging up (1/0)

enum.name: after_bridge_goto
enum.para: R/W the parseable goto string indicating where the channel is expected to return to in the PBX after exiting the next bridge it joins on the condition that it doesn't hang up. The parseable goto string uses the same syntax as the Goto application.

enum.name: hangup_handler_pop
enum.para: W/O Replace the most recently added hangup handler with a new hangup handler on the channel if supplied. The assigned string is passed to the Gosub application when the channel is hung up. Any optionally omitted context and exten are supplied by the channel pushing the handler before it is pushed.

enum.name: hangup_handler_push
enum.para: W/O Push a hangup handler onto the channel hangup handler stack. The assigned string is passed to the Gosub application when the channel is hung up. Any optionally omitted context and exten are supplied by the channel pushing the handler before it is pushed.

enum.name: hangup_handler_wipe
enum.para: W/O Wipe the entire hangup handler stack and replace with a new hangup handler on the channel if supplied. The assigned string is passed to the Gosub application when the channel is hung up. Any optionally omitted context and exten are supplied by the channel pushing the handler before it is pushed.

enum.name: onhold
enum.para: R/O Whether or not the channel is onhold. (1/0)

enum.name: musicclass
enum.para: R/W class (from musiconhold.conf) for hold music.

enum.name: rxgain
enum.para: R/W set rxgain level on channel drivers that support it.

enum.name: secure_bridge_signaling
enum.para: Whether or not channels bridged to this channel require secure signaling (1/0)

enum.name: secure_bridge_media
enum.para: Whether or not channels bridged to this channel require secure media (1/0)

enum.name: transfercapability
enum.para: R/W ISDN Transfer Capability, one of:

enum.name: txgain
enum.para: R/W set txgain level on channel drivers that support it.

enum.name: videonativeformat
enum.para: R/O format used natively for video

enum.name: hangupsource
enum.para: R/W returns the channel responsible for hangup.

enum.name: appname
enum.para: R/O returns the internal application name.

enum.name: appdata
enum.para: R/O returns the application data if available.

enum.name: exten
enum.para: R/O returns the extension for an outbound channel.

enum.name: context
enum.para: R/O returns the context for an outbound channel.

enum.name: channame
enum.para: R/O returns the channel name for an outbound channel.

enum.name: linkedid
enum.para: R/O returns the linkedid if available, otherwise returns the uniqueid.

enum.name: max_forwards
enum.para: R/W The maximum number of forwards allowed.

enum.name: callid
enum.para: R/O Call identifier log tag associated with the channel e.g., [C-00000000].

description.para: Gets/sets various pieces of information about the channel, additional item may be available from the channel driver; see its documentation for details. Any item requested that is not available on the current channel will return an empty string.
description.example:
; Push a hangup handler subroutine existing at dialplan ; location default,s,1 onto the current channel same => n,Set(CHANNEL(hangup_handler_push)=default,s,1)
; Set the current tonezone to Germany (de) same => n,Set(CHANNEL(tonezone)=de)
; Set the allowed maximum number of forwarding attempts same => n,Set(CHANNEL(max_forwards)=10)
; If this channel is ejected from its next bridge, and if ; the channel is not hung up, begin executing dialplan at ; location default,after-bridge,1 same => n,Set(CHANNEL(after_bridge_goto)=default,after-bridge,1)
; Log the current state of the channel same => n,Log(NOTICE, This channel is: ${CHANNEL(state)})

function.name: ENUMQUERY
function.synopsis: Initiate an ENUM query.

parameter.name: method-type
parameter.para: If no method-type is given, the default will be sip.

parameter.name: zone-suffix
parameter.para: If no zone-suffix is given, the default will be e164.arpa

description.para: This will do a ENUM lookup of the given phone number.

function.name: ENUMRESULT
function.synopsis: Retrieve results from a ENUMQUERY.

parameter.name: id
parameter.para: The identifier returned by the ENUMQUERY function.

parameter.name: resultnum
parameter.para: The number of the result that you want to retrieve.
Results start at 1. If this argument is specified as getnum, then it will return the total number of results that are available or -1 on error.

description.para: This function will retrieve results from a previous use of the ENUMQUERY function.

function.name: ENUMLOOKUP
function.synopsis: General or specific querying of NAPTR records for ENUM or ENUM-like DNS pointers.

parameter.name: method-type
parameter.para: If no method-type is given, the default will be sip.

option.name: c
option.para: Returns an integer count of the number of NAPTRs of a certain RR type.
Combination of c and Method-type of ALL will return a count of all NAPTRs for the record or -1 on error.

option.name: u
option.para: Returns the full URI and does not strip off the URI-scheme.

option.name: s
option.para: Triggers ISN specific rewriting.

option.name: i
option.para: Looks for branches into an Infrastructure ENUM tree.

option.name: d
option.para: for a direct DNS lookup without any flipping of digits.

parameter.name: record#
parameter.para: If no record# is given, defaults to 1.

parameter.name: zone-suffix
parameter.para: If no zone-suffix is given, the default will be e164.arpa

description.para: For more information see doc/AST.pdf.

function.name: TXTCIDNAME
function.synopsis: TXTCIDNAME looks up a caller name via DNS.

parameter.name: zone-suffix
parameter.para: If no zone-suffix is given, the default will be e164.arpa

description.para: This function looks up the given phone number in DNS to retrieve the caller id name. The result will either be blank or be the value found in the TXT record in DNS.

function.name: JITTERBUFFER
function.synopsis: Add a Jitterbuffer to the Read side of the channel. This dejitters the audio stream before it reaches the Asterisk core. This is a write only function.

option.name: fixed
option.para: Set a fixed jitterbuffer on the channel.

option.name: adaptive
option.para: Set an adaptive jitterbuffer on the channel.

option.name: disabled
option.para: Remove a previously set jitterbuffer from the channel.

description.para: Jitterbuffers are constructed in two different ways. The first always take three arguments: max_size, resync_threshold, and target_extra. Alternatively, a single argument of default can be provided, which will construct the default jitterbuffer for the given jitterbuffer type.
The arguments are:
max_size: Length in milliseconds of the buffer. Defaults to 200 ms.
resync_threshold: The length in milliseconds over which a timestamp difference will result in resyncing the jitterbuffer. Defaults to 1000ms.
target_extra: This option only affects the adaptive jitterbuffer. It represents the amount time in milliseconds by which the new jitter buffer will pad its size. Defaults to 40ms.

example.title: Fixed with 200ms max size, resync threshold 1500
Adaptive with 200ms max size, 60ms target extra
Set a fixed jitterbuffer with defaults; then remove it

note.para: If a channel specifies a jitterbuffer due to channel driver configuration and the JITTERBUFFER function has set a jitterbuffer for that channel, the jitterbuffer set by the JITTERBUFFER function will take priority and the jitterbuffer set by the channel configuration will not be applied.

function.name: HOLD_INTERCEPT
function.synopsis: Intercepts hold frames on a channel and raises an event instead of passing the frame on

option.name: remove
option.para: W/O. Removes the hold interception function.

option.name: set
option.para: W/O. Enable hold interception on the channel. When enabled, the channel will intercept any hold action that is signalled from the device, and instead simply raise an event (AMI/ARI) indicating that the channel wanted to put other parties on hold.

function.name: SHELL
function.synopsis: Executes a command using the system shell and captures its output.

parameter.name: command
parameter.para: The command that the shell should execute.

warning.para: Do not use untrusted strings such as CALLERID(num) or CALLERID(name) as part of the command parameters. You risk a command injection attack executing arbitrary commands if the untrusted strings aren't filtered to remove dangerous characters. See function FILTER().

description.para: Collects the output generated by a command executed by the system shell
Example: Set(foo=${SHELL(echo bar)})

note.para: The command supplied to this function will be executed by the system's shell, typically specified in the SHELL environment variable. There are many different system shells available with somewhat different behaviors, so the output generated by this function may vary between platforms.
If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be executed from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols.

function.name: SPRINTF
function.synopsis: Format a variable according to a format string.

description.para: Parses the format string specified and returns a string matching that format. Supports most options found in sprintf(3). Returns a shortened string if a format specifier is not recognized.

function.name: ISNULL
function.synopsis: Check if a value is NULL.

description.para: Returns 1 if NULL or 0 otherwise.

function.name: SET
function.synopsis: SET assigns a value to a channel variable.

function.name: EXISTS
function.synopsis: Test the existence of a value.

description.para: Returns 1 if exists, 0 otherwise.

function.name: IF
function.synopsis: Check for an expresion.

description.para: Returns the data following ? if true, else the data following :

function.name: IFTIME
function.synopsis: Temporal Conditional.

description.para: Returns the data following ? if true, else the data following :

function.name: IMPORT
function.synopsis: Retrieve the value of a variable from another channel.

function.name: SYSINFO
function.synopsis: Returns system information specified by parameter.

enum.name: loadavg
enum.para: System load average from past minute.

enum.name: numcalls
enum.para: Number of active calls currently in progress.

note.para: This parameter is dependant upon operating system.

enum.name: totalram
enum.para: Total usable main memory size in KiB.

note.para: This parameter is dependant upon operating system.
This parameter is dependant upon operating system.

enum.name: bufferram
enum.para: Memory used by buffers in KiB.

note.para: This parameter is dependant upon operating system.

enum.name: totalswap
enum.para: Total swap space still available in KiB.

note.para: This parameter is dependant upon operating system.

enum.name: freeswap
enum.para: Free swap space still available in KiB.

note.para: This parameter is dependant upon operating system.
This parameter is dependant upon operating system.

description.para: Returns information from a given parameter.

function.name: VERSION
function.synopsis: Return the Version info for this Asterisk.

parameter.name: info
parameter.para: The possible values are:

enum.name: ASTERISK_VERSION_NUM
enum.para: A string of digits is returned, e.g. 10602 for 1.6.2 or 100300 for 10.3.0, or 999999 when using an SVN build.

enum.name: BUILD_USER
enum.para: The string representing the user's name whose account was used to configure Asterisk, is returned.

enum.name: BUILD_HOSTNAME
enum.para: The string representing the name of the host on which Asterisk was configured, is returned.

enum.name: BUILD_MACHINE
enum.para: The string representing the type of machine on which Asterisk was configured, is returned.

enum.name: BUILD_OS
enum.para: The string representing the OS of the machine on which Asterisk was configured, is returned.

enum.name: BUILD_DATE
enum.para: The string representing the date on which Asterisk was configured, is returned.

enum.name: BUILD_KERNEL
enum.para: The string representing the kernel version of the machine on which Asterisk was configured, is returned.

description.para: If there are no arguments, return the version of Asterisk in this format: SVN-branch-1.4-r44830M
Example: Set(junky=${VERSION()};
Sets junky to the string SVN-branch-1.6-r74830M, or possibly, SVN-trunk-r45126M.

function.name: SRVQUERY
function.synopsis: Initiate an SRV query.

parameter.name: service
parameter.para: The service for which to look up SRV records. An example would be something like _sip._udp.example.com

description.para: This will do an SRV lookup of the given service.

function.name: SRVRESULT
function.synopsis: Retrieve results from an SRVQUERY.

parameter.name: id
parameter.para: The identifier returned by the SRVQUERY function.

parameter.name: resultnum
parameter.para: The number of the result that you want to retrieve.
Results start at 1. If this argument is specified as getnum, then it will return the total number of results that are available.

description.para: This function will retrieve results from a previous use of the SRVQUERY function.

function.name: DIALPLAN_EXISTS
function.synopsis: Checks the existence of a dialplan target.

description.para: This function returns 1 if the target exits. Otherwise, it returns 0.

function.name: VALID_EXTEN
function.synopsis: Determine whether an extension exists or not.

parameter.name: context
parameter.para: Defaults to the current context

parameter.name: priority
parameter.para: Priority defaults to 1.

description.para: Returns a true value if the indicated context, extension, and priority exist.

warning.para: This function has been deprecated in favor of the DIALPLAN_EXISTS() function

function.name: LOCK
function.synopsis: Attempt to obtain a named mutex.

description.para: Attempts to grab a named lock exclusively, and prevents other channels from obtaining the same lock. LOCK will wait for the lock to become available. Returns 1 if the lock was obtained or 0 on error.

note.para: To avoid the possibility of a deadlock, LOCK will only attempt to obtain the lock for 3 seconds if the channel already has another lock.
If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be executed from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols.

function.name: TRYLOCK
function.synopsis: Attempt to obtain a named mutex.

description.para: Attempts to grab a named lock exclusively, and prevents other channels from obtaining the same lock. Returns 1 if the lock was available or 0 otherwise.

note.para: If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be executed from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols.

function.name: UNLOCK
function.synopsis: Unlocks a named mutex.

description.para: Unlocks a previously locked mutex. Returns 1 if the channel had a lock or 0 otherwise.

note.para: It is generally unnecessary to unlock in a hangup routine, as any locks held are automatically freed when the channel is destroyed.
If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be executed from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols.

function.name: TIMEOUT
function.synopsis: Gets or sets timeouts on the channel. Timeout values are in seconds.

parameter.name: timeouttype
parameter.para: The timeout that will be manipulated. The possible timeout types are: absolute, digit or response

description.para: The timeouts that can be manipulated are:
absolute: The absolute maximum amount of time permitted for a call. Setting of 0 disables the timeout.

digit: The maximum amount of time permitted between digits when the user is typing in an extension. When this timeout expires, after the user has started to type in an extension, the extension will be considered complete, and will be interpreted. Note that if an extension typed in is valid, it will not have to timeout to be tested, so typically at the expiry of this timeout, the extension will be considered invalid (and thus control would be passed to the i extension, or if it doesn't exist the call would be terminated). The default timeout is 5 seconds.

response: The maximum amount of time permitted after falling through a series of priorities for a channel in which the user may begin typing an extension. If the user does not type an extension in this amount of time, control will pass to the t extension if it exists, and if not the call would be terminated. The default timeout is 10 seconds.

function.name: CALLCOMPLETION
function.synopsis: Get or set a call completion configuration parameter for a channel.

parameter.name: option
parameter.para: The allowable options are:

description.para:
The CALLCOMPLETION function can be used to get or set a call completion configuration parameter for a channel. Note that setting a configuration parameter will only change the parameter for the duration of the call.
For more information see doc/AST.pdf. For more information on call completion parameters, see configs/ccss.conf.sample.

function.name: EXTENSION_STATE
function.synopsis: Get an extension's state.

parameter.name: context
parameter.para: If it is not specified defaults to default.

description.para: The EXTENSION_STATE function can be used to retrieve the state from any hinted extension. For example:
NoOp(1234@default has state ${EXTENSION_STATE(1234)})
NoOp(4567@home has state ${EXTENSION_STATE(4567@home)})
The possible values returned by this function are:
UNKNOWN | NOT_INUSE | INUSE | BUSY | INVALID | UNAVAILABLE | RINGING | RINGINUSE | HOLDINUSE | ONHOLD

function.name: DB
function.synopsis: Read from or write to the Asterisk database.

description.para: This function will read from or write a value to the Asterisk database. On a read, this function returns the corresponding value from the database, or blank if it does not exist. Reading a database value will also set the variable DB_RESULT. If you wish to find out if an entry exists, use the DB_EXISTS function.

function.name: DB_EXISTS
function.synopsis: Check to see if a key exists in the Asterisk database.

description.para: This function will check to see if a key exists in the Asterisk database. If it exists, the function will return 1. If not, it will return 0. Checking for existence of a database key will also set the variable DB_RESULT to the key's value if it exists.

function.name: DB_KEYS
function.synopsis: Obtain a list of keys within the Asterisk database.

description.para: This function will return a comma-separated list of keys existing at the prefix specified within the Asterisk database. If no argument is provided, then a list of key families will be returned.

function.name: DB_DELETE
function.synopsis: Return a value from the database and delete it.

description.para: This function will retrieve a value from the Asterisk database and then remove that key from the database. DB_RESULT will be set to the key's value if it exists.

note.para: If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be read from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols. It can, however, be executed as a write operation (DB_DELETE(family, key)=ignored)

function.name: PITCH_SHIFT
function.synopsis: Pitch shift both tx and rx audio streams on a channel.

parameter.name: channel direction
parameter.para: Direction can be either rx, tx, or both. The direction can either be set to a valid floating point number between 0.1 and 4.0 or one of the enum values listed below. A value of 1.0 has no effect. Greater than 1 raises the pitch. Lower than 1 lowers the pitch.
The pitch amount can also be set by the following values

description.para: Examples:
exten => 1,1,Set(PITCH_SHIFT(tx)=highest); raises pitch an octave
exten => 1,1,Set(PITCH_SHIFT(rx)=higher) ; raises pitch more
exten => 1,1,Set(PITCH_SHIFT(both)=high) ; raises pitch
exten => 1,1,Set(PITCH_SHIFT(rx)=low) ; lowers pitch
exten => 1,1,Set(PITCH_SHIFT(tx)=lower) ; lowers pitch more
exten => 1,1,Set(PITCH_SHIFT(both)=lowest) ; lowers pitch an octave
exten => 1,1,Set(PITCH_SHIFT(rx)=0.8) ; lowers pitch
exten => 1,1,Set(PITCH_SHIFT(tx)=1.5) ; raises pitch

function.name: IFMODULE
function.synopsis: Checks if an Asterisk module is loaded in memory.

parameter.name: modulename.so
parameter.para: Module name complete with .so

description.para: Checks if a module is loaded. Use the full module name as shown by the list in module list. Returns 1 if module exists in memory, otherwise 0

function.name: GLOBAL
function.synopsis: Gets or sets the global variable specified.

parameter.name: varname
parameter.para: Global variable name

description.para: Set or get the value of a global variable specified in varname

function.name: SHARED
function.synopsis: Gets or sets the shared variable specified.

parameter.name: varname
parameter.para: Variable name

parameter.name: channel
parameter.para: If not specified will default to current channel. It is the complete channel name: SIP/12-abcd1234 or the prefix only SIP/12.

description.para: Implements a shared variable area, in which you may share variables between channels.
The variables used in this space are separate from the general namespace of the channel and thus SHARED(foo) and foo represent two completely different variables, despite sharing the same name.

Finally, realize that there is an inherent race between channels operating at the same time, fiddling with each others' internal variables, which is why this special variable namespace exists; it is to remind you that variables in the SHARED namespace may change at any time, without warning. You should therefore take special care to ensure that when using the SHARED namespace, you retrieve the variable and store it in a regular channel variable before using it in a set of calculations (or you might be surprised by the result).

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a variable is shared between channels.

parameter.name: Variable
parameter.para: The SHARED variable being set.

note.para: The variable name will always be enclosed with SHARED()

parameter.name: Value
parameter.para: The new value of the variable.

function.name: CURL
function.synopsis: Retrieve content from a remote web or ftp server

parameter.name: url
parameter.para: The full URL for the resource to retrieve.

parameter.name: post-data
parameter.para: If specified, an HTTP POST will be performed with the content of post-data, instead of an HTTP GET (default).

description.para: When this function is read, a HTTP GET (by default) will be used to retrieve the contents of the provided url. The contents are returned as the result of the function.
When this function is written to, a HTTP GET will be used to retrieve the contents of the provided url. The value written to the function specifies the destination file of the cURL'd resource.

note.para: If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be written to from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols. Read operations are unaffected.

function.name: CURLOPT
function.synopsis: Sets various options for future invocations of CURL.

enum.name: cookie
enum.para: A cookie to send with the request. Multiple cookies are supported.

enum.name: conntimeout
enum.para: Number of seconds to wait for a connection to succeed

enum.name: dnstimeout
enum.para: Number of seconds to wait for DNS to be resolved

enum.name: ftptext
enum.para: For FTP URIs, force a text transfer (boolean)

enum.name: ftptimeout
enum.para: For FTP URIs, number of seconds to wait for a server response

enum.name: header
enum.para: Include header information in the result (boolean)

enum.name: httptimeout
enum.para: For HTTP(S) URIs, number of seconds to wait for a server response

enum.name: maxredirs
enum.para: Maximum number of redirects to follow

enum.name: proxy
enum.para: Hostname or IP address to use as a proxy server

enum.name: proxyuserpwd
enum.para: A username:password combination to use for authenticating requests through a proxy

enum.name: referer
enum.para: Referer URL to use for the request

enum.name: useragent
enum.para: UserAgent string to use for the request

enum.name: userpwd
enum.para: A username:password to use for authentication when the server response to an initial request indicates a 401 status code.

enum.name: ssl_verifypeer
enum.para: Whether to verify the server certificate against a list of known root certificate authorities (boolean).

enum.name: hashcompat
enum.para: Assuming the responses will be in key1=value1&key2=value2 format, reformat the response such that it can be used by the HASH function.

enum.name: legacy
enum.para: Also translate + to the space character, in violation of current RFC standards.

description.para: Options may be set globally or per channel. Per-channel settings will override global settings.

function.name: AST_CONFIG
function.synopsis: Retrieve a variable from a configuration file.

parameter.name: index
parameter.para: If there are multiple variables with the same name, you can specify 0 for the first item (default), -1 for the last item, or any other number for that specific item. -1 is useful when the variable is derived from a template and you want the effective value (the last occurrence), not the value from the template (the first occurrence).

description.para: This function reads a variable from an Asterisk configuration file.

function.name: PRESENCE_STATE
function.synopsis: Get or Set a presence state.

parameter.name: provider
parameter.para: The provider of the presence, such as CustomPresence

parameter.name: field
parameter.para: Which field of the presence state information is wanted.

option.name: value
option.para: The current presence, such as away

option.name: subtype
option.para: Further information about the current presence

option.name: message
option.para: A custom message that may indicate further details about the presence

option.name: e
option.para: On Write - Use this option when the subtype and message provided are Base64 encoded. The values will be stored encoded within Asterisk, but all consumers of the presence state (e.g. the SIP presence event package) will receive decoded values.
On Read - Retrieves unencoded message/subtype in Base64 encoded form.

description.para: The PRESENCE_STATE function can be used to retrieve the presence from any presence provider. For example:
NoOp(SIP/mypeer has presence ${PRESENCE_STATE(SIP/mypeer,value)})
NoOp(Conference number 1234 has presence message ${PRESENCE_STATE(MeetMe:1234,message)})
The PRESENCE_STATE function can also be used to set custom presence state from the dialplan. The CustomPresence: prefix must be used. For example:
Set(PRESENCE_STATE(CustomPresence:lamp1)=away,temporary,Out to lunch)
Set(PRESENCE_STATE(CustomPresence:lamp2)=dnd,,Trying to get work done)
Set(PRESENCE_STATE(CustomPresence:lamp3)=xa,T24gdmFjYXRpb24=,,e)
Set(BASE64_LAMP3_PRESENCE=${PRESENCE_STATE(CustomPresence:lamp3,subtype,e)})
You can subscribe to the status of a custom presence state using a hint in the dialplan:
exten => 1234,hint,,CustomPresence:lamp1
The possible values for both uses of this function are:
not_set | unavailable | available | away | xa | chat | dnd

function.name: DEVICE_STATE
function.synopsis: Get or Set a device state.

description.para: The DEVICE_STATE function can be used to retrieve the device state from any device state provider. For example:
NoOp(SIP/mypeer has state ${DEVICE_STATE(SIP/mypeer)})
NoOp(Conference number 1234 has state ${DEVICE_STATE(MeetMe:1234)})
The DEVICE_STATE function can also be used to set custom device state from the dialplan. The Custom: prefix must be used. For example:
Set(DEVICE_STATE(Custom:lamp1)=BUSY)
Set(DEVICE_STATE(Custom:lamp2)=NOT_INUSE)
You can subscribe to the status of a custom device state using a hint in the dialplan:
exten => 1234,hint,Custom:lamp1
The possible values for both uses of this function are:
UNKNOWN | NOT_INUSE | INUSE | BUSY | INVALID | UNAVAILABLE | RINGING | RINGINUSE | ONHOLD

function.name: HINT
function.synopsis: Get the devices set for a dialplan hint.

option.name: n
option.para: Retrieve name on the hint instead of list of devices.

description.para: The HINT function can be used to retrieve the list of devices that are mapped to a dialplan hint. For example:
NoOp(Hint for Extension 1234 is ${HINT(1234)})

function.name: MATH
function.synopsis: Performs Mathematical Functions.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.para: Is of the form: number1opnumber2 where the possible values for op are:
+,-,/,*,%,<<,>>,^,AND,OR,XOR,<,>,<=,>=,== (and behave as their C equivalents)

parameter.name: type
parameter.para: Wanted type of result:
f, float - float(default)
i, int - integer
h, hex - hex
c, char - char

description.para: Performs mathematical functions based on two parameters and an operator. The returned value type is type
Example: Set(i=${MATH(123%16,int)}) - sets var i=11

function.name: INC
function.synopsis: Increments the value of a variable, while returning the updated value to the dialplan

parameter.name: variable
parameter.para: The variable name to be manipulated, without the braces.

description.para: Increments the value of a variable, while returning the updated value to the dialplan
Example: INC(MyVAR) - Increments MyVar
Note: INC(${MyVAR}) - Is wrong, as INC expects the variable name, not its value

function.name: DEC
function.synopsis: Decrements the value of a variable, while returning the updated value to the dialplan

parameter.name: variable
parameter.para: The variable name to be manipulated, without the braces.

description.para: Decrements the value of a variable, while returning the updated value to the dialplan
Example: DEC(MyVAR) - Decrements MyVar
Note: DEC(${MyVAR}) - Is wrong, as DEC expects the variable name, not its value

function.name: FIELDQTY
function.synopsis: Count the fields with an arbitrary delimiter

description.para: The delimiter may be specified as a special or extended ASCII character, by encoding it. The characters \n, \r, and \t are all recognized as the newline, carriage return, and tab characters, respectively. Also, octal and hexadecimal specifications are recognized by the patterns \0nnn and \xHH, respectively. For example, if you wanted to encode a comma as the delimiter, you could use either \054 or \x2C.
Example: If ${example} contains ex-amp-le, then ${FIELDQTY(example,-)} returns 3.

function.name: FIELDNUM
function.synopsis: Return the 1-based offset of a field in a list

description.para: Search the variable named varname for the string value delimited by delim and return a 1-based offset as to its location. If not found or an error occured, return 0.

The delimiter may be specified as a special or extended ASCII character, by encoding it. The characters \n, \r, and \t are all recognized as the newline, carriage return, and tab characters, respectively. Also, octal and hexadecimal specifications are recognized by the patterns \0nnn and \xHH, respectively. For example, if you wanted to encode a comma as the delimiter, you could use either \054 or \x2C.
Example: If ${example} contains ex-amp-le, then ${FIELDNUM(example,-,amp)} returns 2.

function.name: LISTFILTER
function.synopsis: Remove an item from a list, by name.

description.para: Remove value from the list contained in the varname variable, where the list delimiter is specified by the delim parameter. This is very useful for removing a single channel name from a list of channels, for example.

function.name: FILTER
function.synopsis: Filter the string to include only the allowed characters

description.para: Permits all characters listed in allowed-chars, filtering all others outs. In addition to literally listing the characters, you may also use ranges of characters (delimited by a -
Hexadecimal characters started with a \x(i.e. \x20)
Octal characters started with a \0 (i.e. \040)
Also \t,\n and \r are recognized.

note.para: If you want the - character it needs to be prefixed with a \

function.name: REPLACE
function.synopsis: Replace a set of characters in a given string with another character.

description.para: Iterates through a string replacing all the find-chars with replace-char. replace-char may be either empty or contain one character. If empty, all find-chars will be deleted from the output.

note.para: The replacement only occurs in the output. The original variable is not altered.

function.name: STRREPLACE
function.synopsis: Replace instances of a substring within a string with another string.

description.para: Searches for all instances of the find-string in provided variable and replaces them with replace-string. If replace-string is an empty string, this will effecively delete that substring. If max-replacements is specified, this function will stop after performing replacements max-replacements times.

note.para: The replacement only occurs in the output. The original variable is not altered.

function.name: PASSTHRU
function.synopsis: Pass the given argument back as a value.

description.para: Literally returns the given string. The intent is to permit other dialplan functions which take a variable name as an argument to be able to take a literal string, instead.

note.para: The functions which take a variable name need to be passed var and not ${var}. Similarly, use PASSTHRU() and not ${PASSTHRU()}.

description.para: Example: ${CHANNEL} contains SIP/321-1
${CUT(PASSTHRU(${CUT(CHANNEL,-,1)}),/,2)}) will return 321

function.name: REGEX
function.synopsis: Check string against a regular expression.

description.para: Return 1 on regular expression match or 0 otherwise

Please note that the space following the double quotes separating the regex from the data is optional and if present, is skipped. If a space is desired at the beginning of the data, then put two spaces there; the second will not be skipped.

application.name: ClearHash
application.synopsis: Clear the keys from a specified hashname.

description.para: Clears all keys out of the specified hashname.

function.name: HASH
function.synopsis: Implementation of a dialplan associative array

description.para: In two arguments mode, gets and sets values to corresponding keys within a named associative array. The single-argument mode will only work when assigned to from a function defined by func_odbc

function.name: HASHKEYS
function.synopsis: Retrieve the keys of the HASH() function.

description.para: Returns a comma-delimited list of the current keys of the associative array defined by the HASH() function. Note that if you iterate over the keys of the result, adding keys during iteration will cause the result of the HASHKEYS() function to change.

function.name: KEYPADHASH
function.synopsis: Hash the letters in string into equivalent keypad numbers.

description.para: Example: ${KEYPADHASH(Les)} returns "537"

function.name: ARRAY
function.synopsis: Allows setting multiple variables at once.

description.para: The comma-delimited list passed as a value to which the function is set will be interpreted as a set of values to which the comma-delimited list of variable names in the argument should be set.
Example: Set(ARRAY(var1,var2)=1,2) will set var1 to 1 and var2 to 2

function.name: STRPTIME
function.synopsis: Returns the epoch of the arbitrary date/time string structured as described by the format.

description.para: This is useful for converting a date into EPOCH time, possibly to pass to an application like SayUnixTime or to calculate the difference between the two date strings
Example: ${STRPTIME(2006-03-01 07:30:35,America/Chicago,%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S)} returns 1141219835

function.name: STRFTIME
function.synopsis: Returns the current date/time in the specified format.

description.para: STRFTIME supports all of the same formats as the underlying C function strftime(3). It also supports the following format: %[n]q - fractions of a second, with leading zeros.
Example: %3q will give milliseconds and %1q will give tenths of a second. The default is set at milliseconds (n=3). The common case is to use it in combination with %S, as in %S.%3q.

function.name: EVAL
function.synopsis: Evaluate stored variables

description.para: Using EVAL basically causes a string to be evaluated twice. When a variable or expression is in the dialplan, it will be evaluated at runtime. However, if the results of the evaluation is in fact another variable or expression, using EVAL will have it evaluated a second time.
Example: If the MYVAR contains OTHERVAR, then the result of ${EVAL( MYVAR)} in the dialplan will be the contents of OTHERVAR. Normally just putting MYVAR in the dialplan the result would be OTHERVAR.

function.name: TOUPPER
function.synopsis: Convert string to all uppercase letters.

description.para: Example: ${TOUPPER(Example)} returns "EXAMPLE"

function.name: TOLOWER
function.synopsis: Convert string to all lowercase letters.

description.para: Example: ${TOLOWER(Example)} returns "example"

function.name: LEN
function.synopsis: Return the length of the string given.

description.para: Example: ${LEN(example)} returns 7

function.name: QUOTE
function.synopsis: Quotes a given string, escaping embedded quotes as necessary

description.para: Example: ${QUOTE(ab"c"de)} will return ""ab\"c\"de""

function.name: CSV_QUOTE
function.synopsis: Quotes a given string for use in a CSV file, escaping embedded quotes as necessary

description.para: Example: ${CSV_QUOTE("a,b" 123)} will return """a,b"" 123"

function.name: SHIFT
function.synopsis: Removes and returns the first item off of a variable containing delimited text

description.para: Example:
exten => s,1,Set(array=one,two,three)
exten => s,n,While($["${SET(var=${SHIFT(array)})}" != ""])
exten => s,n,NoOp(var is ${var})
exten => s,n,EndWhile
This would iterate over each value in array, left to right, and would result in NoOp(var is one), NoOp(var is two), and NoOp(var is three) being executed.

function.name: POP
function.synopsis: Removes and returns the last item off of a variable containing delimited text

description.para: Example:
exten => s,1,Set(array=one,two,three)
exten => s,n,While($["${SET(var=${POP(array)})}" != ""])
exten => s,n,NoOp(var is ${var})
exten => s,n,EndWhile
This would iterate over each value in array, right to left, and would result in NoOp(var is three), NoOp(var is two), and NoOp(var is one) being executed.

function.name: PUSH
function.synopsis: Appends one or more values to the end of a variable containing delimited text

description.para: Example: Set(PUSH(array)=one,two,three) would append one, two, and three to the end of the values stored in the variable "array".

function.name: UNSHIFT
function.synopsis: Inserts one or more values to the beginning of a variable containing delimited text

description.para: Example: Set(UNSHIFT(array)=one,two,three) would insert one, two, and three before the values stored in the variable "array".

function.name: VMCOUNT
function.synopsis: Count the voicemails in a specified mailbox.

parameter.name: folder
parameter.para: If not specified, defaults to INBOX

description.para: Count the number of voicemails in a specified mailbox, you could also specify the mailbox folder.
Example: exten => s,1,Set(foo=${VMCOUNT(125@default)})

function.name: VOLUME
function.synopsis: Set the TX or RX volume of a channel.

parameter.name: direction
parameter.para: Must be TX or RX.

option.name: p
option.para: Enable DTMF volume control

description.para: The VOLUME function can be used to increase or decrease the tx or rx gain of any channel.
For example:
Set(VOLUME(TX)=3)
Set(VOLUME(RX)=2)
Set(VOLUME(TX,p)=3)
Set(VOLUME(RX,p)=3)

function.name: REALTIME
function.synopsis: RealTime Read/Write Functions.

parameter.name: delim1|field
parameter.para: Use delim1 with delim2 on read and field without delim2 on write
If we are reading and delim1 is not specified, defaults to ,

parameter.name: delim2
parameter.para: Parameter only used when reading, if not specified defaults to =

description.para: This function will read or write values from/to a RealTime repository. REALTIME(....) will read names/values from the repository, and REALTIME(....)= will write a new value/field to the repository. On a read, this function returns a delimited text string. The name/value pairs are delimited by delim1, and the name and value are delimited between each other with delim2. If there is no match, NULL will be returned by the function. On a write, this function will always return NULL.

function.name: REALTIME_STORE
function.synopsis: RealTime Store Function.

description.para: This function will insert a new set of values into the RealTime repository. If RT engine provides an unique ID of the stored record, REALTIME_STORE(...)=.. creates channel variable named RTSTOREID, which contains value of unique ID. Currently, a maximum of 30 field/value pairs is supported.

function.name: REALTIME_DESTROY
function.synopsis: RealTime Destroy Function.

description.para: This function acts in the same way as REALTIME(....) does, except that it destroys the matched record in the RT engine.

note.para: If live_dangerously in asterisk.conf is set to no, this function can only be read from the dialplan, and not directly from external protocols. It can, however, be executed as a write operation (REALTIME_DESTROY(family, fieldmatch)=ignored)

function.name: REALTIME_FIELD
function.synopsis: RealTime query function.

description.para: This function retrieves a single item, fieldname from the RT engine, where fieldmatch contains the value matchvalue. When written to, the REALTIME_FIELD() function performs identically to the REALTIME() function.

function.name: REALTIME_HASH
function.synopsis: RealTime query function.

description.para: This function retrieves a single record from the RT engine, where fieldmatch contains the value matchvalue and formats the output suitably, such that it can be assigned to the HASH() function. The HASH() function then provides a suitable method for retrieving each field value of the record.

function.name: HANGUPCAUSE
function.synopsis: Gets per-channel hangupcause information from the channel.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.para: The name of the channel for which to retrieve cause information.

parameter.name: type
parameter.para: Parameter describing which type of information is requested. Types are:

description.para: Gets technology-specific or translated Asterisk cause code information from the channel for the specified channel that resulted from a dial.

function.name: HANGUPCAUSE_KEYS
function.synopsis: Gets the list of channels for which hangup causes are available.

description.para: Returns a comma-separated list of channel names to be used with the HANGUPCAUSE function.

application.name: HangupCauseClear
application.synopsis: Clears hangup cause information from the channel that is available through HANGUPCAUSE.

description.para: Clears all channel-specific hangup cause information from the channel. This is never done automatically (i.e. for new Dial()s).

function.name: AUDIOHOOK_INHERIT
function.synopsis: DEPRECATED: Used to set whether an audiohook may be inherited to another channel. Due to architectural changes in Asterisk 12, audiohook inheritance is performed automatically and this function now lacks function.

description.para: Prior to Asterisk 12, masquerades would occur under all sorts of situations which were hard to predict. In Asterisk 12, masquerades only occur as a result of a small set of operations for which inheriting all audiohooks from the original channel is now safe. So in Asterisk 12.5+, all audiohooks are inherited without needing other controls expressing which audiohooks should be inherited under which conditions.

configObject.name: named_acl
configObject.synopsis: Options for configuring a named ACL

configOption.name: permit
configOption.synopsis: An address/subnet from which to allow access

configOption.name: deny
configOption.synopsis: An address/subnet from which to disallow access

configOption.name: featuredigittimeout
configOption.synopsis: Milliseconds allowed between digit presses when entering a feature code.

configOption.name: courtesytone
configOption.synopsis: Sound to play when automon or automixmon is activated

configOption.name: recordingfailsound
configOption.synopsis: Sound to play when automon or automixmon is attempted but fails to start

configOption.name: transferdigittimeout
configOption.synopsis: Seconds allowed between digit presses when dialing a transfer destination

configOption.name: atxfernoanswertimeout
configOption.synopsis: Seconds to wait for attended transfer destination to answer

configOption.name: atxferdropcall
configOption.synopsis: Hang up the call entirely if the attended transfer fails

description.para: When this option is set to no, then Asterisk will attempt to re-call the transferrer if the call to the transfer target fails. If the call to the transferrer fails, then Asterisk will wait atxferloopdelay milliseconds and then attempt to dial the transfer target again. This process will repeat until atxfercallbackretries attempts to re-call the transferrer have occurred.

When this option is set to yes, then Asterisk will not attempt to re-call the transferrer if the call to the transfer target fails. Asterisk will instead hang up all channels involved in the transfer.

configOption.name: atxferloopdelay
configOption.synopsis: Seconds to wait between attempts to re-dial transfer destination

configOption.name: atxfercallbackretries
configOption.synopsis: Number of times to re-attempt dialing a transfer destination

configOption.name: xfersound
configOption.synopsis: Sound to play to during transfer and transfer-like operations.

description.para: This sound will play to the transferrer and transfer target channels when an attended transfer completes. This sound is also played to channels when performing an AMI Bridge action.

configOption.name: xferfailsound
configOption.synopsis: Sound to play to a transferee when a transfer fails

configOption.name: atxferabort
configOption.synopsis: Digits to dial to abort an attended transfer attempt

description.para: This option is only available to the transferrer during an attended transfer operation. Aborting a transfer results in the transfer being cancelled and the original parties in the call being re-bridged.

configOption.name: atxfercomplete
configOption.synopsis: Digits to dial to complete an attended transfer

description.para: This option is only available to the transferrer during an attended transfer operation. Completing the transfer with a DTMF sequence is functionally equivalent to hanging up the transferrer channel during an attended transfer. The result is that the transfer target and transferees are bridged.

configOption.name: atxferthreeway
configOption.synopsis: Digits to dial to change an attended transfer into a three-way call

description.para: This option is only available to the transferrer during an attended transfer operation. Pressing this DTMF sequence will result in the transferrer, the transferees, and the transfer target all being in a single bridge together.

configOption.name: atxferswap
configOption.synopsis: Digits to dial to toggle who the transferrer is currently bridged to during an attended transfer

description.para: This option is only available to the transferrer during an attended transfer operation. Pressing this DTMF sequence will result in the transferrer swapping which party he is bridged with. For instance, if the transferrer is currently bridged with the transfer target, then pressing this DTMF sequence will cause the transferrer to be bridged with the transferees.

configOption.name: pickupexten
configOption.synopsis: Digits used for picking up ringing calls

description.para: In order for the pickup attempt to be successful, the party attempting to pick up the call must either have a namedpickupgroup in common with a ringing party's namedcallgroup or must have a pickupgroup in common with a ringing party's callgroup.

configOption.name: pickupsound
configOption.synopsis: Sound to play to picker when a call is picked up

configOption.name: pickupfailsound
configOption.synopsis: Sound to play to picker when a call cannot be picked up

configOption.name: transferdialattempts
configOption.synopsis: Number of dial attempts allowed when attempting a transfer

configOption.name: transferretrysound
configOption.synopsis: Sound that is played when an incorrect extension is dialed and the transferer should try again.

configOption.name: transferinvalidsound
configOption.synopsis: Sound that is played when an incorrect extension is dialed and the transferer has no attempts remaining.

configObject.name: featuremap
configObject.synopsis: DTMF options that can be triggered during bridged calls

configOption.name: atxfer
configOption.synopsis: DTMF sequence to initiate an attended transfer

description.para: The transferee parties will be placed on hold and the transferrer may dial an extension to reach a transfer target. During an attended transfer, the transferrer may consult with the transfer target before completing the transfer. Once the transferrer has hung up or pressed the atxfercomplete DTMF sequence, then the transferees and transfer target will be bridged.

configOption.name: blindxfer
configOption.synopsis: DTMF sequence to initiate a blind transfer

description.para: The transferee parties will be placed on hold and the transferrer may dial an extension to reach a transfer target. During a blind transfer, as soon as the transfer target is dialed, the transferrer is hung up.

configOption.name: disconnect
configOption.synopsis: DTMF sequence to disconnect the current call

description.para: Entering this DTMF sequence will cause the bridge to end, no matter the number of parties present

configOption.name: parkcall
configOption.synopsis: DTMF sequence to park a call

description.para: The parking lot used to park the call is determined by using either the PARKINGLOT channel variable or a configured value on the channel (provided by the channel driver) if the variable is not present. If no configured value on the channel is present, then "default" is used. The call is parked in the next available space in the parking lot.

configOption.name: automon
configOption.synopsis: DTMF sequence to start or stop monitoring a call

description.para: This will cause the channel that pressed the DTMF sequence to be monitored by the Monitor application. The format for the recording is determined by the TOUCH_MONITOR_FORMAT channel variable. If this variable is not specified, then wav is the default. The filename is constructed in the following manner:
prefix-timestamp-filename

where prefix is either the value of the TOUCH_MONITOR_PREFIX channel variable or auto if the variable is not set. The timestamp is a UNIX timestamp. The filename is either the value of the TOUCH_MONITOR channel variable or the callerID of the channels if the variable is not set.

configOption.name: automixmon
configOption.synopsis: DTMF sequence to start or stop mixmonitoring a call

description.para: Operation of the automixmon is similar to the automon feature, with the following exceptions: TOUCH_MIXMONITOR is used in place of TOUCH_MONITOR TOUCH_MIXMONITOR_FORMAT is used in place of TOUCH_MIXMONITOR There is no equivalent for TOUCH_MONITOR_PREFIX. "auto" is always how the filename begins.

configObject.name: applicationmap
configObject.synopsis: Section for defining custom feature invocations during a call

description.para: The applicationmap is an area where new custom features can be created. Items defined in the applicationmap are not automatically accessible to bridged parties. Access to the individual items is controled using the DYNAMIC_FEATURES channel variable. The DYNAMIC_FEATURES is a # separated list of either applicationmap item names or featuregroup names.

configOption.synopsis: A custom feature to invoke during a bridged call

description.para: Each item listed here is a comma-separated list of parameters that determine how a feature may be invoked during a call
Example:
eggs = *5,self,Playback(hello-world),default

This would create a feature called eggs that could be invoked during a call by pressing the *5. The party that presses the DTMF sequence would then trigger the Playback application to play the hello-world file. The application invocation would happen on the party that pressed the DTMF sequence since self is specified. The other parties in the bridge would hear the default music on hold class during the playback.
In addition to the syntax outlined in this documentation, a backwards-compatible alternative is also allowed. The following applicationmap lines are functionally identical:
eggs = *5,self,Playback(hello-world),default
eggs = *5,self,Playback,hello-world,default
eggs = *5,self,Playback,"hello-world",default

parameter.name: dtmf
parameter.para: The DTMF sequence used to trigger the option

parameter.name: activate_on
parameter.para: The party that the feature will be invoked on

option.name: self
option.para: Feature is invoked on party that presses the DTMF sequence

option.name: peer
option.para: Feature is invoked on other parties in the bridge

parameter.name: app
parameter.para: The dialplan application to run when the DTMF sequence is pressed

argument.name: app_args
argument.para: The arguments to the dialplan application to run

parameter.name: moh_class
parameter.para: Music on hold class to play to bridge participants that are not the target of the application invocation

configObject.name: featuregroup
configObject.synopsis: Groupings of items from the applicationmap

description.para: Feature groups allow for multiple applicationmap items to be grouped together. Like with individual applicationmap items, feature groups can be part of the DYNAMIC_FEATURES channel variable. In addition to creating groupings, the feature group section allows for the DTMF sequence used to invoke an applicationmap item to be overridden with a different sequence.

configOption.synopsis: Applicationmap item to place in the feature group

description.para: Each item here must be a name of an item in the applicationmap. The argument may either be a new DTMF sequence to use for the item or it may be left blank in order to use the DTMF sequence specified in the applicationmap. For example:
eggs => *1
bacon =>

would result in the applicationmap items eggs and bacon being in the featuregroup. The former would have its default DTMF trigger overridden with *1 and the latter would have the DTMF value specified in the applicationmap.

function.name: FEATURE
function.synopsis: Get or set a feature option on a channel.

parameter.name: option_name
parameter.para: The allowed values are:

enum.name: inherit
enum.para: Inherit feature settings made in FEATURE or FEATUREMAP to child channels.

description.para: When this function is used as a read, it will get the current value of the specified feature option for this channel. It will be the value of this option configured in features.conf if a channel specific value has not been set. This function can also be used to set a channel specific value for the supported feature options.

function.name: FEATUREMAP
function.synopsis: Get or set a feature map to a given value on a specific channel.

parameter.name: feature_name
parameter.para: The allowed values are:

description.para: When this function is used as a read, it will get the current digit sequence mapped to the specified feature for this channel. This value will be the one configured in features.conf if a channel specific value has not been set. This function can also be used to set a channel specific value for a feature mapping.

application.name: Set
application.synopsis: Set channel variable or function value.

description.para: This function can be used to set the value of channel variables or dialplan functions. When setting variables, if the variable name is prefixed with _, the variable will be inherited into channels created from the current channel. If the variable name is prefixed with __, the variable will be inherited into channels created from the current channel and all children channels.

note.para: If (and only if), in /etc/asterisk/asterisk.conf, you have a [compat] category, and you have app_set = 1.4 under that, then the behavior of this app changes, and strips surrounding quotes from the right hand side as it did previously in 1.4. The advantages of not stripping out quoting, and not caring about the separator characters (comma and vertical bar) were sufficient to make these changes in 1.6. Confusion about how many backslashes would be needed to properly protect separators and quotes in various database access strings has been greatly reduced by these changes.

application.name: MSet
application.synopsis: Set channel variable(s) or function value(s).

description.para: This function can be used to set the value of channel variables or dialplan functions. When setting variables, if the variable name is prefixed with _, the variable will be inherited into channels created from the current channel If the variable name is prefixed with __, the variable will be inherited into channels created from the current channel and all children channels. MSet behaves in a similar fashion to the way Set worked in 1.2/1.4 and is thus prone to doing things that you may not expect. For example, it strips surrounding double-quotes from the right-hand side (value). If you need to put a separator character (comma or vert-bar), you will need to escape them by inserting a backslash before them. Avoid its use if possible.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when an outbound registration completes.

parameter.para: The type of channel that was registered (or not).

parameter.name: Username
parameter.para: The username portion of the registration.

parameter.name: Domain
parameter.para: The address portion of the registration.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.para: The status of the registration request.

parameter.name: Cause
parameter.para: What caused the rejection of the request, if available.

function.name: MESSAGE
function.synopsis: Create a message or read fields from a message.

parameter.name: argument
parameter.para: Field of the message to get or set.

enum.name: to
enum.para: Read-only. The destination of the message. When processing an incoming message, this will be set to the destination listed as the recipient of the message that was received by Asterisk.

enum.name: from
enum.para: Read-only. The source of the message. When processing an incoming message, this will be set to the source of the message.

enum.name: custom_data
enum.para: Write-only. Mark or unmark all message headers for an outgoing message. The following values can be set:

enum.name: mark_all_outbound
enum.para: Mark all headers for an outgoing message.

enum.name: clear_all_outbound
enum.para: Unmark all headers for an outgoing message.

enum.name: body
enum.para: Read/Write. The message body. When processing an incoming message, this includes the body of the message that Asterisk received. When MessageSend() is executed, the contents of this field are used as the body of the outgoing message. The body will always be UTF-8.

description.para: This function will read from or write a value to a text message. It is used both to read the data out of an incoming message, as well as modify or create a message that will be sent outbound.

function.name: MESSAGE_DATA
function.synopsis: Read or write custom data attached to a message.

parameter.name: argument
parameter.para: Field of the message to get or set.

description.para: This function will read from or write a value to a text message. It is used both to read the data out of an incoming message, as well as modify a message that will be sent outbound.

note.para: If you want to set an outbound message to carry data in the current message, do Set(MESSAGE_DATA(key)=${MESSAGE_DATA(key)}).

parameter.name: to
parameter.para: A To URI for the message.

parameter.name: from
parameter.para: A From URI for the message if needed for the message technology being used to send this message. This can be a SIP(S) URI, such as Alice <sip:alice@atlanta.com>, a string in the format alice@atlanta.com, or simply a username such as alice.

description.para: Send a text message. The body of the message that will be sent is what is currently set to MESSAGE(body). The technology chosen for sending the message is determined based on a prefix to the to parameter.
This application sets the following channel variables:

variable.name: MESSAGE_SEND_STATUS
variable.para: This is the message delivery status returned by this application.
variable.value: No handler for the technology part of the URI was found.
The protocol handler reported that the URI was not valid.
Successfully passed on to the protocol handler, but delivery has not necessarily been guaranteed.
The protocol handler reported that it was unabled to deliver the message for some reason.

manager.name: MessageSend
manager.synopsis: Send an out of call message to an endpoint.

parameter.name: To
parameter.para: The URI the message is to be sent to.

parameter.name: From
parameter.para: A From URI for the message if needed for the message technology being used to send this message.

parameter.name: Body
parameter.para: The message body text. This must not contain any newlines as that conflicts with the AMI protocol.

parameter.name: Base64Body
parameter.para: Text bodies requiring the use of newlines have to be base64 encoded in this field. Base64Body will be decoded before being sent out. Base64Body takes precedence over Body.

parameter.name: Variable
parameter.para: Message variable to set, multiple Variable: headers are allowed. The header value is a comma separated list of name=value pairs.

manager.name: LocalOptimizeAway
manager.synopsis: Optimize away a local channel when possible.

parameter.name: Channel

description.para: A local channel created with "/n" will not automatically optimize away. Calling this command on the local channel will clear that flag and allow it to optimize away if it's bridged or when it becomes bridged.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.para: The current channel is bridged to the specified channel.

option.name: p
option.para: Play a courtesy tone to channel.

option.name: F
option.para: When the bridger hangs up, transfer the bridged party to the specified destination and start execution at that location.

note.para: Any channel variables you want the called channel to inherit from the caller channel must be prefixed with one or two underbars ('_').
This option will override the 'x' option

option.name: F
option.para: When the bridger hangs up, transfer the bridged party to the next priority of the current extension and start execution at that location.

note.para: Any channel variables you want the called channel to inherit from the caller channel must be prefixed with one or two underbars ('_').
Using this option from a Macro() or GoSub() might not make sense as there would be no return points.
This option will override the 'x' option

option.name: h
option.para: Allow the called party to hang up by sending the * DTMF digit.

option.name: H
option.para: Allow the calling party to hang up by pressing the * DTMF digit.

option.name: k
option.para: Allow the called party to enable parking of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for call parking in features.conf.

option.name: K
option.para: Allow the calling party to enable parking of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for call parking in features.conf.

option.name: L(x[:y][:z])
option.para: Limit the call to x ms. Play a warning when y ms are left. Repeat the warning every z ms. The following special variables can be used with this option:

variable.name: LIMIT_PLAYAUDIO_CALLER
variable.para: Play sounds to the caller. yes|no (default yes)

variable.name: LIMIT_PLAYAUDIO_CALLEE
variable.para: Play sounds to the callee. yes|no

variable.name: LIMIT_TIMEOUT_FILE
variable.para: File to play when time is up.

variable.name: LIMIT_CONNECT_FILE
variable.para: File to play when call begins.

variable.name: LIMIT_WARNING_FILE
variable.para: File to play as warning if y is defined. The default is to say the time remaining.

option.name: S(x)
option.para: Hang up the call after x seconds *after* the called party has answered the call.

option.name: t
option.para: Allow the called party to transfer the calling party by sending the DTMF sequence defined in features.conf.

option.name: T
option.para: Allow the calling party to transfer the called party by sending the DTMF sequence defined in features.conf.

option.name: w
option.para: Allow the called party to enable recording of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for one-touch recording in features.conf.

option.name: W
option.para: Allow the calling party to enable recording of the call by sending the DTMF sequence defined for one-touch recording in features.conf.

option.name: x
option.para: Cause the called party to be hung up after the bridge, instead of being restarted in the dialplan.

description.para: Allows the ability to bridge two channels via the dialplan.
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: BRIDGERESULT
variable.para: The result of the bridge attempt as a text string.

parameter.name: Channel1
parameter.para: Channel to Bridge to Channel2.

parameter.name: Channel2
parameter.para: Channel to Bridge to Channel1.

parameter.name: Tone
