description.para: Bridge together two channels already in the PBX.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when an RTCP packet is sent.

parameter.name: SSRC
parameter.para: The SSRC identifier for our stream

parameter.name: PT
parameter.para: The type of packet for this RTCP report.

parameter.name: To
parameter.para: The address the report is sent to.

parameter.name: ReportCount
parameter.para: The number of reports that were sent.
The report count determines the number of ReportX headers in the message. The X for each set of report headers will range from 0 to ReportCount - 1.

parameter.name: SentNTP
parameter.para: The time the sender generated the report. Only valid when PT is 200(SR).

parameter.name: SentRTP
parameter.para: The sender's last RTP timestamp. Only valid when PT is 200(SR).

parameter.name: SentPackets
parameter.para: The number of packets the sender has sent. Only valid when PT is 200(SR).

parameter.name: SentOctets
parameter.para: The number of bytes the sender has sent. Only valid when PT is 200(SR).

parameter.name: ReportXSourceSSRC
parameter.para: The SSRC for the source of this report block.

parameter.name: ReportXFractionLost
parameter.para: The fraction of RTP data packets from ReportXSourceSSRC lost since the previous SR or RR report was sent.

parameter.name: ReportXCumulativeLost
parameter.para: The total number of RTP data packets from ReportXSourceSSRC lost since the beginning of reception.

parameter.name: ReportXHighestSequence
parameter.para: The highest sequence number received in an RTP data packet from ReportXSourceSSRC.

parameter.name: ReportXSequenceNumberCycles
parameter.para: The number of sequence number cycles seen for the RTP data received from ReportXSourceSSRC.

parameter.name: ReportXIAJitter
parameter.para: An estimate of the statistical variance of the RTP data packet interarrival time, measured in timestamp units.

parameter.name: ReportXLSR
parameter.para: The last SR timestamp received from ReportXSourceSSRC. If no SR has been received from ReportXSourceSSRC, then 0.

parameter.name: ReportXDLSR
parameter.para: The delay, expressed in units of 1/65536 seconds, between receiving the last SR packet from ReportXSourceSSRC and sending this report.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when an RTCP packet is received.

parameter.name: SSRC
parameter.para: The SSRC identifier for the remote system

parameter.name: From
parameter.para: The address the report was received from.

parameter.name: RTT
parameter.para: Calculated Round-Trip Time in seconds

parameter.name: ReportCount
parameter.para: The number of reports that were received.
The report count determines the number of ReportX headers in the message. The X for each set of report headers will range from 0 to ReportCount - 1.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a call pickup occurs.
Raised when a blind transfer is complete.

parameter.name: Result
parameter.para: Indicates if the transfer was successful or if it failed.

enum.name: Invalid
enum.para: Invalid configuration for transfer (e.g. Not bridged)

note.para: A result of Success does not necessarily mean that a target was succesfully contacted. It means that a party was succesfully placed into the dialplan at the expected location.

parameter.name: IsExternal
parameter.para: Indicates if the transfer was performed outside of Asterisk. For instance, a channel protocol native transfer is external. A DTMF transfer is internal.

parameter.name: Context
parameter.para: Destination context for the blind transfer.

parameter.name: Extension
parameter.para: Destination extension for the blind transfer.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when an attended transfer is complete.

parameter.name: DestType
parameter.para: Indicates the method by which the attended transfer completed.

enum.name: Bridge
enum.para: The transfer was accomplished by merging two bridges into one.

enum.name: App
enum.para: The transfer was accomplished by having a channel or bridge run a dialplan application.

enum.name: Link
enum.para: The transfer was accomplished by linking two bridges together using a local channel pair.

enum.name: Threeway
enum.para: The transfer was accomplished by placing all parties into a threeway call.

parameter.name: DestBridgeUniqueid
parameter.para: Indicates the surviving bridge when bridges were merged to complete the transfer

note.para: This header is only present when DestType is Bridge or Threeway

parameter.name: DestApp
parameter.para: Indicates the application that is running when the transfer completes

note.para: This header is only present when DestType is App

parameter.name: DestTransfererChannel
parameter.para: The name of the surviving transferer channel when a transfer results in a threeway call

note.para: This header is only present when DestType is Threeway

description.para: The headers in this event attempt to describe all the major details of the attended transfer. The two transferer channels and the two bridges are determined based on their chronological establishment. So consider that Alice calls Bob, and then Alice transfers the call to Voicemail. The transferer and bridge headers would be arranged as follows:
OrigTransfererChannel: Alice's channel in the bridge with Bob.
OrigBridgeUniqueid: The bridge between Alice and Bob.
SecondTransfererChannel: Alice's channel that called Voicemail.
SecondBridgeUniqueid: Not present, since a call to Voicemail has no bridge.

Now consider if the order were reversed; instead of having Alice call Bob and transfer him to Voicemail, Alice instead calls her Voicemail and transfers that to Bob. The transferer and bridge headers would be arranged as follows:
OrigTransfererChannel: Alice's channel that called Voicemail.
OrigBridgeUniqueid: Not present, since a call to Voicemail has no bridge.
SecondTransfererChannel: Alice's channel in the bridge with Bob.
SecondBridgeUniqueid: The bridge between Alice and Bob.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a presence state changes

parameter.name: Presentity
parameter.para: The entity whose presence state has changed

parameter.name: Status
parameter.para: The new status of the presentity

parameter.name: Subtype
parameter.para: The new subtype of the presentity

parameter.name: Message
parameter.para: The new message of the presentity

description.para: This differs from the PresenceStatus event because this event is raised for all presence state changes, not only for changes that affect dialplan hints.

CDR is Call Detail Record, which provides logging services via a variety of pluggable backend modules. Detailed call information can be recorded to databases, files, etc. Useful for billing, fraud prevention, compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley aka The Enron Act, QOS evaluations, and more.

configObject.name: general
configObject.synopsis: Global settings applied to the CDR engine.

configOption.name: debug
configOption.synopsis: Enable/disable verbose CDR debugging.

description.para: When set to True, verbose updates of changes in CDR information will be logged. Note that this is only of use when debugging CDR behavior.

configOption.name: enable
configOption.synopsis: Enable/disable CDR logging.

description.para: Define whether or not to use CDR logging. Setting this to "no" will override any loading of backend CDR modules. Default is "yes".

configOption.name: unanswered
configOption.synopsis: Log calls that are never answered and don't set an outgoing party.

description.para: Define whether or not to log unanswered calls that don't involve an outgoing party. Setting this to "yes" will make calls to extensions that don't answer and don't set a side B channel (such as by using the Dial application) receive CDR log entries. If this option is set to "no", then those log entries will not be created. Unanswered calls which get offered to an outgoing line will always receive log entries regardless of this option, and that is the intended behavior.

configOption.name: congestion
configOption.synopsis: Log congested calls.

description.para: Define whether or not to log congested calls. Setting this to "yes" will report each call that fails to complete due to congestion conditions.

configOption.name: endbeforehexten
configOption.synopsis: Don't produce CDRs while executing hangup logic

description.para: As each CDR for a channel is finished, its end time is updated and the CDR is finalized. When a channel is hung up and hangup logic is present (in the form of a hangup handler or the h extension), a new CDR is generated for the channel. Any statistics are gathered from this new CDR. By enabling this option, no new CDR is created for the dialplan logic that is executed in h extensions or attached hangup handler subroutines. The default value is yes, indicating that a CDR will be generated during hangup logic.

configOption.name: initiatedseconds
configOption.synopsis: Count microseconds for billsec purposes

description.para: Normally, the billsec field logged to the CDR backends is simply the end time (hangup time) minus the answer time in seconds. Internally, asterisk stores the time in terms of microseconds and seconds. By setting initiatedseconds to yes, you can force asterisk to report any seconds that were initiated (a sort of round up method). Technically, this is when the microsecond part of the end time is greater than the microsecond part of the answer time, then the billsec time is incremented one second.

configOption.name: batch
configOption.synopsis: Submit CDRs to the backends for processing in batches

description.para: Define the CDR batch mode, where instead of posting the CDR at the end of every call, the data will be stored in a buffer to help alleviate load on the asterisk server.

warning.para: Use of batch mode may result in data loss after unsafe asterisk termination, i.e., software crash, power failure, kill -9, etc.

configOption.name: size
configOption.synopsis: The maximum number of CDRs to accumulate before triggering a batch

description.para: Define the maximum number of CDRs to accumulate in the buffer before posting them to the backend engines. batch must be set to yes.

configOption.name: time
configOption.synopsis: The maximum time to accumulate CDRs before triggering a batch

description.para: Define the maximum time to accumulate CDRs before posting them in a batch to the backend engines. If this time limit is reached, then it will post the records, regardless of the value defined for size. batch must be set to yes.

note.para: Time is expressed in seconds.

configOption.name: scheduleronly
configOption.synopsis: Post batched CDRs on their own thread instead of the scheduler

description.para: The CDR engine uses the internal asterisk scheduler to determine when to post records. Posting can either occur inside the scheduler thread, or a new thread can be spawned for the submission of every batch. For small batches, it might be acceptable to just use the scheduler thread, so set this to yes. For large batches, say anything over size=10, a new thread is recommended, so set this to no.

configOption.name: safeshutdown
configOption.synopsis: Block shutdown of Asterisk until CDRs are submitted

description.para: When shutting down asterisk, you can block until the CDRs are submitted. If you don't, then data will likely be lost. You can always check the size of the CDR batch buffer with the CLI cdr status command. To enable blocking on submission of CDR data during asterisk shutdown, set this to yes.

configOption.name: udptlstart
configOption.synopsis: The start of the UDPTL port range

configOption.name: udptlend
configOption.synopsis: The end of the UDPTL port range

configOption.name: udptlchecksums
configOption.synopsis: Whether to enable or disable UDP checksums on UDPTL traffic

configOption.name: udptlfecentries

configOption.name: udptlfecspan
configOption.synopsis: The span over which parity is calculated for FEC in a UDPTL packet

configOption.name: use_even_ports
configOption.synopsis: Whether to only use even-numbered UDPTL ports

configOption.name: t38faxudpec
configOption.synopsis: Removed

configOption.name: t38faxmaxdatagram
configOption.synopsis: Removed

parameter.name: delay
parameter.para: Asterisk will wait this number of milliseconds before returning to the dialplan after answering the call.

description.para: If the call has not been answered, this application will answer it. Otherwise, it has no effect on the call.

application.name: BackGround
application.synopsis: Play an audio file while waiting for digits of an extension to go to.

option.name: s
option.para: Causes the playback of the message to be skipped if the channel is not in the up state (i.e. it hasn't been answered yet). If this happens, the application will return immediately.

option.name: n
option.para: Don't answer the channel before playing the files.

option.name: m
option.para: Only break if a digit hit matches a one digit extension in the destination context.

parameter.name: langoverride
parameter.para: Explicitly specifies which language to attempt to use for the requested sound files.

parameter.name: context
parameter.para: This is the dialplan context that this application will use when exiting to a dialed extension.

description.para: This application will play the given list of files (do not put extension) while waiting for an extension to be dialed by the calling channel. To continue waiting for digits after this application has finished playing files, the WaitExten application should be used.
If one of the requested sound files does not exist, call processing will be terminated.
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: BACKGROUNDSTATUS
variable.para: The status of the background attempt as a text string.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: If specified, the calling channel will be hung up after the specified number of seconds. Otherwise, this application will wait until the calling channel hangs up.

description.para: This application will indicate the busy condition to the calling channel.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: If specified, the calling channel will be hung up after the specified number of seconds. Otherwise, this application will wait until the calling channel hangs up.

description.para: This application will indicate the congestion condition to the calling channel.

application.name: ExecIfTime
application.synopsis: Conditional application execution based on the current time.

description.para: This application will execute the specified dialplan application, with optional arguments, if the current time matches the given time specification.

application.name: Goto
application.synopsis: Jump to a particular priority, extension, or context.

description.para: This application will set the current context, extension, and priority in the channel structure. After it completes, the pbx engine will continue dialplan execution at the specified location. If no specific extension, or extension and context, are specified, then this application will just set the specified priority of the current extension.
At least a priority is required as an argument, or the goto will return a -1, and the channel and call will be terminated.

If the location that is put into the channel information is bogus, and asterisk cannot find that location in the dialplan, then the execution engine will try to find and execute the code in the i (invalid) extension in the current context. If that does not exist, it will try to execute the h extension. If neither the h nor i extensions have been defined, the channel is hung up, and the execution of instructions on the channel is terminated. What this means is that, for example, you specify a context that does not exist, then it will not be possible to find the h or i extensions, and the call will terminate!

argument.name: labeliftrue
argument.para: Continue at labeliftrue if the condition is true. Takes the form similar to Goto() of [[context,]extension,]priority.

argument.name: labeliffalse
argument.para: Continue at labeliffalse if the condition is false. Takes the form similar to Goto() of [[context,]extension,]priority.

description.para: This application will set the current context, extension, and priority in the channel structure based on the evaluation of the given condition. After this application completes, the pbx engine will continue dialplan execution at the specified location in the dialplan. The labels are specified with the same syntax as used within the Goto application. If the label chosen by the condition is omitted, no jump is performed, and the execution passes to the next instruction. If the target location is bogus, and does not exist, the execution engine will try to find and execute the code in the i (invalid) extension in the current context. If that does not exist, it will try to execute the h extension. If neither the h nor i extensions have been defined, the channel is hung up, and the execution of instructions on the channel is terminated. Remember that this command can set the current context, and if the context specified does not exist, then it will not be able to find any 'h' or 'i' extensions there, and the channel and call will both be terminated!.

application.name: GotoIfTime
application.synopsis: Conditional Goto based on the current time.

argument.name: labeliftrue
argument.para: Continue at labeliftrue if the condition is true. Takes the form similar to Goto() of [[context,]extension,]priority.

argument.name: labeliffalse
argument.para: Continue at labeliffalse if the condition is false. Takes the form similar to Goto() of [[context,]extension,]priority.

description.para: This application will set the context, extension, and priority in the channel structure based on the evaluation of the given time specification. After this application completes, the pbx engine will continue dialplan execution at the specified location in the dialplan. If the current time is within the given time specification, the channel will continue at labeliftrue. Otherwise the channel will continue at labeliffalse. If the label chosen by the condition is omitted, no jump is performed, and execution passes to the next instruction. If the target jump location is bogus, the same actions would be taken as for Goto. Further information on the time specification can be found in examples illustrating how to do time-based context includes in the dialplan.

application.name: ImportVar
application.synopsis: Import a variable from a channel into a new variable.

description.para: This application imports a variable from the specified channel (as opposed to the current one) and stores it as a variable (newvar) in the current channel (the channel that is calling this application). Variables created by this application have the same inheritance properties as those created with the Set application.

parameter.name: causecode
parameter.para: If a causecode is given the channel's hangup cause will be set to the given value.

description.para: This application will hang up the calling channel.

parameter.name: n
parameter.para: If specified, then Incomplete will not attempt to answer the channel first.

note.para: Most channel types need to be in Answer state in order to receive DTMF.

description.para: Signals the PBX routines that the previous matched extension is incomplete and that further input should be allowed before matching can be considered to be complete. Can be used within a pattern match when certain criteria warrants a longer match.

parameter.name: text
parameter.para: Any text provided can be viewed at the Asterisk CLI.

description.para: This application does nothing. However, it is useful for debugging purposes.
This method can be used to see the evaluations of variables or functions without having any effect.
This application will request that a proceeding message be provided to the calling channel.
This application will request that in-band progress information be provided to the calling channel.
This application will jump to the e extension in the current context, setting the dialplan function EXCEPTION(). If the e extension does not exist, the call will hangup.
This application will request that the channel indicate a ringing tone to the user.

This application will play the sounds that correspond to the letters of the given string. If the channel variable SAY_DTMF_INTERRUPT is set to 'true' (case insensitive), then this application will react to DTMF in the same way as Background.

enum.name: a
enum.para: Case sensitive (all) pronunciation. (Ex: SayAlphaCase(a,aBc); - lowercase a uppercase b lowercase c).

enum.name: l
enum.para: Case sensitive (lower) pronunciation. (Ex: SayAlphaCase(l,aBc); - lowercase a b lowercase c).

enum.name: n
enum.para: Case insensitive pronunciation. Equivalent to SayAlpha. (Ex: SayAlphaCase(n,aBc) - a b c).

enum.name: u
enum.para: Case sensitive (upper) pronunciation. (Ex: SayAlphaCase(u,aBc); - a uppercase b c).

description.para: This application will play the sounds that correspond to the letters of the given string. Optionally, a casetype may be specified. This will be used for case-insensitive or case-sensitive pronunciations. If the channel variable SAY_DTMF_INTERRUPT is set to 'true' (case insensitive), then this application will react to DTMF in the same way as Background.

This application will play the sounds that correspond to the digits of the given number. This will use the language that is currently set for the channel. If the channel variable SAY_DTMF_INTERRUPT is set to 'true' (case insensitive), then this application will react to DTMF in the same way as Background.

This application will play the sounds that correspond to the given digits. Optionally, a gender may be specified. This will use the language that is currently set for the channel. See the CHANNEL() function for more information on setting the language for the channel. If the channel variable SAY_DTMF_INTERRUPT is set to 'true' (case insensitive), then this application will react to DTMF in the same way as Background.

This application will play the sounds from the phonetic alphabet that correspond to the letters in the given string. If the channel variable SAY_DTMF_INTERRUPT is set to 'true' (case insensitive), then this application will react to DTMF in the same way as Background.
This application will set the channel's AMA Flags for billing purposes.

warning.para: This application is deprecated. Please use the CHANNEL function instead.

parameter.name: seconds
parameter.para: Can be passed with fractions of a second. For example, 1.5 will ask the application to wait for 1.5 seconds.

description.para: This application waits for a specified number of seconds.

application.name: WaitDigit

parameter.name: seconds
parameter.para: Can be passed with fractions of a second. For example, 1.5 will ask the application to wait for 1.5 seconds.

The timeout passed before any acceptable digits were received.

For example, you may wish to evaluate whether a location will correctly identify to callers that the area is closed on Christmas Day, when Christmas would otherwise fall on a day when the office is normally open.

The special variable name TEMPLATES can be used to control whether templates are included. Passing include as the value will include templates along with normal categories. Passing restrict as the value will restrict the operation to ONLY templates. Not specifying a TEMPLATES expression results in the default behavior which is to not include templates.

parameter.para: The transferer channel.

description.para: Cancel an attended transfer. Note, this uses the configured cancel attended transfer feature option (atxferabort) to cancel the transfer. If not available this action will fail.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Channel name to call.

parameter.name: Exten
parameter.para: Extension to use (requires Context and Priority)

parameter.name: Context
parameter.para: Context to use (requires Exten and Priority)

parameter.name: Priority
parameter.para: Priority to use (requires Exten and Context)

parameter.name: Application
parameter.para: Application to execute.

parameter.name: Data
parameter.para: Data to use (requires Application).

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.para: How long to wait for call to be answered (in ms.).

parameter.name: CallerID
parameter.para: Caller ID to be set on the outgoing channel.

parameter.name: Variable
parameter.para: Channel variable to set, multiple Variable: headers are allowed.

parameter.name: Account
parameter.para: Account code.

parameter.name: EarlyMedia
parameter.para: Set to true to force call bridge on early media..

parameter.name: Async
parameter.para: Set to true for fast origination.

parameter.name: Codecs
parameter.para: Comma-separated list of codecs to use for this call.

parameter.name: ChannelId
parameter.para: Channel UniqueId to be set on the channel.

parameter.name: OtherChannelId
parameter.para: Channel UniqueId to be set on the second local channel.

description.para: Generates an outgoing call to a Extension/Context/Priority or Application/Data

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised in response to an Originate command.

parameter.name: Command
parameter.para: Asterisk CLI command to run.

description.para: Run a CLI command.

parameter.name: Exten
parameter.para: Extension to check state on.

parameter.name: Context
parameter.para: Context for extension.

description.para: Report the extension state for given extension. If the extension has a hint, will use devicestate to check the status of the device connected to the extension.
Will return an Extension Status message. The response will include the hint for the extension and the status.

parameter.name: Provider
parameter.para: Presence Provider to check the state of

description.para: Report the presence state for the given presence provider.
Will return a Presence State message. The response will include the presence state and, if set, a presence subtype and custom message.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Channel name to hangup.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.para: Maximum duration of the call (sec).

description.para: Hangup a channel after a certain time. Acknowledges set time with Timeout Set message.

parameter.name: Mailbox
parameter.para: Full mailbox ID mailbox@vm-context.

description.para: Checks a voicemail account for status.
Returns whether there are messages waiting.
Message: Mailbox Status.
Mailbox: mailboxid.
Waiting: 0 if messages waiting, 1 if no messages waiting.

parameter.name: Mailbox
parameter.para: Full mailbox ID mailbox@vm-context.

description.para: Checks a voicemail account for new messages.
Returns number of urgent, new and old messages.
Message: Mailbox Message Count
Mailbox: mailboxid
UrgentMessages: count
NewMessages: count
OldMessages: count
Returns the action name and synopsis for every action that is available to the user.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Channel to send message to.

parameter.name: Message
parameter.para: Message to send.

description.para: Sends A Text Message to a channel while in a call.

parameter.name: UserEvent
parameter.para: Event string to send.

parameter.name: Header1
parameter.para: Content1.

parameter.name: HeaderN
parameter.para: ContentN.

description.para: Send an event to manager sessions.

manager.name: WaitEvent
manager.synopsis: Wait for an event to occur.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.para: Maximum time (in seconds) to wait for events, -1 means forever.

description.para: This action will ellicit a Success response. Whenever a manager event is queued. Once WaitEvent has been called on an HTTP manager session, events will be generated and queued.
Query for Core PBX settings.
Query for Core PBX status.

parameter.name: Module
parameter.para: Name of the module to reload.

description.para: Send a reload event.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised in response to a CoreShowChannels command.

parameter.name: BridgeId
parameter.para: Identifier of the bridge the channel is in, may be empty if not in one

parameter.name: Application
parameter.para: Application currently executing on the channel

parameter.name: ApplicationData
parameter.para: Data given to the currently executing application

parameter.name: Duration
parameter.para: The amount of time the channel has existed

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised at the end of the CoreShowChannel list produced by the CoreShowChannels command.

parameter.name: EventList
parameter.para: Conveys the status of the command reponse list

parameter.name: ListItems
parameter.para: The total number of list items produced

description.para: List currently defined channels and some information about them.

manager.name: LoggerRotate
manager.synopsis: Reload and rotate the Asterisk logger.

description.para: Reload and rotate the logger. Analogous to the CLI command 'logger rotate'.

parameter.name: Module
parameter.para: Asterisk module name (including .so extension) or subsystem identifier:

parameter.name: LoadType
parameter.para: The operation to be done on module. Subsystem identifiers may only be reloaded.
If no module is specified for a reload loadtype, all modules are reloaded.

description.para: Loads, unloads or reloads an Asterisk module in a running system.

parameter.name: Module
parameter.para: Asterisk module name (not including extension).

description.para: Checks if Asterisk module is loaded. Will return Success/Failure. For success returns, the module revision number is included.

manager.name: AOCMessage
manager.synopsis: Generate an Advice of Charge message on a channel.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Channel name to generate the AOC message on.

parameter.name: ChannelPrefix
parameter.para: Partial channel prefix. By using this option one can match the beginning part of a channel name without having to put the entire name in. For example if a channel name is SIP/snom-00000001 and this value is set to SIP/snom, then that channel matches and the message will be sent. Note however that only the first matched channel has the message sent on it.

parameter.name: MsgType
parameter.para: Defines what type of AOC message to create, AOC-D or AOC-E

parameter.name: ChargeType
parameter.para: Defines what kind of charge this message represents.

parameter.name: UnitAmount(0)
parameter.para: This represents the amount of units charged. The ETSI AOC standard specifies that this value along with the optional UnitType value are entries in a list. To accommodate this these values take an index value starting at 0 which can be used to generate this list of unit entries. For Example, If two unit entires were required this could be achieved by setting the paramter UnitAmount(0)=1234 and UnitAmount(1)=5678. Note that UnitAmount at index 0 is required when ChargeType=Unit, all other entries in the list are optional.

parameter.name: UnitType(0)
parameter.para: Defines the type of unit. ETSI AOC standard specifies this as an integer value between 1 and 16, but this value is left open to accept any positive integer. Like the UnitAmount parameter, this value represents a list entry and has an index parameter that starts at 0.

parameter.name: CurrencyName
parameter.para: Specifies the currency's name. Note that this value is truncated after 10 characters.

parameter.name: CurrencyAmount
parameter.para: Specifies the charge unit amount as a positive integer. This value is required when ChargeType==Currency.

parameter.name: CurrencyMultiplier
parameter.para: Specifies the currency multiplier. This value is required when ChargeType==Currency.

parameter.name: TotalType
parameter.para: Defines what kind of AOC-D total is represented.

parameter.name: AOCBillingId
parameter.para: Represents a billing ID associated with an AOC-D or AOC-E message. Note that only the first 3 items of the enum are valid AOC-D billing IDs

parameter.name: ChargingAssociationId
parameter.para: Charging association identifier. This is optional for AOC-E and can be set to any value between -32768 and 32767

parameter.name: ChargingAssociationNumber
parameter.para: Represents the charging association party number. This value is optional for AOC-E.

parameter.name: ChargingAssociationPlan
parameter.para: Integer representing the charging plan associated with the ChargingAssociationNumber. The value is bits 7 through 1 of the Q.931 octet containing the type-of-number and numbering-plan-identification fields.

description.para: Generates an AOC-D or AOC-E message on a channel.

function.name: AMI_CLIENT
function.synopsis: Checks attributes of manager accounts

parameter.name: loginname
parameter.para: Login name, specified in manager.conf

parameter.name: field
parameter.para: The manager account attribute to return

enum.name: sessions
enum.para: The number of sessions for this AMI account

description.para: Currently, the only supported parameter is "sessions" which will return the current number of active sessions for this AMI account.

manager.name: Filter
manager.synopsis: Dynamically add filters for the current manager session.

parameter.name: Filter
parameter.para: Filters can be whitelist or blacklist
Example whitelist filter: "Event: Newchannel"
Example blacklist filter: "!Channel: DAHDI.*"

This filter option is used to whitelist or blacklist events per user to be reported with regular expressions and are allowed if both the regex matches and the user has read access as defined in manager.conf. Filters are assumed to be for whitelisting unless preceeded by an exclamation point, which marks it as being black. Evaluation of the filters is as follows:
- If no filters are configured all events are reported as normal.
- If there are white filters only: implied black all filter processed first, then white filters.
- If there are black filters only: implied white all filter processed first, then black filters.
- If there are both white and black filters: implied black all filter processed first, then white filters, and lastly black filters.

description.para: The filters added are only used for the current session. Once the connection is closed the filters are removed.
This comand requires the system permission because this command can be used to create filters that may bypass filters defined in manager.conf

manager.name: FilterList
manager.synopsis: Show current event filters for this session

description.para: The filters displayed are for the current session. Only those filters defined in manager.conf will be present upon starting a new session.

manager.name: BlindTransfer
manager.synopsis: Blind transfer channel(s) to the given destination

description.para: Redirect all channels currently bridged to the specified channel to the specified destination.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a hint changes due to a device state change.

parameter.name: Exten
parameter.para: Name of the extension.

parameter.name: Context
parameter.para: Context that owns the extension.

parameter.name: Hint
parameter.para: Hint set for the extension

parameter.name: Status
parameter.para: Numerical value of the extension status. Extension status is determined by the combined device state of all items contained in the hint.

enum.para: The extension was removed from the dialplan.
The extension's hint was removed from the dialplan.
Idle - Related device(s) are in an idle state.
InUse - Related device(s) are in active calls but may take more calls.
Busy - Related device(s) are in active calls and may not take any more calls.
Unavailable - Related device(s) are not reachable.
Ringing - Related device(s) are currently ringing.
InUse&Ringing - Related device(s) are currently ringing and in active calls.
Hold - Related device(s) are currently on hold.
InUse&Hold - Related device(s) are currently on hold and in active calls.

parameter.name: StatusText
parameter.para: Text representation of Status.

enum.name: Unknown
enum.para: Status does not match any of the above values.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a hint changes due to a presence state change.

description.para: The Endpoint is the primary configuration object. It contains the core SIP related options only, endpoints are NOT dialable entries of their own. Communication with another SIP device is accomplished via Addresses of Record (AoRs) which have one or more contacts associated with them. Endpoints NOT configured to use a transport will default to first transport found in pjsip.conf that matches its type.

Example: An Endpoint has been configured with no transport. When it comes time to call an AoR, PJSIP will find the first transport that matches the type. A SIP URI of sip:5000@[11::33] will use the first IPv6 transport and try to send the request.

If the anonymous endpoint identifier is in use an endpoint with the name "anonymous@domain" will be searched for as a last resort. If this is not found it will fall back to searching for "anonymous". If neither endpoints are found the anonymous endpoint identifier will not return an endpoint and anonymous calling will not be possible.

configOption.name: 100rel
configOption.synopsis: Allow support for RFC3262 provisional ACK tags

configOption.name: aggregate_mwi
configOption.synopsis: Condense MWI notifications into a single NOTIFY.

description.para: When enabled, aggregate_mwi condenses message waiting notifications from multiple mailboxes into a single NOTIFY. If it is disabled, individual NOTIFYs are sent for each mailbox.

configOption.name: allow
configOption.synopsis: Media Codec(s) to allow

configOption.name: allow_overlap
configOption.synopsis: Enable RFC3578 overlap dialing support.

configOption.name: aors
configOption.synopsis: AoR(s) to be used with the endpoint

description.para: List of comma separated AoRs that the endpoint should be associated with.

configOption.name: auth
configOption.synopsis: Authentication Object(s) associated with the endpoint

description.para: This is a comma-delimited list of auth sections defined in pjsip.conf to be used to verify inbound connection attempts.
Endpoints without an authentication object configured will allow connections without verification.

note.para: Using the same auth section for inbound and outbound authentication is not recommended. There is a difference in meaning for an empty realm setting between inbound and outbound authentication uses. See the auth realm description for details.

configOption.name: callerid
configOption.synopsis: CallerID information for the endpoint

description.para: Must be in the format Name <Number>, or only <Number>.

configOption.name: callerid_privacy
configOption.synopsis: Default privacy level

configOption.name: callerid_tag
configOption.synopsis: Internal id_tag for the endpoint

configOption.name: context
configOption.synopsis: Dialplan context for inbound sessions

configOption.name: direct_media_glare_mitigation
configOption.synopsis: Mitigation of direct media (re)INVITE glare

description.para: This setting attempts to avoid creating INVITE glare scenarios by disabling direct media reINVITEs in one direction thereby allowing designated servers (according to this option) to initiate direct media reINVITEs without contention and significantly reducing call setup time.
A more detailed description of how this option functions can be found on the Asterisk wiki https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/SIP+Direct+Media+Reinvite+Glare+Avoidance

configOption.name: direct_media_method
configOption.synopsis: Direct Media method type

description.para: Method for setting up Direct Media between endpoints.

configOption.name: connected_line_method
configOption.synopsis: Connected line method type

description.para: Method used when updating connected line information.

enum.name: invite
enum.para: When set to invite, check the remote's Allow header and if UPDATE is allowed, send UPDATE instead of INVITE to avoid SDP renegotiation. If UPDATE is not Allowed, send INVITE.

enum.name: update
enum.para: If set to update, send UPDATE regardless of what the remote Allows.

configOption.name: direct_media
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether media may flow directly between endpoints.

configOption.name: disable_direct_media_on_nat
configOption.synopsis: Disable direct media session refreshes when NAT obstructs the media session

configOption.name: disallow
configOption.synopsis: Media Codec(s) to disallow

configOption.name: dtmf_mode
configOption.synopsis: DTMF mode

description.para: This setting allows to choose the DTMF mode for endpoint communication.

enum.name: rfc4733
enum.para: DTMF is sent out of band of the main audio stream. This supercedes the older RFC-2833 used within the older chan_sip.

enum.name: inband
enum.para: DTMF is sent as part of audio stream.

enum.name: info
enum.para: DTMF is sent as SIP INFO packets.

enum.name: auto
enum.para: DTMF is sent as RFC 4733 if the other side supports it or as INBAND if not.

enum.name: auto_info
enum.para: DTMF is sent as RFC 4733 if the other side supports it or as SIP INFO if not.

configOption.name: media_address
configOption.synopsis: IP address used in SDP for media handling

description.para: At the time of SDP creation, the IP address defined here will be used as the media address for individual streams in the SDP.

note.para: Be aware that the external_media_address option, set in Transport configuration, can also affect the final media address used in the SDP.

configOption.name: bind_rtp_to_media_address
configOption.synopsis: Bind the RTP instance to the media_address

description.para: If media_address is specified, this option causes the RTP instance to be bound to the specified ip address which causes the packets to be sent from that address.

configOption.name: force_rport
configOption.synopsis: Force use of return port

configOption.name: ice_support
configOption.synopsis: Enable the ICE mechanism to help traverse NAT

configOption.name: identify_by
configOption.synopsis: Way(s) for the endpoint to be identified

description.para: Endpoints and AORs can be identified in multiple ways. This option is a comma separated list of methods the endpoint can be identified.

note.para: This option controls both how an endpoint is matched for incoming traffic and also how an AOR is determined if a registration occurs. You must list at least one method that also matches for AORs or the registration will fail.

enum.name: username
enum.para: Matches the endpoint or AOR ID based on the username and domain in the From header (or To header for AORs). If an exact match on both username and domain/realm fails, the match is retried with just the username.

enum.name: auth_username
enum.para: Matches the endpoint or AOR ID based on the username and realm in the Authentication header. If an exact match on both username and domain/realm fails, the match is retried with just the username.

note.para: This method of identification has some security considerations because an Authentication header is not present on the first message of a dialog when digest authentication is used. The client can't generate it until the server sends the challenge in a 401 response. Since Asterisk normally sends a security event when an incoming request can't be matched to an endpoint, using this method requires that the security event be deferred until a request is received with the Authentication header and only generated if the username doesn't result in a match. This may result in a delay before an attack is recognized. You can control how many unmatched requests are received from a single ip address before a security event is generated using the unidentified_request parameters in the "global" configuration object.

enum.name: ip
enum.para: Matches the endpoint based on the source IP address.

This method of identification is not configured here but simply allowed by this configuration option. See the documentation for the identify configuration section for more details on this method of endpoint identification.

enum.name: header
enum.para: Matches the endpoint based on a configured SIP header value.

This method of identification is not configured here but simply allowed by this configuration option. See the documentation for the identify configuration section for more details on this method of endpoint identification.

configOption.name: redirect_method
configOption.synopsis: How redirects received from an endpoint are handled

description.para: When a redirect is received from an endpoint there are multiple ways it can be handled. If this option is set to user the user portion of the redirect target is treated as an extension within the dialplan and dialed using a Local channel. If this option is set to uri_core the target URI is returned to the dialing application which dials it using the PJSIP channel driver and endpoint originally used. If this option is set to uri_pjsip the redirect occurs within chan_pjsip itself and is not exposed to the core at all. The uri_pjsip option has the benefit of being more efficient and also supporting multiple potential redirect targets. The con is that since redirection occurs within chan_pjsip redirecting information is not forwarded and redirection can not be prevented.

configOption.name: mailboxes
configOption.synopsis: NOTIFY the endpoint when state changes for any of the specified mailboxes

description.para: Asterisk will send unsolicited MWI NOTIFY messages to the endpoint when state changes happen for any of the specified mailboxes. More than one mailbox can be specified with a comma-delimited string. app_voicemail mailboxes must be specified as mailbox@context; for example: mailboxes=6001@default. For mailboxes provided by external sources, such as through the res_external_mwi module, you must specify strings supported by the external system.
For endpoints that SUBSCRIBE for MWI, use the mailboxes option in your AOR configuration.

configOption.name: mwi_subscribe_replaces_unsolicited
configOption.synopsis: An MWI subscribe will replace sending unsolicited NOTIFYs

configOption.name: voicemail_extension
configOption.synopsis: The voicemail extension to send in the NOTIFY Message-Account header

configOption.name: moh_suggest
configOption.synopsis: Default Music On Hold class

configOption.name: outbound_auth
configOption.synopsis: Authentication object(s) used for outbound requests

description.para: This is a comma-delimited list of auth sections defined in pjsip.conf used to respond to outbound connection authentication challenges.

note.para: Using the same auth section for inbound and outbound authentication is not recommended. There is a difference in meaning for an empty realm setting between inbound and outbound authentication uses. See the auth realm description for details.

configOption.name: outbound_proxy
configOption.synopsis: Full SIP URI of the outbound proxy used to send requests

configOption.name: rewrite_contact
configOption.synopsis: Allow Contact header to be rewritten with the source IP address-port

description.para: On inbound SIP messages from this endpoint, the Contact header or an appropriate Record-Route header will be changed to have the source IP address and port. This option does not affect outbound messages sent to this endpoint. This option helps servers communicate with endpoints that are behind NATs. This option also helps reuse reliable transport connections such as TCP and TLS.

configOption.name: rtp_ipv6
configOption.synopsis: Allow use of IPv6 for RTP traffic

configOption.name: rtp_symmetric
configOption.synopsis: Enforce that RTP must be symmetric

configOption.name: send_diversion
configOption.synopsis: Send the Diversion header, conveying the diversion information to the called user agent

configOption.name: send_pai
configOption.synopsis: Send the P-Asserted-Identity header

configOption.name: send_rpid
configOption.synopsis: Send the Remote-Party-ID header

configOption.name: rpid_immediate
configOption.synopsis: Immediately send connected line updates on unanswered incoming calls.

description.para: When enabled, immediately send 180 Ringing or 183 Progress response messages to the caller if the connected line information is updated before the call is answered. This can send a 180 Ringing response before the call has even reached the far end. The caller can start hearing ringback before the far end even gets the call. Many phones tend to grab the first connected line information and refuse to update the display if it changes. The first information is not likely to be correct if the call goes to an endpoint not under the control of this Asterisk box.

When disabled, a connected line update must wait for another reason to send a message with the connected line information to the caller before the call is answered. You can trigger the sending of the information by using an appropriate dialplan application such as Ringing.

configOption.name: timers_min_se
configOption.synopsis: Minimum session timers expiration period

description.para: Minimum session timer expiration period. Time in seconds.

configOption.name: timers
configOption.synopsis: Session timers for SIP packets

configOption.name: timers_sess_expires
configOption.synopsis: Maximum session timer expiration period

description.para: Maximum session timer expiration period. Time in seconds.

configOption.name: transport
configOption.synopsis: Explicit transport configuration to use

description.para: This will force the endpoint to use the specified transport configuration to send SIP messages. You need to already know what kind of transport (UDP/TCP/IPv4/etc) the endpoint device will use.

note.para: Not specifying a transport will select the first configured transport in pjsip.conf which is compatible with the URI we are trying to contact.

warning.para: Transport configuration is not affected by reloads. In order to change transports, a full Asterisk restart is required

configOption.name: trust_id_inbound
configOption.synopsis: Accept identification information received from this endpoint

description.para: This option determines whether Asterisk will accept identification from the endpoint from headers such as P-Asserted-Identity or Remote-Party-ID header. This option applies both to calls originating from the endpoint and calls originating from Asterisk. If no, the configured Caller-ID from pjsip.conf will always be used as the identity for the endpoint.

configOption.name: trust_id_outbound
configOption.synopsis: Send private identification details to the endpoint.

description.para: This option determines whether res_pjsip will send private identification information to the endpoint. If no, private Caller-ID information will not be forwarded to the endpoint. "Private" in this case refers to any method of restricting identification. Example: setting callerid_privacy to any prohib variation. Example: If trust_id_inbound is set to yes, the presence of a Privacy: id header in a SIP request or response would indicate the identification provided in the request is private.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'endpoint'.

configOption.name: use_ptime
configOption.synopsis: Use Endpoint's requested packetization interval

configOption.name: use_avpf
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether res_pjsip will use and enforce usage of AVPF for this endpoint.

description.para: If set to yes, res_pjsip will use the AVPF or SAVPF RTP profile for all media offers on outbound calls and media updates and will decline media offers not using the AVPF or SAVPF profile.
If set to no, res_pjsip will use the AVP or SAVP RTP profile for all media offers on outbound calls and media updates, and will decline media offers not using the AVP or SAVP profile.

configOption.name: force_avp
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether res_pjsip will use and enforce usage of AVP, regardless of the RTP profile in use for this endpoint.

description.para: If set to yes, res_pjsip will use the AVP, AVPF, SAVP, or SAVPF RTP profile for all media offers on outbound calls and media updates including those for DTLS-SRTP streams.
If set to no, res_pjsip will use the respective RTP profile depending on configuration.

configOption.name: media_use_received_transport
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether res_pjsip will use the media transport received in the offer SDP in the corresponding answer SDP.

description.para: If set to yes, res_pjsip will use the received media transport.
If set to no, res_pjsip will use the respective RTP profile depending on configuration.

configOption.name: media_encryption
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether res_pjsip will use and enforce usage of media encryption for this endpoint.

enum.name: no
enum.para: res_pjsip will offer no encryption and allow no encryption to be setup.

enum.name: sdes
enum.para: res_pjsip will offer standard SRTP setup via in-SDP keys. Encrypted SIP transport should be used in conjunction with this option to prevent exposure of media encryption keys.

configOption.name: media_encryption_optimistic
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether encryption should be used if possible but does not terminate the session if not achieved.

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to sdes or dtls.

configOption.name: g726_non_standard
configOption.synopsis: Force g.726 to use AAL2 packing order when negotiating g.726 audio

description.para: When set to "yes" and an endpoint negotiates g.726 audio then use g.726 for AAL2 packing order instead of what is recommended by RFC3551. Since this essentially replaces the underlying 'g726' codec with 'g726aal2' then 'g726aal2' needs to be specified in the endpoint's allowed codec list.

configOption.name: inband_progress
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether chan_pjsip will indicate ringing using inband progress.

description.para: If set to yes, chan_pjsip will send a 183 Session Progress when told to indicate ringing and will immediately start sending ringing as audio.
If set to no, chan_pjsip will send a 180 Ringing when told to indicate ringing and will NOT send it as audio.

configOption.name: call_group
configOption.synopsis: The numeric pickup groups for a channel.

description.para: Can be set to a comma separated list of numbers or ranges between the values of 0-63 (maximum of 64 groups).

configOption.name: pickup_group
configOption.synopsis: The numeric pickup groups that a channel can pickup.

description.para: Can be set to a comma separated list of numbers or ranges between the values of 0-63 (maximum of 64 groups).

configOption.name: named_call_group
configOption.synopsis: The named pickup groups for a channel.

description.para: Can be set to a comma separated list of case sensitive strings limited by supported line length.

configOption.name: named_pickup_group
configOption.synopsis: The named pickup groups that a channel can pickup.

description.para: Can be set to a comma separated list of case sensitive strings limited by supported line length.

configOption.name: device_state_busy_at
configOption.synopsis: The number of in-use channels which will cause busy to be returned as device state

description.para: When the number of in-use channels for the endpoint matches the devicestate_busy_at setting the PJSIP channel driver will return busy as the device state instead of in use.

configOption.name: t38_udptl
configOption.synopsis: Whether T.38 UDPTL support is enabled or not

description.para: If set to yes T.38 UDPTL support will be enabled, and T.38 negotiation requests will be accepted and relayed.

configOption.name: t38_udptl_ec
configOption.synopsis: T.38 UDPTL error correction method

enum.name: none
enum.para: No error correction should be used.

enum.name: fec
enum.para: Forward error correction should be used.

enum.name: redundancy
enum.para: Redundancy error correction should be used.

configOption.name: t38_udptl_maxdatagram
configOption.synopsis: T.38 UDPTL maximum datagram size

description.para: This option can be set to override the maximum datagram of a remote endpoint for broken endpoints.

configOption.name: fax_detect
configOption.synopsis: Whether CNG tone detection is enabled

description.para: This option can be set to send the session to the fax extension when a CNG tone is detected.

configOption.name: fax_detect_timeout
configOption.synopsis: How long into a call before fax_detect is disabled for the call

description.para: The option determines how many seconds into a call before the fax_detect option is disabled for the call. Setting the value to zero disables the timeout.

configOption.name: t38_udptl_nat
configOption.synopsis: Whether NAT support is enabled on UDPTL sessions

description.para: When enabled the UDPTL stack will send UDPTL packets to the source address of received packets.

configOption.name: t38_udptl_ipv6
configOption.synopsis: Whether IPv6 is used for UDPTL Sessions

description.para: When enabled the UDPTL stack will use IPv6.

configOption.name: tone_zone
configOption.synopsis: Set which country's indications to use for channels created for this endpoint.

configOption.name: language
configOption.synopsis: Set the default language to use for channels created for this endpoint.

configOption.name: one_touch_recording
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether one-touch recording is allowed for this endpoint.

configOption.name: record_on_feature
configOption.synopsis: The feature to enact when one-touch recording is turned on.

description.para: When an INFO request for one-touch recording arrives with a Record header set to "on", this feature will be enabled for the channel. The feature designated here can be any built-in or dynamic feature defined in features.conf.

note.para: This setting has no effect if the endpoint's one_touch_recording option is disabled

configOption.name: record_off_feature
configOption.synopsis: The feature to enact when one-touch recording is turned off.

description.para: When an INFO request for one-touch recording arrives with a Record header set to "off", this feature will be enabled for the channel. The feature designated here can be any built-in or dynamic feature defined in features.conf.

note.para: This setting has no effect if the endpoint's one_touch_recording option is disabled

configOption.name: rtp_engine
configOption.synopsis: Name of the RTP engine to use for channels created for this endpoint

configOption.name: allow_transfer
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether SIP REFER transfers are allowed for this endpoint

configOption.name: user_eq_phone
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether a user=phone parameter is placed into the request URI if the user is determined to be a phone number

configOption.name: moh_passthrough
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether hold and unhold will be passed through using re-INVITEs with recvonly and sendrecv to the remote side

configOption.name: sdp_owner
configOption.synopsis: String placed as the username portion of an SDP origin (o=) line.

configOption.name: sdp_session
configOption.synopsis: String used for the SDP session (s=) line.

configOption.name: tos_audio
configOption.synopsis: DSCP TOS bits for audio streams

description.para: See https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service for more information about QoS settings

configOption.name: tos_video
configOption.synopsis: DSCP TOS bits for video streams

description.para: See https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service for more information about QoS settings

configOption.name: cos_audio
configOption.synopsis: Priority for audio streams

description.para: See https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service for more information about QoS settings

configOption.name: cos_video
configOption.synopsis: Priority for video streams

description.para: See https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service for more information about QoS settings

configOption.name: allow_subscribe
configOption.synopsis: Determines if endpoint is allowed to initiate subscriptions with Asterisk.

configOption.name: sub_min_expiry
configOption.synopsis: The minimum allowed expiry time for subscriptions initiated by the endpoint.

configOption.name: from_user
configOption.synopsis: Username to use in From header for requests to this endpoint.

configOption.name: mwi_from_user
configOption.synopsis: Username to use in From header for unsolicited MWI NOTIFYs to this endpoint.

configOption.name: from_domain
configOption.synopsis: Domain to user in From header for requests to this endpoint.

configOption.name: dtls_verify
configOption.synopsis: Verify that the provided peer certificate is valid

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to dtls.

configOption.name: dtls_rekey
configOption.synopsis: Interval at which to renegotiate the TLS session and rekey the SRTP session

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to dtls.
If this is not set or the value provided is 0 rekeying will be disabled.

configOption.name: dtls_auto_generate_cert
configOption.synopsis: Whether or not to automatically generate an ephemeral X.509 certificate

description.para: If enabled, Asterisk will generate an X.509 certificate for each DTLS session. This option only applies if media_encryption is set to dtls. This option will be automatically enabled if webrtc is enabled and dtls_cert_file is not specified.

configOption.name: dtls_cert_file
configOption.synopsis: Path to certificate file to present to peer

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to dtls.

configOption.name: dtls_private_key
configOption.synopsis: Path to private key for certificate file

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to dtls.

configOption.name: dtls_cipher
configOption.synopsis: Cipher to use for DTLS negotiation

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to dtls.
Many options for acceptable ciphers. See link for more:
http://www.openssl.org/docs/apps/ciphers.html#CIPHER_STRINGS

configOption.name: dtls_ca_file
configOption.synopsis: Path to certificate authority certificate

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to dtls.

configOption.name: dtls_ca_path
configOption.synopsis: Path to a directory containing certificate authority certificates

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to dtls.

configOption.name: dtls_setup
configOption.synopsis: Whether we are willing to accept connections, connect to the other party, or both.

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to dtls.

enum.name: active
enum.para: res_pjsip will make a connection to the peer.

enum.name: passive
enum.para: res_pjsip will accept connections from the peer.

enum.name: actpass
enum.para: res_pjsip will offer and accept connections from the peer.

configOption.name: dtls_fingerprint
configOption.synopsis: Type of hash to use for the DTLS fingerprint in the SDP.

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to dtls.

configOption.name: srtp_tag_32
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether 32 byte tags should be used instead of 80 byte tags.

description.para: This option only applies if media_encryption is set to sdes or dtls.

configOption.name: set_var
configOption.synopsis: Variable set on a channel involving the endpoint.

description.para: When a new channel is created using the endpoint set the specified variable(s) on that channel. For multiple channel variables specify multiple 'set_var'(s).

configOption.name: message_context
configOption.synopsis: Context to route incoming MESSAGE requests to.

description.para: If specified, incoming MESSAGE requests will be routed to the indicated dialplan context. If no message_context is specified, then the context setting is used.

configOption.name: accountcode
configOption.synopsis: An accountcode to set automatically on any channels created for this endpoint.

description.para: If specified, any channel created for this endpoint will automatically have this accountcode set on it.

configOption.name: preferred_codec_only
configOption.synopsis: Respond to a SIP invite with the single most preferred codec rather than advertising all joint codec capabilities. This limits the other side's codec choice to exactly what we prefer.

configOption.name: rtp_keepalive
configOption.synopsis: Number of seconds between RTP comfort noise keepalive packets.

description.para: At the specified interval, Asterisk will send an RTP comfort noise frame. This may be useful for situations where Asterisk is behind a NAT or firewall and must keep a hole open in order to allow for media to arrive at Asterisk.

configOption.name: rtp_timeout
configOption.synopsis: Maximum number of seconds without receiving RTP (while off hold) before terminating call.

description.para: This option configures the number of seconds without RTP (while off hold) before considering a channel as dead. When the number of seconds is reached the underlying channel is hung up. By default this option is set to 0, which means do not check.

configOption.name: rtp_timeout_hold
configOption.synopsis: Maximum number of seconds without receiving RTP (while on hold) before terminating call.

description.para: This option configures the number of seconds without RTP (while on hold) before considering a channel as dead. When the number of seconds is reached the underlying channel is hung up. By default this option is set to 0, which means do not check.

configOption.name: acl
configOption.synopsis: List of IP ACL section names in acl.conf

description.para: This matches sections configured in acl.conf. The value is defined as a list of comma-delimited section names.

configOption.name: deny
configOption.synopsis: List of IP addresses to deny access from

description.para: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

configOption.name: permit
configOption.synopsis: List of IP addresses to permit access from

description.para: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

configOption.name: contact_acl
configOption.synopsis: List of Contact ACL section names in acl.conf

description.para: This matches sections configured in acl.conf. The value is defined as a list of comma-delimited section names.

configOption.name: contact_deny
configOption.synopsis: List of Contact header addresses to deny

description.para: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

configOption.name: contact_permit
configOption.synopsis: List of Contact header addresses to permit

description.para: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

configOption.name: subscribe_context
configOption.synopsis: Context for incoming MESSAGE requests.

description.para: If specified, incoming SUBSCRIBE requests will be searched for the matching extension in the indicated context. If no subscribe_context is specified, then the context setting is used.

configOption.name: contact_user
configOption.synopsis: Force the user on the outgoing Contact header to this value.

description.para: On outbound requests, force the user portion of the Contact header to this value.

configOption.name: asymmetric_rtp_codec
configOption.synopsis: Allow the sending and receiving RTP codec to differ

description.para: When set to "yes" the codec in use for sending will be allowed to differ from that of the received one. PJSIP will not automatically switch the sending one to the receiving one.

configOption.name: rtcp_mux
configOption.synopsis: Enable RFC 5761 RTCP multiplexing on the RTP port

description.para: With this option enabled, Asterisk will attempt to negotiate the use of the "rtcp-mux" attribute on all media streams. This will result in RTP and RTCP being sent and received on the same port. This shifts the demultiplexing logic to the application rather than the transport layer. This option is useful when interoperating with WebRTC endpoints since they mandate this option's use.

configOption.name: refer_blind_progress
configOption.synopsis: Whether to notifies all the progress details on blind transfer

description.para: Some SIP phones (Mitel/Aastra, Snom) expect a sip/frag "200 OK" after REFER has been accepted. If set to no then asterisk will not send the progress details, but immediately will send "200 OK".

configOption.name: notify_early_inuse_ringing
configOption.synopsis: Whether to notifies dialog-info 'early' on InUse&Ringing state

description.para: Control whether dialog-info subscriptions get 'early' state on Ringing when already INUSE.

configOption.name: max_audio_streams
configOption.synopsis: The maximum number of allowed audio streams for the endpoint

description.para: This option enforces a limit on the maximum simultaneous negotiated audio streams allowed for the endpoint.

configOption.name: max_video_streams
configOption.synopsis: The maximum number of allowed video streams for the endpoint

description.para: This option enforces a limit on the maximum simultaneous negotiated video streams allowed for the endpoint.

configOption.name: bundle
configOption.synopsis: Enable RTP bundling

description.para: With this option enabled, Asterisk will attempt to negotiate the use of bundle. If negotiated this will result in multiple RTP streams being carried over the same underlying transport. Note that enabling bundle will also enable the rtcp_mux option.

configOption.name: webrtc
configOption.synopsis: Defaults and enables some options that are relevant to WebRTC

description.para: When set to "yes" this also enables the following values that are needed in order for basic WebRTC support to work: rtcp_mux, use_avpf, ice_support, and use_received_transport. The following configuration settings also get defaulted as follows:
media_encryption=dtls
dtls_auto_generate_cert=yes (if dtls_cert_file is not set)
dtls_verify=fingerprint
dtls_setup=actpass

configOption.name: incoming_mwi_mailbox
configOption.synopsis: Mailbox name to use when incoming MWI NOTIFYs are received

description.para: If an MWI NOTIFY is received from this endpoint, this mailbox will be used when notifying other modules of MWI status changes. If not set, incoming MWI NOTIFYs are ignored.

configOption.name: follow_early_media_fork
configOption.synopsis: Follow SDP forked media when To tag is different

description.para: On outgoing calls, if the UAS responds with different SDP attributes on subsequent 18X or 2XX responses (such as a port update) AND the To tag on the subsequent response is different than that on the previous one, follow it. This usually happens when the INVITE is forked to multiple UASs and more than one sends an SDP answer.

note.para: This option must also be enabled in the system section for it to take effect here.

configOption.name: accept_multiple_sdp_answers
configOption.synopsis: Accept multiple SDP answers on non-100rel responses

description.para: On outgoing calls, if the UAS responds with different SDP attributes on non-100rel 18X or 2XX responses (such as a port update) AND the To tag on the subsequent response is the same as that on the previous one, process the updated SDP. This can happen when the UAS needs to change ports for some reason such as using a separate port for custom ringback.

note.para: This option must also be enabled in the system section for it to take effect here.

configOption.name: suppress_q850_reason_headers
configOption.synopsis: Suppress Q.850 Reason headers for this endpoint

description.para: Some devices can't accept multiple Reason headers and get confused when both 'SIP' and 'Q.850' Reason headers are received. This option allows the 'Q.850' Reason header to be suppressed.

Authentication objects hold the authentication information for use by other objects such as endpoints or registrations. This also allows for multiple objects to use a single auth object. See the auth_type config option for password style choices.

configOption.name: auth_type
configOption.synopsis: Authentication type

description.para: This option specifies which of the password style config options should be read when trying to authenticate an endpoint inbound request. If set to userpass then we'll read from the 'password' option. For md5 we'll read from 'md5_cred'.

configOption.name: nonce_lifetime
configOption.synopsis: Lifetime of a nonce associated with this authentication config.

configOption.name: md5_cred
configOption.synopsis: MD5 Hash used for authentication.

description.para: Only used when auth_type is md5.

configOption.name: password
configOption.synopsis: Plain text password used for authentication.

description.para: Only used when auth_type is userpass.

configOption.name: realm
configOption.synopsis: SIP realm for endpoint

description.para: The treatment of this value depends upon how the authentication object is used.

When used as an inbound authentication object, the realm is sent as part of the challenge so the peer can know which key to use when responding. An empty value will use the global section's default_realm value when issuing a challenge.

When used as an outbound authentication object, the realm is matched with the received challenge realm to determine which authentication object to use when responding to the challenge. An empty value matches any challenging realm when determining which authentication object matches a received challenge.

note.para: Using the same auth section for inbound and outbound authentication is not recommended. There is a difference in meaning for an empty realm setting between inbound and outbound authentication uses.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be 'auth'

configOption.name: username
configOption.synopsis: Username to use for account

description.para: Signifies that a domain is an alias. If the domain on a session is not found to match an AoR then this object is used to see if we have an alias for the AoR to which the endpoint is binding. This objects name as defined in configuration should be the domain alias and a config option is provided to specify the domain to be aliased.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'domain_alias'.

configOption.name: domain
configOption.synopsis: Domain to be aliased

description.para: There are different transports and protocol derivatives supported by res_pjsip. They are in order of preference: UDP, TCP, and WebSocket (WS).

note.para: Changes to transport configuration in pjsip.conf will only be effected on a complete restart of Asterisk. A module reload will not suffice.

configOption.name: async_operations
configOption.synopsis: Number of simultaneous Asynchronous Operations

configOption.name: bind
configOption.synopsis: IP Address and optional port to bind to for this transport

configOption.name: ca_list_file
configOption.synopsis: File containing a list of certificates to read (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

configOption.name: ca_list_path
configOption.synopsis: Path to directory containing a list of certificates to read (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

configOption.name: cert_file
configOption.synopsis: Certificate file for endpoint (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

description.para: A path to a .crt or .pem file can be provided. However, only the certificate is read from the file, not the private key. The priv_key_file option must supply a matching key file.

configOption.name: cipher
configOption.synopsis: Preferred cryptography cipher names (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

description.para: Comma separated list of cipher names or numeric equivalents. Numeric equivalents can be either decimal or hexadecimal (0xX).
There are many cipher names. Use the CLI command pjsip list ciphers to see a list of cipher names available for your installation. See link for more:
http://www.openssl.org/docs/apps/ciphers.html#CIPHER_SUITE_NAMES

configOption.name: domain
configOption.synopsis: Domain the transport comes from

configOption.name: external_media_address
configOption.synopsis: External IP address to use in RTP handling

description.para: When a request or response is sent out, if the destination of the message is outside the IP network defined in the option localnet, and the media address in the SDP is within the localnet network, then the media address in the SDP will be rewritten to the value defined for external_media_address.

configOption.name: external_signaling_address
configOption.synopsis: External address for SIP signalling

configOption.name: external_signaling_port
configOption.synopsis: External port for SIP signalling

configOption.name: method
configOption.synopsis: Method of SSL transport (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

enum.name: default
enum.para: The default as defined by PJSIP. This is currently TLSv1, but may change with future releases.

enum.name: unspecified
enum.para: This option is equivalent to setting 'default'

configOption.name: local_net
configOption.synopsis: Network to consider local (used for NAT purposes).

description.para: This must be in CIDR or dotted decimal format with the IP and mask separated with a slash ('/').

configOption.name: password
configOption.synopsis: Password required for transport

configOption.name: priv_key_file
configOption.synopsis: Private key file (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

configOption.name: protocol
configOption.synopsis: Protocol to use for SIP traffic

configOption.name: require_client_cert
configOption.synopsis: Require client certificate (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'transport'.

configOption.name: verify_client
configOption.synopsis: Require verification of client certificate (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

configOption.name: verify_server
configOption.synopsis: Require verification of server certificate (TLS ONLY, not WSS)

configOption.name: tos
configOption.synopsis: Enable TOS for the signalling sent over this transport

description.para: See https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service for more information on this parameter.

note.para: This option does not apply to the ws or the wss protocols.

configOption.name: cos
configOption.synopsis: Enable COS for the signalling sent over this transport

description.para: See https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/IP+Quality+of+Service for more information on this parameter.

note.para: This option does not apply to the ws or the wss protocols.

configOption.name: websocket_write_timeout
configOption.synopsis: The timeout (in milliseconds) to set on WebSocket connections.

description.para: If a websocket connection accepts input slowly, the timeout for writes to it can be increased to keep it from being disconnected. Value is in milliseconds; default is 100 ms.

configOption.name: allow_reload
configOption.synopsis: Allow this transport to be reloaded.

description.para: Allow this transport to be reloaded when res_pjsip is reloaded. This option defaults to "no" because reloading a transport may disrupt in-progress calls.

configOption.name: symmetric_transport
