configOption.synopsis: Use the same transport for outgoing requests as incoming ones.

description.para: When a request from a dynamic contact comes in on a transport with this option set to 'yes', the transport name will be saved and used for subsequent outgoing requests like OPTIONS, NOTIFY and INVITE. It's saved as a contact uri parameter named 'x-ast-txp' and will display with the contact uri in CLI, AMI, and ARI output. On the outgoing request, if a transport wasn't explicitly set on the endpoint AND the request URI is not a hostname, the saved transport will be used and the 'x-ast-txp' parameter stripped from the outgoing packet.

configObject.name: contact
configObject.synopsis: A way of creating an aliased name to a SIP URI

description.para: Contacts are a way to hide SIP URIs from the dialplan directly. They are also used to make a group of contactable parties when in use with AoR lists.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'contact'.

configOption.name: uri
configOption.synopsis: SIP URI to contact peer

configOption.name: expiration_time
configOption.synopsis: Time to keep alive a contact

description.para: Time to keep alive a contact. String style specification.

configOption.name: qualify_frequency
configOption.synopsis: Interval at which to qualify a contact

description.para: Interval between attempts to qualify the contact for reachability. If 0 never qualify. Time in seconds.

configOption.name: qualify_timeout
configOption.synopsis: Timeout for qualify

description.para: If the contact doesn't respond to the OPTIONS request before the timeout, the contact is marked unavailable. If 0 no timeout. Time in fractional seconds.

configOption.name: authenticate_qualify
configOption.synopsis: Authenticates a qualify challenge response if needed

description.para: If true and a qualify request receives a challenge response then authentication is attempted before declaring the contact available.

note.para: This option does nothing as we will always complete the challenge response authentication if the qualify request is challenged.

configOption.name: outbound_proxy
configOption.synopsis: Outbound proxy used when sending OPTIONS request

description.para: If set the provided URI will be used as the outbound proxy when an OPTIONS request is sent to a contact for qualify purposes.

configOption.name: path
configOption.synopsis: Stored Path vector for use in Route headers on outgoing requests.

configOption.name: user_agent
configOption.synopsis: User-Agent header from registration.

description.para: The User-Agent is automatically stored based on data present in incoming SIP REGISTER requests and is not intended to be configured manually.

configOption.name: endpoint
configOption.synopsis: Endpoint name

description.para: The name of the endpoint this contact belongs to

configOption.name: reg_server
configOption.synopsis: Asterisk Server name

description.para: Asterisk Server name on which SIP endpoint registered.

configOption.name: via_addr
configOption.synopsis: IP-address of the last Via header from registration.

description.para: The last Via header should contain the address of UA which sent the request. The IP-address of the last Via header is automatically stored based on data present in incoming SIP REGISTER requests and is not intended to be configured manually.

configOption.name: via_port
configOption.synopsis: IP-port of the last Via header from registration.

description.para: The IP-port of the last Via header is automatically stored based on data present in incoming SIP REGISTER requests and is not intended to be configured manually.

configOption.name: call_id
configOption.synopsis: Call-ID header from registration.

description.para: The Call-ID header is automatically stored based on data present in incoming SIP REGISTER requests and is not intended to be configured manually.

configOption.name: prune_on_boot
configOption.synopsis: A contact that cannot survive a restart/boot.

description.para: The option is set if the incoming SIP REGISTER contact is rewritten on a reliable transport and is not intended to be configured manually.

configObject.name: aor
configObject.synopsis: The configuration for a location of an endpoint

description.para: An AoR is what allows Asterisk to contact an endpoint via res_pjsip. If no AoRs are specified, an endpoint will not be reachable by Asterisk. Beyond that, an AoR has other uses within Asterisk, such as inbound registration.
An AoR is a way to allow dialing a group of Contacts that all use the same endpoint for calls.

This can be used as another way of grouping a list of contacts to dial rather than specifying them each directly when dialing via the dialplan. This must be used in conjunction with the PJSIP_DIAL_CONTACTS.

Registrations: For Asterisk to match an inbound registration to an endpoint, the AoR object name must match the user portion of the SIP URI in the "To:" header of the inbound SIP registration. That will usually be equivalent to the "user name" set in your hard or soft phones configuration.

configOption.name: contact
configOption.synopsis: Permanent contacts assigned to AoR

description.para: Contacts specified will be called whenever referenced by chan_pjsip.
Use a separate "contact=" entry for each contact required. Contacts are specified using a SIP URI.

configOption.name: default_expiration
configOption.synopsis: Default expiration time in seconds for contacts that are dynamically bound to an AoR.

configOption.name: mailboxes
configOption.synopsis: Allow subscriptions for the specified mailbox(es)

description.para: This option applies when an external entity subscribes to an AoR for Message Waiting Indications. The mailboxes specified will be subscribed to. More than one mailbox can be specified with a comma-delimited string. app_voicemail mailboxes must be specified as mailbox@context; for example: mailboxes=6001@default. For mailboxes provided by external sources, such as through the res_external_mwi module, you must specify strings supported by the external system.
For endpoints that cannot SUBSCRIBE for MWI, you can set the mailboxes option in your endpoint configuration section to enable unsolicited MWI NOTIFYs to the endpoint.

configOption.name: voicemail_extension
configOption.synopsis: The voicemail extension to send in the NOTIFY Message-Account header

configOption.name: maximum_expiration
configOption.synopsis: Maximum time to keep an AoR

description.para: Maximum time to keep a peer with explicit expiration. Time in seconds.

configOption.name: max_contacts
configOption.synopsis: Maximum number of contacts that can bind to an AoR

description.para: Maximum number of contacts that can associate with this AoR. This value does not affect the number of contacts that can be added with the "contact" option. It only limits contacts added through external interaction, such as registration.

note.para: The rewrite_contact option registers the source address as the contact address to help with NAT and reusing connection oriented transports such as TCP and TLS. Unfortunately, refreshing a registration may register a different contact address and exceed max_contacts. The remove_existing option can help by removing the soonest to expire contact(s) over max_contacts which is likely the old rewrite_contact contact source address being refreshed.
This should be set to 1 and remove_existing set to yes if you wish to stick with the older chan_sip behaviour.

configOption.name: minimum_expiration
configOption.synopsis: Minimum keep alive time for an AoR

description.para: Minimum time to keep a peer with an explicit expiration. Time in seconds.

configOption.name: remove_existing
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether new contacts replace existing ones.

description.para: On receiving a new registration to the AoR should it remove enough existing contacts not added or updated by the registration to satisfy max_contacts? Any removed contacts will expire the soonest.

note.para: The rewrite_contact option registers the source address as the contact address to help with NAT and reusing connection oriented transports such as TCP and TLS. Unfortunately, refreshing a registration may register a different contact address and exceed max_contacts. The remove_existing option can help by removing the soonest to expire contact(s) over max_contacts which is likely the old rewrite_contact contact source address being refreshed.
This should be set to yes and max_contacts set to 1 if you wish to stick with the older chan_sip behaviour.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'aor'.

configOption.name: qualify_frequency
configOption.synopsis: Interval at which to qualify an AoR

description.para: Interval between attempts to qualify the AoR for reachability. If 0 never qualify. Time in seconds.

configOption.name: qualify_timeout
configOption.synopsis: Timeout for qualify

description.para: If the contact doesn't respond to the OPTIONS request before the timeout, the contact is marked unavailable. If 0 no timeout. Time in fractional seconds.

configOption.name: authenticate_qualify
configOption.synopsis: Authenticates a qualify challenge response if needed

description.para: If true and a qualify request receives a challenge response then authentication is attempted before declaring the contact available.

note.para: This option does nothing as we will always complete the challenge response authentication if the qualify request is challenged.

configOption.name: outbound_proxy
configOption.synopsis: Outbound proxy used when sending OPTIONS request

description.para: If set the provided URI will be used as the outbound proxy when an OPTIONS request is sent to a contact for qualify purposes.

configOption.name: support_path
configOption.synopsis: Enables Path support for REGISTER requests and Route support for other requests.

description.para: When this option is enabled, the Path headers in register requests will be saved and its contents will be used in Route headers for outbound out-of-dialog requests and in Path headers for outbound 200 responses. Path support will also be indicated in the Supported header.

configObject.name: system
configObject.synopsis: Options that apply to the SIP stack as well as other system-wide settings

description.para: The settings in this section are global. In addition to being global, the values will not be re-evaluated when a reload is performed. This is because the values must be set before the SIP stack is initialized. The only way to reset these values is to either restart Asterisk, or unload res_pjsip.so and then load it again.

configOption.name: timer_t1
configOption.synopsis: Set transaction timer T1 value (milliseconds).

description.para: Timer T1 is the base for determining how long to wait before retransmitting requests that receive no response when using an unreliable transport (e.g. UDP). For more information on this timer, see RFC 3261, Section 17.1.1.1.

configOption.name: timer_b
configOption.synopsis: Set transaction timer B value (milliseconds).

description.para: Timer B determines the maximum amount of time to wait after sending an INVITE request before terminating the transaction. It is recommended that this be set to 64 * Timer T1, but it may be set higher if desired. For more information on this timer, see RFC 3261, Section 17.1.1.1.

configOption.name: compact_headers
configOption.synopsis: Use the short forms of common SIP header names.

configOption.name: threadpool_initial_size
configOption.synopsis: Initial number of threads in the res_pjsip threadpool.

configOption.name: threadpool_auto_increment
configOption.synopsis: The amount by which the number of threads is incremented when necessary.

configOption.name: threadpool_idle_timeout
configOption.synopsis: Number of seconds before an idle thread should be disposed of.

configOption.name: threadpool_max_size
configOption.synopsis: Maximum number of threads in the res_pjsip threadpool. A value of 0 indicates no maximum.

configOption.name: disable_tcp_switch
configOption.synopsis: Disable automatic switching from UDP to TCP transports.

description.para: Disable automatic switching from UDP to TCP transports if outgoing request is too large. See RFC 3261 section 18.1.1.

configOption.name: follow_early_media_fork
configOption.synopsis: Follow SDP forked media when To tag is different

description.para: On outgoing calls, if the UAS responds with different SDP attributes on subsequent 18X or 2XX responses (such as a port update) AND the To tag on the subsequent response is different than that on the previous one, follow it.

note.para: This option must also be enabled on endpoints that require this functionality.

configOption.name: accept_multiple_sdp_answers
configOption.synopsis: Follow SDP forked media when To tag is the same

description.para: On outgoing calls, if the UAS responds with different SDP attributes on non-100rel 18X or 2XX responses (such as a port update) AND the To tag on the subsequent response is the same as that on the previous one, process the updated SDP.

note.para: This option must also be enabled on endpoints that require this functionality.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'system' UNLESS the object name is 'system'.

configObject.name: global
configObject.synopsis: Options that apply globally to all SIP communications

description.para: The settings in this section are global. Unlike options in the system section, these options can be refreshed by performing a reload.

configOption.name: max_forwards
configOption.synopsis: Value used in Max-Forwards header for SIP requests.

configOption.name: keep_alive_interval
configOption.synopsis: The interval (in seconds) to send keepalives to active connection-oriented transports.

configOption.name: contact_expiration_check_interval
configOption.synopsis: The interval (in seconds) to check for expired contacts.

configOption.name: disable_multi_domain
configOption.synopsis: Disable Multi Domain support

description.para: If disabled it can improve realtime performance by reducing the number of database requests.

configOption.name: max_initial_qualify_time
configOption.synopsis: The maximum amount of time from startup that qualifies should be attempted on all contacts. If greater than the qualify_frequency for an aor, qualify_frequency will be used instead.

configOption.name: unidentified_request_period
configOption.synopsis: The number of seconds over which to accumulate unidentified requests.

description.para: If unidentified_request_count unidentified requests are received during unidentified_request_period, a security event will be generated.

configOption.name: unidentified_request_count
configOption.synopsis: The number of unidentified requests from a single IP to allow.

description.para: If unidentified_request_count unidentified requests are received during unidentified_request_period, a security event will be generated.

configOption.name: unidentified_request_prune_interval
configOption.synopsis: The interval at which unidentified requests are older than twice the unidentified_request_period are pruned.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'global' UNLESS the object name is 'global'.

configOption.name: user_agent
configOption.synopsis: Value used in User-Agent header for SIP requests and Server header for SIP responses.

configOption.name: regcontext
configOption.synopsis: When set, Asterisk will dynamically create and destroy a NoOp priority 1 extension for a given peer who registers or unregisters with us.

configOption.name: default_outbound_endpoint
configOption.synopsis: Endpoint to use when sending an outbound request to a URI without a specified endpoint.

configOption.name: default_voicemail_extension
configOption.synopsis: The voicemail extension to send in the NOTIFY Message-Account header if not specified on endpoint or aor

configOption.name: debug
configOption.synopsis: Enable/Disable SIP debug logging. Valid options include yes|no or a host address

configOption.name: endpoint_identifier_order
configOption.synopsis: The order by which endpoint identifiers are processed and checked. Identifier names are usually derived from and can be found in the endpoint identifier module itself (res_pjsip_endpoint_identifier_*). You can use the CLI command "pjsip show identifiers" to see the identifiers currently available.

note.para: One of the identifiers is "auth_username" which matches on the username in an Authentication header. This method has some security considerations because an Authentication header is not present on the first message of a dialog when digest authentication is used. The client can't generate it until the server sends the challenge in a 401 response. Since Asterisk normally sends a security event when an incoming request can't be matched to an endpoint, using auth_username requires that the security event be deferred until a request is received with the Authentication header and only generated if the username doesn't result in a match. This may result in a delay before an attack is recognized. You can control how many unmatched requests are received from a single ip address before a security event is generated using the unidentified_request parameters.

configOption.name: default_from_user
configOption.synopsis: When Asterisk generates an outgoing SIP request, the From header username will be set to this value if there is no better option (such as CallerID) to be used.

configOption.name: default_realm
configOption.synopsis: When Asterisk generates a challenge, the digest realm will be set to this value if there is no better option (such as auth/realm) to be used.

configOption.name: mwi_tps_queue_high
configOption.synopsis: MWI taskprocessor high water alert trigger level.

description.para: On a heavily loaded system you may need to adjust the taskprocessor queue limits. If any taskprocessor queue size reaches its high water level then pjsip will stop processing new requests until the alert is cleared. The alert clears when all alerting taskprocessor queues have dropped to their low water clear level.

configOption.name: mwi_tps_queue_low
configOption.synopsis: MWI taskprocessor low water clear alert level.

description.para: On a heavily loaded system you may need to adjust the taskprocessor queue limits. If any taskprocessor queue size reaches its high water level then pjsip will stop processing new requests until the alert is cleared. The alert clears when all alerting taskprocessor queues have dropped to their low water clear level.

note.para: Set to -1 for the low water level to be 90% of the high water level.

configOption.name: mwi_disable_initial_unsolicited
configOption.synopsis: Enable/Disable sending unsolicited MWI to all endpoints on startup.

description.para: When the initial unsolicited MWI notification are enabled on startup then the initial notifications get sent at startup. If you have a lot of endpoints (thousands) that use unsolicited MWI then you may want to consider disabling the initial startup notifications.
When the initial unsolicited MWI notifications are disabled on startup then the notifications will start on the endpoint's next contact update.

configOption.name: ignore_uri_user_options
configOption.synopsis: Enable/Disable ignoring SIP URI user field options.

description.para: If you have this option enabled and there are semicolons in the user field of a SIP URI then the field is truncated at the first semicolon. This effectively makes the semicolon a non-usable character for PJSIP endpoint names, extensions, and AORs. This can be useful for improving compatibility with an ITSP that likes to use user options for whatever reason.

example.title: Sample SIP URI user field truncated

note.para: The caller-id and redirecting number strings obtained from incoming SIP URI user fields are always truncated at the first semicolon.

parameter.name: Endpoint
parameter.para: The endpoint you want to qualify.

description.para: Qualify a chan_pjsip endpoint.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Provide details about an identify section.

parameter.name: ObjectType
parameter.para: The object's type. This will always be 'identify'.

parameter.name: ObjectName
parameter.para: The name of this object.

parameter.name: EndpointName
parameter.para: The name of the endpoint associated with this information.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Provide details about an Address of Record (AoR) section.

parameter.name: ObjectType
parameter.para: The object's type. This will always be 'aor'.

parameter.name: ObjectName
parameter.para: The name of this object.

parameter.name: TotalContacts
parameter.para: The total number of contacts associated with this AoR.

parameter.name: ContactsRegistered
parameter.para: The number of non-permanent contacts associated with this AoR.

parameter.name: EndpointName
parameter.para: The name of the endpoint associated with this information.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Provide details about an authentication section.

parameter.name: ObjectType
parameter.para: The object's type. This will always be 'auth'.

parameter.name: ObjectName
parameter.para: The name of this object.

parameter.name: EndpointName
parameter.para: The name of the endpoint associated with this information.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Provide details about an authentication section.

parameter.name: ObjectType
parameter.para: The object's type. This will always be 'transport'.

parameter.name: ObjectName
parameter.para: The name of this object.

parameter.name: EndpointName
parameter.para: The name of the endpoint associated with this information.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Provide details about an endpoint section.

parameter.name: ObjectType
parameter.para: The object's type. This will always be 'endpoint'.

parameter.name: ObjectName
parameter.para: The name of this object.

parameter.name: DeviceState
parameter.para: The aggregate device state for this endpoint.

parameter.name: ActiveChannels
parameter.para: The number of active channels associated with this endpoint.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Provide details about a contact's status.

parameter.name: AOR
parameter.para: The AoR that owns this contact.

parameter.name: URI
parameter.para: This contact's URI.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.para: This contact's status.

parameter.name: RoundtripUsec
parameter.para: The round trip time in microseconds.

parameter.name: EndpointName
parameter.para: The name of the endpoint associated with this information.

parameter.name: UserAgent
parameter.para: Content of the User-Agent header in REGISTER request

parameter.name: RegExpire
parameter.para: Absolute time that this contact is no longer valid after

parameter.name: ViaAddress
parameter.para: IP address:port of the last Via header in REGISTER request. Will only appear in the event if available.

parameter.name: CallID
parameter.para: Content of the Call-ID header in REGISTER request. Will only appear in the event if available.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.para: The sorcery ID of the contact.

parameter.name: AuthenticateQualify
parameter.para: A boolean indicating whether a qualify should be authenticated.

parameter.name: OutboundProxy
parameter.para: The contact's outbound proxy.

parameter.name: Path
parameter.para: The Path header received on the REGISTER.

parameter.name: QualifyFrequency
parameter.para: The interval in seconds at which the contact will be qualified.

parameter.name: QualifyTimeout
parameter.para: The elapsed time in decimal seconds after which an OPTIONS message is sent before the contact is considered unavailable.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Provide details about a contact's status.

parameter.name: ObjectType
parameter.para: The object's type. This will always be 'endpoint'.

parameter.name: ObjectName
parameter.para: The name of this object.

parameter.name: Transport
parameter.para: The transport configurations associated with this endpoint.

parameter.name: Aor
parameter.para: The aor configurations associated with this endpoint.

parameter.name: Auths
parameter.para: The inbound authentication configurations associated with this endpoint.

parameter.name: OutboundAuths
parameter.para: The outbound authentication configurations associated with this endpoint.

parameter.name: DeviceState
parameter.para: The aggregate device state for this endpoint.

parameter.name: ActiveChannels
parameter.para: The number of active channels associated with this endpoint.

description.para: Provides a listing of all endpoints. For each endpoint an EndpointList event is raised that contains relevant attributes and status information. Once all endpoints have been listed an EndpointListComplete event is issued.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Provide final information about an endpoint list.

manager.name: PJSIPShowEndpoint
manager.synopsis: Detail listing of an endpoint and its objects.

parameter.name: Endpoint
parameter.para: The endpoint to list.

description.para: Provides a detailed listing of options for a given endpoint. Events are issued showing the configuration and status of the endpoint and associated objects. These events include EndpointDetail, AorDetail, AuthDetail, TransportDetail, and IdentifyDetail. Some events may be listed multiple times if multiple objects are associated (for instance AoRs). Once all detail events have been raised a final EndpointDetailComplete event is issued.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Provide final information about endpoint details.

description.para: This module allows res_pjsip to register to other SIP servers.
Registration is COMPLETELY separate from the rest of pjsip.conf. A minimal configuration consists of setting a server_uri and a client_uri.

configOption.name: auth_rejection_permanent
configOption.synopsis: Determines whether failed authentication challenges are treated as permanent failures.

description.para: If this option is enabled and an authentication challenge fails, registration will not be attempted again until the configuration is reloaded.

configOption.name: client_uri
configOption.synopsis: Client SIP URI used when attemping outbound registration

description.para: This is the address-of-record for the outbound registration (i.e. the URI in the To header of the REGISTER).

For registration with an ITSP, the client SIP URI may need to consist of an account name or number and the provider's hostname for their registrar, e.g. client_uri=1234567890@example.com. This may differ between providers.
For registration to generic registrars, the client SIP URI will depend on networking specifics and configuration of the registrar.

configOption.name: contact_user
configOption.synopsis: Contact User to use in request

configOption.name: expiration
configOption.synopsis: Expiration time for registrations in seconds

configOption.name: max_retries
configOption.synopsis: Maximum number of registration attempts.

configOption.name: outbound_auth
configOption.synopsis: Authentication object(s) to be used for outbound registrations.

description.para: This is a comma-delimited list of auth sections defined in pjsip.conf used to respond to outbound authentication challenges.

note.para: Using the same auth section for inbound and outbound authentication is not recommended. There is a difference in meaning for an empty realm setting between inbound and outbound authentication uses. See the auth realm description for details.

configOption.name: outbound_proxy
configOption.synopsis: Full SIP URI of the outbound proxy used to send registrations

configOption.name: retry_interval
configOption.synopsis: Interval in seconds between retries if outbound registration is unsuccessful

configOption.name: forbidden_retry_interval
configOption.synopsis: Interval used when receiving a 403 Forbidden response.

description.para: If a 403 Forbidden is received, chan_pjsip will wait forbidden_retry_interval seconds before attempting registration again. If 0 is specified, chan_pjsip will not retry after receiving a 403 Forbidden response. Setting this to a non-zero value goes against a "SHOULD NOT" in RFC3261, but can be used to work around buggy registrars.

configOption.name: fatal_retry_interval
configOption.synopsis: Interval used when receiving a Fatal response.

description.para: If a fatal response is received, chan_pjsip will wait fatal_retry_interval seconds before attempting registration again. If 0 is specified, chan_pjsip will not retry after receiving a fatal (non-temporary 4xx, 5xx, 6xx) response. Setting this to a non-zero value may go against a "SHOULD NOT" in RFC3261, but can be used to work around buggy registrars.

note.para: if also set the forbidden_retry_interval takes precedence over this one when a 403 is received. Also, if auth_rejection_permanent equals 'yes' then a 401 and 407 become subject to this retry interval.

configOption.name: server_uri
configOption.synopsis: SIP URI of the server to register against

description.para: This is the URI at which to find the registrar to send the outbound REGISTER. This URI is used as the request URI of the outbound REGISTER request from Asterisk.
For registration with an ITSP, the setting may often be just the domain of the registrar, e.g. sip:sip.example.com.

configOption.name: transport
configOption.synopsis: Transport used for outbound authentication

note.para: A transport configured in pjsip.conf. As with other res_pjsip modules, this will use the first available transport of the appropriate type if unconfigured.

configOption.name: line
configOption.synopsis: Whether to add a 'line' parameter to the Contact for inbound call matching

description.para: When enabled this option will cause a 'line' parameter to be added to the Contact header placed into the outgoing registration request. If the remote server sends a call this line parameter will be used to establish a relationship to the outbound registration, ultimately causing the configured endpoint to be used.

configOption.name: endpoint
configOption.synopsis: Endpoint to use for incoming related calls

description.para: When line support is enabled this configured endpoint name is used for incoming calls that are related to the outbound registration.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'registration'.

configOption.name: support_path
configOption.synopsis: Enables Path support for outbound REGISTER requests.

description.para: When this option is enabled, outbound REGISTER requests will advertise support for Path headers so that intervening proxies can add to the Path header as necessary.

parameter.name: Registration
parameter.para: The outbound registration to unregister or '*all' to unregister them all.

description.para: Unregisters the specified (or all) outbound registration(s) and stops future registration attempts. Call PJSIPRegister to start registration and schedule re-registrations according to configuration.

parameter.name: Registration
parameter.para: The outbound registration to register or '*all' to register them all.

description.para: Unregisters the specified (or all) outbound registration(s) then starts registration and schedules re-registrations according to configuration.

In response OutboundRegistrationDetail events showing configuration and status information are raised for each outbound registration object. AuthDetail events are raised for each associated auth object as well. Once all events are completed an OutboundRegistrationDetailComplete is issued.

manager.name: Parkinglots
manager.synopsis: Get a list of parking lots

description.para: List all parking lots as a series of AMI events

parameter.name: ParkingLot
parameter.para: If specified, only show parked calls from the parking lot with this name.

description.para: List parked calls.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Channel name to park.

parameter.name: TimeoutChannel
parameter.para: Channel name to use when constructing the dial string that will be dialed if the parked channel times out. If TimeoutChannel is in a two party bridge with Channel, then TimeoutChannel will receive an announcement and be treated as having parked Channel in the same manner as the Park Call DTMF feature.

parameter.name: AnnounceChannel
parameter.para: If specified, then this channel will receive an announcement when Channel is parked if AnnounceChannel is in a state where it can receive announcements (AnnounceChannel must be bridged). AnnounceChannel has no bearing on the actual state of the parked call.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.para: Overrides the timeout of the parking lot for this park action. Specified in milliseconds, but will be converted to seconds. Use a value of 0 to disable the timeout.

parameter.name: Parkinglot
parameter.para: The parking lot to use when parking the channel

description.para: Park an arbitrary channel with optional arguments for specifying the parking lot used, how long the channel should remain parked, and what dial string to use as the parker if the call times out.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a channel is parked.

parameter.name: ParkerDialString
parameter.para: Dial String that can be used to call back the parker on ParkingTimeout.

parameter.name: Parkinglot
parameter.para: Name of the parking lot that the parkee is parked in

parameter.name: ParkingSpace
parameter.para: Parking Space that the parkee is parked in

parameter.name: ParkingTimeout
parameter.para: Time remaining until the parkee is forcefully removed from parking in seconds

parameter.name: ParkingDuration
parameter.para: Time the parkee has been in the parking bridge (in seconds)

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a channel leaves a parking lot due to reaching the time limit of being parked.
Raised when a channel leaves a parking lot because it hung up without being answered.
Raised when a channel leaves a parking lot because it was retrieved from the parking lot and reconnected.
Raised when a channel takes the place of a previously parked channel

description.para: This event is raised when a channel initially parked in the parking lot is swapped out with a different channel. The most common case for this is when an attended transfer to a parking lot occurs. The Parkee information in the event will indicate the party that was swapped into the parking lot.

parameter.name: parking_lot_name
parameter.para: Specify in which parking lot to park a call.
The parking lot used is selected in the following order:
1) parking_lot_name option to this application
2) PARKINGLOT variable
3) CHANNEL(parkinglot) function (Possibly preset by the channel driver.)
4) Default parking lot.

parameter.name: options
parameter.para: A list of options for this parked call.

option.name: r
option.para: Send ringing instead of MOH to the parked call.

option.name: R
option.para: Randomize the selection of a parking space.

option.name: s
option.para: Silence announcement of the parking space number.

option.name: c
option.para: If the parking times out, go to this place in the dialplan instead of where the parking lot defines the call should go.

option.name: t
option.para: Use a timeout of duration seconds instead of the timeout specified by the parking lot.

description.para: Used to park yourself (typically in combination with an attended transfer to know the parking space).

If you set the PARKINGEXTEN variable to a parking space extension in the parking lot, Park() will attempt to park the call on that extension. If the extension is already in use then execution will continue at the next priority.

If the parkeddynamic option is enabled in res_parking.conf the following variables can be used to dynamically create new parking lots. When using dynamic parking lots, be aware of the conditions as explained in the notes section below.

The PARKINGDYNAMIC variable specifies the parking lot to use as a template to create a dynamic parking lot. It is an error to specify a non-existent parking lot for the template. If not set then the default parking lot is used as the template.

The PARKINGDYNCONTEXT variable specifies the dialplan context to use for the newly created dynamic parking lot. If not set then the context from the parking lot template is used. The context is created if it does not already exist and the new parking lot needs to create extensions.

The PARKINGDYNEXTEN variable specifies the parkext to use for the newly created dynamic parking lot. If not set then the parkext is used from the parking lot template. If the template does not specify a parkext then no extensions are created for the newly created parking lot. The dynamic parking lot cannot be created if it needs to create extensions that overlap existing parking lot extensions. The only exception to this is for the parkext extension and only if neither of the overlaping parking lot's parkext is exclusive.
The PARKINGDYNPOS variable specifies the parking positions to use for the newly created dynamic parking lot. If not set then the parkpos from the parking lot template is used.

note.para: This application must be used as the first extension priority to be recognized as a parking access extension for blind transfers. Blind transfers and the DTMF one-touch parking feature need this distinction to operate properly. The parking access extension in this case is treated like a dialplan hint.

parameter.name: parking_lot_name
parameter.para: Specify from which parking lot to retrieve a parked call.
The parking lot used is selected in the following order:
1) parking_lot_name option
2) PARKINGLOT variable
3) CHANNEL(parkinglot) function (Possibly preset by the channel driver.)
4) Default parking lot.

parameter.name: parking_space
parameter.para: Parking space to retrieve a parked call from. If not provided then the first available parked call in the parking lot will be retrieved.

description.para: Used to retrieve a parked call from a parking lot.

note.para: If a parking lot's parkext option is set, then Parking lots will automatically create and manage dialplan extensions in the parking lot context. If that is the case then you will not need to manage parking extensions yourself, just include the parking context of the parking lot.

parameter.name: parking_lot_name
parameter.para: Specify in which parking lot to park a call.
The parking lot used is selected in the following order:
1) parking_lot_name option to this application
2) PARKINGLOT variable
3) CHANNEL(parkinglot) function (Possibly preset by the channel driver.)
4) Default parking lot.

parameter.name: options
parameter.para: A list of options for this parked call.

option.name: r
option.para: Send ringing instead of MOH to the parked call.

option.name: R
option.para: Randomize the selection of a parking space.

option.name: c
option.para: If the parking times out, go to this place in the dialplan instead of where the parking lot defines the call should go.

option.name: t
option.para: Use a timeout of duration seconds instead of the timeout specified by the parking lot.

argument.name: announce
argument.para: Colon-separated list of files to announce. The word PARKED will be replaced by a say_digits of the extension in which the call is parked.

parameter.name: dial
parameter.para: The app_dial style resource to call to make the announcement. Console/dsp calls the console.

description.para: Park a call into the parkinglot and announce the call to another channel.
The variable PARKEDAT will contain the parking extension into which the call was placed. Use with the Local channel to allow the dialplan to make use of this information.

manager.name: DeviceStateList
manager.synopsis: List the current known device states.

description.para: This will list out all known device states in a sequence of DeviceStateChange events. When finished, a DeviceStateListComplete event will be emitted.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Indicates the end of the list the current known extension states.

parameter.name: EventList
parameter.para: Conveys the status of the event list.

parameter.name: ListItems
parameter.para: Conveys the number of statuses reported.

configInfo.name: res_ari
configInfo.synopsis: HTTP binding for the Stasis API

configOption.name: enabled
configOption.synopsis: Enable/disable the ARI module

description.para: This option enables or disables the ARI module.

note.para: ARI uses Asterisk's HTTP server, which must also be enabled in http.conf.

configOption.name: websocket_write_timeout
configOption.synopsis: The timeout (in milliseconds) to set on WebSocket connections.

description.para: If a websocket connection accepts input slowly, the timeout for writes to it can be increased to keep it from being disconnected. Value is in milliseconds; default is 100 ms.

configOption.name: pretty
configOption.synopsis: Responses from ARI are formatted to be human readable

configOption.name: auth_realm
configOption.synopsis: Realm to use for authentication. Defaults to Asterisk REST Interface.

configOption.name: allowed_origins
configOption.synopsis: Comma separated list of allowed origins, for Cross-Origin Resource Sharing. May be set to * to allow all origins.

configOption.name: channelvars
configOption.synopsis: Comma separated list of channel variables to display in channel json.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Define this configuration section as a user.

enum.name: user
enum.para: Configure this section as a user

configOption.name: read_only
configOption.synopsis: When set to yes, user is only authorized for read-only requests

configOption.name: password
configOption.synopsis: Crypted or plaintext password (see password_format)

configOption.name: password_format
configOption.synopsis: password_format may be set to plain (the default) or crypt. When set to crypt, crypt(3) is used to validate the password. A crypted password can be generated using mkpasswd -m sha-512. When set to plain, the password is in plaintext

configObject.name: mailboxes
configObject.synopsis: Persistent cache of external MWI Mailboxs.

description.para: Allows the alteration of sorcery backend mapping for the persistent cache of external MWI mailboxes.

function.name: PJSIP_HEADER
function.synopsis: Gets headers from an inbound PJSIP channel. Adds, updates or removes the specified SIP header from an outbound PJSIP channel.

enum.name: read
enum.para: Returns instance number of header name.

enum.name: add
enum.para: Adds a new header name to this session.

enum.name: update
enum.para: Updates instance number of header name to a new value. The header must already exist.

enum.name: remove
enum.para: Removes all instances of previously added headers whose names match name. A * may be appended to name to remove all headers beginning with name. name may be set to a single * to clear all previously added headers. In all cases, the number of headers actually removed is returned.

parameter.name: name
parameter.para: The name of the header.

parameter.name: number
parameter.para: If there's more than 1 header with the same name, this specifies which header to read or update. If not specified, defaults to 1 meaning the first matching header. Not valid for add or remove.

description.para: PJSIP_HEADER allows you to read specific SIP headers from the inbound PJSIP channel as well as write(add, update, remove) headers on the outbound channel. One exception is that you can read headers that you have already added on the outbound channel.
Examples:
; Set 'somevar' to the value of the 'From' header.
exten => 1,1,Set(somevar=${PJSIP_HEADER(read,From)})
; Set 'via2' to the value of the 2nd 'Via' header.
exten => 1,1,Set(via2=${PJSIP_HEADER(read,Via,2)})
; Add an 'X-Myheader' header with the value of 'myvalue'.
exten => 1,1,Set(PJSIP_HEADER(add,X-MyHeader)=myvalue)
; Add an 'X-Myheader' header with an empty value.
exten => 1,1,Set(PJSIP_HEADER(add,X-MyHeader)=)
; Update the value of the header named 'X-Myheader' to 'newvalue'.
; 'X-Myheader' must already exist or the call will fail.
exten => 1,1,Set(PJSIP_HEADER(update,X-MyHeader)=newvalue)
; Remove all headers whose names exactly match 'X-MyHeader'.
exten => 1,1,Set(PJSIP_HEADER(remove,X-MyHeader)=)
; Remove all headers that begin with 'X-My'.
exten => 1,1,Set(PJSIP_HEADER(remove,X-My*)=)
; Remove all previously added headers.
exten => 1,1,Set(PJSIP_HEADER(remove,*)=)

note.para: The remove action can be called by reading or writing PJSIP_HEADER.
; Display the number of headers removed
exten => 1,1,Verbose( Removed ${PJSIP_HEADER(remove,X-MyHeader)} headers)
; Set a variable to the number of headers removed
exten => 1,1,Set(count=${PJSIP_HEADER(remove,X-MyHeader)})
; Just remove them ignoring any count
exten => 1,1,Set(=${PJSIP_HEADER(remove,X-MyHeader)})
exten => 1,1,Set(PJSIP_HEADER(remove,X-MyHeader)=)

If you call PJSIP_HEADER in a normal dialplan context you'll be operating on the caller's (incoming) channel which may not be what you want. To operate on the callee's (outgoing) channel call PJSIP_HEADER in a pre-dial handler.
Example:
[handler]
exten => addheader,1,Set(PJSIP_HEADER(add,X-MyHeader)=myvalue)
exten => addheader,2,Set(PJSIP_HEADER(add,X-MyHeader2)=myvalue2)
[somecontext]
exten => 1,1,Dial(PJSIP/${EXTEN},,b(handler^addheader^1))

configInfo.name: res_hep
configInfo.synopsis: Resource for integration with Homer using HEPv3

description.para: The general settings section contains information to configure Asterisk as a Homer capture agent.

configOption.name: enabled
configOption.synopsis: Enable or disable packet capturing.

configOption.name: uuid_type
configOption.synopsis: The preferred type of UUID to pass to Homer.

configOption.name: capture_address
configOption.synopsis: The address and port of the Homer server to send packets to.

configOption.name: capture_password
configOption.synopsis: If set, the authentication password to send to Homer.

configOption.name: capture_id
configOption.synopsis: The ID for this capture agent.

function.name: SMDI_MSG_RETRIEVE
function.synopsis: Retrieve an SMDI message.

enum.name: t
enum.para: Instead of searching on the forwarding station, search on the message desk terminal.

enum.name: n
enum.para: Instead of searching on the forwarding station, search on the message desk number.

description.para: This function is used to retrieve an incoming SMDI message. It returns an ID which can be used with the SMDI_MSG() function to access details of the message. Note that this is a destructive function in the sense that once an SMDI message is retrieved using this function, it is no longer in the global SMDI message queue, and can not be accessed by any other Asterisk channels. The timeout for this function is optional, and the default is 3 seconds. When providing a timeout, it should be in milliseconds.
The default search is done on the forwarding station ID. However, if you set one of the search key options in the options field, you can change this behavior.

function.name: SMDI_MSG
function.synopsis: Retrieve details about an SMDI message.

parameter.name: component
parameter.para: Valid message components are:

enum.name: callerid
enum.para: The callerID of the calling party that was forwarded

enum.name: type
enum.para: The call type. The value here is the exact character that came in on the SMDI link. Typically, example values are:

description.para: This function is used to access details of an SMDI message that was pulled from the incoming SMDI message queue using the SMDI_MSG_RETRIEVE() function.

Provides a listing of all inbound subscriptions. An event InboundSubscriptionDetail is issued for each subscription object. Once all detail events are completed an InboundSubscriptionDetailComplete event is issued.

Provides a listing of all outbound subscriptions. An event OutboundSubscriptionDetail is issued for each subscription object. Once all detail events are completed an OutboundSubscriptionDetailComplete event is issued.

manager.name: PJSIPShowResourceLists
manager.synopsis: Displays settings for configured resource lists.

description.para: Provides a listing of all resource lists. An event ResourceListDetail is issued for each resource list object. Once all detail events are completed a ResourceListDetailComplete event is issued.

configInfo.name: res_pjsip_pubsub
configInfo.synopsis: Module that implements publish and subscribe support.

configObject.name: subscription_persistence
configObject.synopsis: Persists SIP subscriptions so they survive restarts.

configOption.name: packet
configOption.synopsis: Entire SIP SUBSCRIBE packet that created the subscription

configOption.name: src_name
configOption.synopsis: The source address of the subscription

configOption.name: src_port
configOption.synopsis: The source port of the subscription

configOption.name: transport_key
configOption.synopsis: The type of transport the subscription was received on

configOption.name: local_name
configOption.synopsis: The local address the subscription was received on

configOption.name: local_port
configOption.synopsis: The local port the subscription was received on

configOption.name: cseq
configOption.synopsis: The sequence number of the next NOTIFY to be sent

configOption.name: tag
configOption.synopsis: The local tag of the dialog for the subscription

configOption.name: endpoint
configOption.synopsis: The name of the endpoint that subscribed

configOption.name: expires
configOption.synopsis: The time at which the subscription expires

configOption.name: contact_uri
configOption.synopsis: The Contact URI of the dialog for the subscription

configOption.name: prune_on_boot
configOption.synopsis: If set, indicates that the contact used a reliable transport and therefore the subscription must be deleted after an asterisk restart.

description.para: This configuration object allows for RFC 4662 resource list subscriptions to be specified. This can be useful to decrease the amount of subscription traffic that a server has to process.

note.para: Current limitations limit the size of SIP NOTIFY requests that Asterisk sends to 64000 bytes. If your resource list notifications are larger than this maximum, you will need to make adjustments.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'resource_list'

configOption.name: event
configOption.synopsis: The SIP event package that the list resource belong to.

description.para: The SIP event package describes the types of resources that Asterisk reports the state of.

configOption.name: list_item
configOption.synopsis: The name of a resource to report state on

description.para: In general Asterisk looks up list items in the following way:
1. Check if the list item refers to another configured resource list.
2. Pass the name of the resource off to event-package-specific handlers to find the specified resource.

The second part means that the way the list item is specified depends on what type of list this is. For instance, if you have the event set to presence, then list items should be in the form of dialplan_extension@dialplan_context. For message-summary mailbox names should be listed.

configOption.name: full_state
configOption.synopsis: Indicates if the entire list's state should be sent out.

description.para: If this option is enabled, and a resource changes state, then Asterisk will construct a notification that contains the state of all resources in the list. If the option is disabled, Asterisk will construct a notification that only contains the states of resources that have changed.

note.para: Even with this option disabled, there are certain situations where Asterisk is forced to send a notification with the states of all resources in the list. When a subscriber renews or terminates its subscription to the list, Asterisk MUST send a full state notification.

configOption.name: notification_batch_interval
configOption.synopsis: Time Asterisk should wait, in milliseconds, before sending notifications.

description.para: When a resource's state changes, it may be desired to wait a certain amount before Asterisk sends a notification to subscribers. This allows for other state changes to accumulate, so that Asterisk can communicate multiple state changes in a single notification instead of rapidly sending many notifications.

configOption.name: endpoint
configOption.synopsis: Optional name of an endpoint that is only allowed to publish to this resource

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'inbound-publication'.

application.name: ReceiveFAX
application.synopsis: Receive a FAX and save as a TIFF/F file.

option.name: d
option.para: Enable FAX debugging.

option.name: f
option.para: Allow audio fallback FAX transfer on T.38 capable channels.

option.name: F
option.para: Force usage of audio mode on T.38 capable channels.

option.name: s
option.para: Send progress Manager events (overrides statusevents setting in res_fax.conf).

description.para: This application is provided by res_fax, which is a FAX technology agnostic module that utilizes FAX technology resource modules to complete a FAX transmission.
Session arguments can be set by the FAXOPT function and to check results of the ReceiveFax() application.

application.name: SendFAX
application.synopsis: Sends a specified TIFF/F file as a FAX.

argument.name: filename2
argument.para: TIFF file to send as a FAX.

option.name: d
option.para: Enable FAX debugging.

option.name: f
option.para: Allow audio fallback FAX transfer on T.38 capable channels.

option.name: F
option.para: Force usage of audio mode on T.38 capable channels.

option.name: s
option.para: Send progress Manager events (overrides statusevents setting in res_fax.conf).

option.name: z
option.para: Initiate a T.38 reinvite on the channel if the remote end does not.

description.para: This application is provided by res_fax, which is a FAX technology agnostic module that utilizes FAX technology resource modules to complete a FAX transmission.
Session arguments can be set by the FAXOPT function and to check results of the SendFax() application.

function.name: FAXOPT
function.synopsis: Gets/sets various pieces of information about a fax session.

enum.name: ecm
enum.para: R/W Error Correction Mode (ECM) enable with 'yes', disable with 'no'.

enum.name: error
enum.para: R/O FAX transmission error code upon failure.

enum.name: filename
enum.para: R/O Filename of the first file of the FAX transmission.

enum.name: filenames
enum.para: R/O Filenames of all of the files in the FAX transmission (comma separated).

enum.name: minrate
enum.para: R/W Minimum transfer rate set before transmission.

enum.name: maxrate
enum.para: R/W Maximum transfer rate set before transmission.

enum.name: gateway
enum.para: R/W T38 fax gateway, with optional fax activity timeout in seconds (yes[,timeout]/no)

enum.name: faxdetect
enum.para: R/W Enable FAX detect with optional timeout in seconds (yes,t38,cng[,timeout]/no)

enum.name: remotestationid
enum.para: R/O Remote Station Identification after transmission.

enum.name: resolution
enum.para: R/O Negotiated image resolution after transmission.

enum.name: sessionid
enum.para: R/O Session ID of the FAX transmission.

enum.name: status
enum.para: R/O Result Status of the FAX transmission.

enum.name: statusstr
enum.para: R/O Verbose Result Status of the FAX transmission.

enum.name: t38timeout
enum.para: R/W The timeout used for T.38 negotiation.

description.para: FAXOPT can be used to override the settings for a FAX session listed in res_fax.conf, it can also be used to retrieve information about a FAX session that has finished eg. pages/status.

Will generate a series of FAXSession events with information about each FAXSession. Closes with a FAXSessionsComplete event which includes a count of the included FAX sessions. This action works in the same manner as the CLI command 'fax show sessions'

managerEventInstance.synopsis: A single list item for the FAXSessions AMI command

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Name of the channel responsible for the FAX session

parameter.name: Technology
parameter.para: The FAX technology that the FAX session is using

parameter.name: SessionNumber
parameter.para: The numerical identifier for this particular session

parameter.name: SessionType
parameter.para: FAX session passthru/relay type

parameter.name: Operation
parameter.para: FAX session operation type

parameter.name: State
parameter.para: Current state of the FAX session

parameter.name: Files
parameter.para: File or list of files associated with this FAX session

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when all FAXSession events are completed for a FAXSessions command

parameter.name: Total
parameter.para: Count of FAXSession events sent in response to FAXSessions action

manager.name: FAXSession
manager.synopsis: Responds with a detailed description of a single FAX session

parameter.name: SessionNumber
parameter.para: The session ID of the fax the user is interested in.

description.para: Provides details about a specific FAX session. The response will include a common subset of the output from the CLI command 'fax show session <session_number>' for each technology. If the FAX technolgy used by this session does not include a handler for FAXSession, then this action will fail.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised in response to FAXSession manager command

parameter.name: SessionNumber
parameter.para: The numerical identifier for this particular session

parameter.name: ErrorCorrectionMode
parameter.para: Whether error correcting mode is enabled for the FAX session. This field is not included when operation is 'V.21 Detect' or if operation is 'gateway' and state is 'Uninitialized'

parameter.name: DataRate
parameter.para: Bit rate of the FAX. This field is not included when operation is 'V.21 Detect' or if operation is 'gateway' and state is 'Uninitialized'.

parameter.name: ImageResolution
parameter.para: Resolution of each page of the FAX. Will be in the format of X_RESxY_RES. This field is not included if the operation is anything other than Receive/Transmit.

parameter.name: PageNumber
parameter.para: Current number of pages transferred during this FAX session. May change as the FAX progresses. This field is not included when operation is 'V.21 Detect' or if operation is 'gateway' and state is 'Uninitialized'.

parameter.name: FileName
parameter.para: Filename of the image being sent/received for this FAX session. This field is not included if Operation isn't 'send' or 'receive'.

parameter.name: PagesTransmitted
parameter.para: Total number of pages sent during this session. This field is not included if Operation isn't 'send' or 'receive'. Will always be 0 for 'receive'.

parameter.name: PagesReceived
parameter.para: Total number of pages received during this session. This field is not included if Operation is not 'send' or 'receive'. Will be 0 for 'send'.

parameter.name: TotalBadLines
parameter.para: Total number of bad lines sent/received during this session. This field is not included if Operation is not 'send' or 'received'.

description.para: Provides FAX statistics including the number of active sessions, reserved sessions, completed sessions, failed sessions, and the number of receive/transmit attempts. This command provides all of the non-technology specific information provided by the CLI command 'fax show stats'

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised in response to FAXStats manager command

parameter.name: CurrentSessions
parameter.para: Number of active FAX sessions

parameter.name: ReservedSessions
parameter.para: Number of reserved FAX sessions

parameter.name: TransmitAttempts
parameter.para: Total FAX sessions for which Asterisk is/was the transmitter

parameter.name: ReceiveAttempts
parameter.para: Total FAX sessions for which Asterisk is/was the recipient

parameter.name: CompletedFAXes
parameter.para: Total FAX sessions which have been completed successfully

parameter.name: FailedFAXes
parameter.para: Total FAX sessions which failed to complete successfully

description.para: Plays hold music specified by class. If omitted, the default music source for the channel will be used. Change the default class with Set(CHANNEL(musicclass)=...). If duration is given, hold music will be played specified number of seconds. If duration is ommited, music plays indefinitely. Returns 0 when done, -1 on hangup.
This application does not automatically answer and should be preceeded by an application such as Answer() or Progress().
Starts playing music on hold, uses default music class for channel. Starts playing music specified by class. If omitted, the default music source for the channel will be used. Always returns 0.
Stops playing music on hold.

description.para: Pass in a string, with phoneprov variables you want substituted in the format of %{VARNAME}, and you will get the string rendered for each user in phoneprov excluding ones with MAC address exclude_mac. Probably not useful outside of res_phoneprov.
Example: ${PP_EACH_USER(<item><fn>%{DISPLAY_NAME}</fn></item>|${MAC})

parameter.name: OldMessages

parameter.name: NewMessages

description.para: Update the mailbox message counts.

application.name: JabberSend
application.synopsis: Sends an XMPP message to a buddy.

parameter.name: account
parameter.para: The local named account to listen on (specified in xmpp.conf)

parameter.name: jid
parameter.para: Jabber ID of the buddy to send the message to. It can be a bare JID (username@domain) or a full JID (username@domain/resource).

parameter.name: message
parameter.para: The message to send.

description.para: Sends the content of message as text message from the given account to the buddy identified by jid
Example: JabberSend(asterisk,bob@domain.com,Hello world) sends "Hello world" to bob@domain.com as an XMPP message from the account asterisk, configured in xmpp.conf.

function.name: JABBER_RECEIVE
function.synopsis: Reads XMPP messages.

parameter.name: account
parameter.para: The local named account to listen on (specified in xmpp.conf)

parameter.name: jid
parameter.para: Jabber ID of the buddy to receive message from. It can be a bare JID (username@domain) or a full JID (username@domain/resource).

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: In seconds, defaults to 20.

description.para: Receives a text message on the given account from the buddy identified by jid and returns the contents.
Example: ${JABBER_RECEIVE(asterisk,bob@domain.com)} returns an XMPP message sent from bob@domain.com (or nothing in case of a time out), to the asterisk XMPP account configured in xmpp.conf.

function.name: JABBER_STATUS
function.synopsis: Retrieves a buddy's status.

parameter.name: account
parameter.para: The local named account to listen on (specified in xmpp.conf)

parameter.name: jid
parameter.para: Jabber ID of the buddy to receive message from. It can be a bare JID (username@domain) or a full JID (username@domain/resource).

description.para: Retrieves the numeric status associated with the buddy identified by jid. If the buddy does not exist in the buddylist, returns 7.
Status will be 1-7.
1=Online, 2=Chatty, 3=Away, 4=XAway, 5=DND, 6=Offline
If not in roster variable will be set to 7.
Example: ${JABBER_STATUS(asterisk,bob@domain.com)} returns 1 if bob@domain.com is online. asterisk is the associated XMPP account configured in xmpp.conf.

application.name: JabberSendGroup
application.synopsis: Send a Jabber Message to a specified chat room

parameter.name: Message

parameter.name: Nickname

description.para: Allows user to send a message to a chat room via XMPP.

note.para: To be able to send messages to a chat room, a user must have previously joined it. Use the JabberJoin function to do so.

parameter.name: Jabber

parameter.name: RoomJID

parameter.name: Nickname

note.para: If a different nickname is supplied to an already joined room, the old nick will be changed to the new one.

description.para: Allows Asterisk to join a chat room.

parameter.name: Jabber

parameter.name: RoomJID
parameter.para: XMPP/Jabber JID (Name) of chat room.

parameter.name: Nickname
parameter.para: The nickname Asterisk uses in the chat room.

description.para: Allows Asterisk to leave a chat room.

application.name: JabberStatus
application.synopsis: Retrieve the status of a jabber list member

parameter.name: Variable
parameter.para: Variable to store the status of requested user.

description.para: This application is deprecated. Please use the JABBER_STATUS() function instead.
Retrieves the numeric status associated with the specified buddy JID. The return value in the Variablewill be one of the following.
