function.name: ODBC
function.synopsis: Controls ODBC transaction properties.

enum.name: transaction
enum.para: Gets or sets the active transaction ID. If set, and the transaction ID does not exist and a database name is specified as an argument, it will be created.

enum.name: forcecommit
enum.para: Controls whether a transaction will be automatically committed when the channel hangs up. Defaults to false. If a transaction ID is specified in the optional argument, the property will be applied to that ID, otherwise to the current active ID.

enum.name: isolation
enum.para: Controls the data isolation on uncommitted transactions. May be one of the following: read_committed, read_uncommitted, repeatable_read, or serializable. Defaults to the database setting in res_odbc.conf or read_committed if not specified. If a transaction ID is specified as an optional argument, it will be applied to that ID, otherwise the current active ID.

description.para: The ODBC() function allows setting several properties to influence how a connected database processes transactions.

application.name: ODBC_Commit
application.synopsis: Commits a currently open database transaction.

description.para: Commits the database transaction specified by transaction ID or the current active transaction, if not specified.

application.name: ODBC_Rollback
application.synopsis: Rollback a currently open database transaction.

description.para: Rolls back the database transaction specified by transaction ID or the current active transaction, if not specified.

configObject.name: startup
configObject.synopsis: Asterisk startup time options for PJPROJECT

note.para: The id of this object, as well as its type, must be 'startup' or it won't be found.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'startup'.

configOption.name: log_level
configOption.synopsis: Initial maximum pjproject logging level to log.

description.para: Valid values are: 0-6, and default

note.para: This option is needed very early in the startup process so it can only be read from config files because the modules for other methods have not been loaded yet.

configObject.name: log_mappings
configObject.synopsis: PJPROJECT to Asterisk Log Level Mapping

description.para: Warnings and errors in the pjproject libraries are generally handled by Asterisk. In many cases, Asterisk wouldn't even consider them to be warnings or errors so the messages emitted by pjproject directly are either superfluous or misleading. The 'log_mappings' object allows mapping the pjproject levels to Asterisk levels, or nothing.

note.para: The id of this object, as well as its type, must be 'log_mappings' or it won't be found.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'log_mappings'.

configOption.name: asterisk_error
configOption.synopsis: A comma separated list of pjproject log levels to map to Asterisk LOG_ERROR.

configOption.name: asterisk_warning
configOption.synopsis: A comma separated list of pjproject log levels to map to Asterisk LOG_WARNING.

configOption.name: asterisk_notice
configOption.synopsis: A comma separated list of pjproject log levels to map to Asterisk LOG_NOTICE.

configOption.name: asterisk_debug
configOption.synopsis: A comma separated list of pjproject log levels to map to Asterisk LOG_DEBUG.

configOption.name: asterisk_verbose
configOption.synopsis: A comma separated list of pjproject log levels to map to Asterisk LOG_VERBOSE.

configInfo.name: res_pjsip_publish_asterisk
configInfo.synopsis: SIP resource for inbound and outbound Asterisk event publications

para.emphasis: Inbound and outbound Asterisk event publication

description.para: This module allows res_pjsip to send and receive Asterisk event publications.

configObject.name: asterisk-publication
configObject.synopsis: The configuration for inbound Asterisk event publication

description.para: Publish is COMPLETELY separate from the rest of pjsip.conf.

configOption.name: devicestate_publish
configOption.synopsis: Optional name of a publish item that can be used to publish a request for full device state information.

configOption.name: mailboxstate_publish
configOption.synopsis: Optional name of a publish item that can be used to publish a request for full mailbox state information.

configOption.name: device_state
configOption.synopsis: Whether we should permit incoming device state events.

configOption.name: device_state_filter
configOption.synopsis: Optional regular expression used to filter what devices we accept events for.

configOption.name: mailbox_state
configOption.synopsis: Whether we should permit incoming mailbox state events.

configOption.name: mailbox_state_filter
configOption.synopsis: Optional regular expression used to filter what mailboxes we accept events for.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'asterisk-publication'.

argument.name: file_format
argument.para: Optional. If not set, defaults to wav

parameter.name: fname_base
parameter.para: If set, changes the filename used to the one specified.

option.name: m
option.para: When the recording ends mix the two leg files into one and delete the two leg files. If the variable MONITOR_EXEC is set, the application referenced in it will be executed instead of soxmix/sox and the raw leg files will NOT be deleted automatically. soxmix/sox or MONITOR_EXEC is handed 3 arguments, the two leg files and a target mixed file name which is the same as the leg file names only without the in/out designator.
If MONITOR_EXEC_ARGS is set, the contents will be passed on as additional arguments to MONITOR_EXEC. Both MONITOR_EXEC and the Mix flag can be set from the administrator interface.

warning.para: Do not use untrusted strings such as CALLERID(num) or CALLERID(name) as part of MONITOR_EXEC or MONITOR_EXEC_ARGS. You risk a command injection attack executing arbitrary commands if the untrusted strings aren't filtered to remove dangerous characters. See function FILTER().

option.name: b
option.para: Don't begin recording unless a call is bridged to another channel.

option.name: B
option.para: Play a periodic beep while this call is being recorded.

argument.name: interval
argument.para: Interval, in seconds. Default is 15.

option.name: i
option.para: Skip recording of input stream (disables m option).

option.name: o
option.para: Skip recording of output stream (disables m option).

description.para: Used to start monitoring a channel. The channel's input and output voice packets are logged to files until the channel hangs up or monitoring is stopped by the StopMonitor application.
By default, files are stored to /var/spool/asterisk/monitor/. Returns -1 if monitor files can't be opened or if the channel is already monitored, otherwise 0.
Stops monitoring a channel. Has no effect if the channel is not monitored.

application.name: ChangeMonitor
application.synopsis: Change monitoring filename of a channel.

parameter.name: filename_base
parameter.para: The new filename base to use for monitoring this channel.

description.para: Changes monitoring filename of a channel. Has no effect if the channel is not monitored.
Pauses monitoring of a channel until it is re-enabled by a call to UnpauseMonitor.
Unpauses monitoring of a channel on which monitoring had previously been paused with PauseMonitor.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Used to specify the channel to record.

parameter.name: File
parameter.para: Is the name of the file created in the monitor spool directory. Defaults to the same name as the channel (with slashes replaced with dashes).

parameter.name: Format
parameter.para: Is the audio recording format. Defaults to wav.

parameter.name: Mix
parameter.para: Boolean parameter as to whether to mix the input and output channels together after the recording is finished.

description.para: This action may be used to record the audio on a specified channel.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: The name of the channel monitored.

description.para: This action may be used to end a previously started 'Monitor' action.

manager.name: ChangeMonitor
manager.synopsis: Change monitoring filename of a channel.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Used to specify the channel to record.

parameter.name: File
parameter.para: Is the new name of the file created in the monitor spool directory.

description.para: This action may be used to change the file started by a previous 'Monitor' action.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Used to specify the channel to record.

description.para: This action may be used to temporarily stop the recording of a channel.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Used to specify the channel to record.

description.para: This action may be used to re-enable recording of a channel after calling PauseMonitor.

configOption.name: hosts
configOption.synopsis: Full path to an optional hosts file

description.para: Hosts specified in a hosts file will be resolved within the resolver itself. If a value of system is provided the system-specific file will be used.

configOption.name: resolv
configOption.synopsis: Full path to an optional resolv.conf file

description.para: The resolv.conf file specifies the nameservers to contact when resolving queries. If a value of system is provided the system-specific file will be used. If provided alongside explicit nameservers the nameservers contained within the resolv.conf file will be used after all others.

configOption.name: nameserver
configOption.synopsis: Nameserver to use for queries

description.para: An explicit nameserver can be specified which is used for resolving queries. If multiple nameserver lines are specified the first will be the primary with failover occurring, in order, to the other nameservers as backups. If provided alongside a resolv.conf file the nameservers explicitly specified will be used before all others.

configOption.name: debug
configOption.synopsis: Unbound debug level

description.para: The debugging level for the unbound resolver. While there is no explicit range generally the higher the number the more debug is output.

configOption.name: ta_file
configOption.synopsis: Trust anchor file

description.para: Full path to a file with DS and DNSKEY records in zone file format. This file is provided to unbound and is used as a source for trust anchors.

In response, InboundRegistrationDetail events showing configuration and status information are raised for all contacts, static or dynamic. Once all events are completed an InboundRegistrationDetailComplete is issued.

warning.para: This command just dumps all coonfigured AORs with contacts, even if the contact is a permanent one. To really get just inbound registrations, use PJSIPShowRegistrationInboundContactStatuses.

manager.name: PJSIPShowRegistrationInboundContactStatuses
manager.synopsis: Lists ContactStatuses for PJSIP inbound registrations.

description.para: In response, ContactStatusDetail events showing status information are raised for each inbound registration (dynamic contact) object. Once all events are completed a ContactStatusDetailComplete event is issued.

manager.name: PresenceStateList
manager.synopsis: List the current known presence states.

description.para: This will list out all known presence states in a sequence of PresenceStateChange events. When finished, a PresenceStateListComplete event will be emitted.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Indicates the end of the list the current known extension states.

parameter.name: EventList
parameter.para: Conveys the status of the event list.

parameter.name: ListItems
parameter.para: Conveys the number of statuses reported.

description.para: The ACL module used by res_pjsip. This module is independent of endpoints and operates on all inbound SIP communication using res_pjsip.

There are two main ways of defining your ACL with the options provided. You can use the permit and deny options which act on IP addresses, or the contactpermit and contactdeny options which act on Contact header addresses in incoming REGISTER requests. You can combine the various options to create a mixed ACL.
Additionally, instead of defining an ACL with options, you can reference IP or Contact header ACLs from the file acl.conf by using the acl or contactacl options.

configOption.name: acl
configOption.synopsis: List of IP ACL section names in acl.conf

description.para: This matches sections configured in acl.conf. The value is defined as a list of comma-delimited section names.

configOption.name: contact_acl
configOption.synopsis: List of Contact ACL section names in acl.conf

description.para: This matches sections configured in acl.conf. The value is defined as a list of comma-delimited section names.

configOption.name: contact_deny
configOption.synopsis: List of Contact header addresses to deny

description.para: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

configOption.name: contact_permit
configOption.synopsis: List of Contact header addresses to permit

description.para: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

configOption.name: deny
configOption.synopsis: List of IP addresses to deny access from

description.para: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

configOption.name: permit
configOption.synopsis: List of IP addresses to permit access from

description.para: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/')

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'acl'.

manager.name: SorceryMemoryCacheExpireObject
manager.synopsis: Expire (remove) an object from a sorcery memory cache.

parameter.name: Cache
parameter.para: The name of the cache to expire the object from.

parameter.name: Object
parameter.para: The name of the object to expire.

description.para: Expires (removes) an object from a sorcery memory cache.

manager.name: SorceryMemoryCacheExpire
manager.synopsis: Expire (remove) ALL objects from a sorcery memory cache.

parameter.name: Cache
parameter.para: The name of the cache to expire all objects from.

description.para: Expires (removes) ALL objects from a sorcery memory cache.

manager.name: SorceryMemoryCacheStaleObject
manager.synopsis: Mark an object in a sorcery memory cache as stale.

parameter.name: Cache
parameter.para: The name of the cache to mark the object as stale in.

parameter.name: Object
parameter.para: The name of the object to mark as stale.

parameter.name: Reload
parameter.para: If true, then immediately reload the object from the backend cache instead of waiting for the next retrieval

description.para: Marks an object as stale within a sorcery memory cache.

manager.name: SorceryMemoryCacheStale
manager.synopsis: Marks ALL objects in a sorcery memory cache as stale.

parameter.name: Cache
parameter.para: The name of the cache to mark all object as stale in.

description.para: Marks ALL objects in a sorcery memory cache as stale.

manager.name: SorceryMemoryCachePopulate
manager.synopsis: Expire all objects from a memory cache and populate it with all objects from the backend.

parameter.name: Cache
parameter.para: The name of the cache to populate.

description.para: Expires all objects from a memory cache and populate it with all objects from the backend.

function.name: CALENDAR_BUSY
function.synopsis: Determine if the calendar is marked busy at this time.

description.para: Check the specified calendar's current busy status.

function.name: CALENDAR_EVENT
function.synopsis: Get calendar event notification data from a notification call.

enum.name: summary
enum.para: The VEVENT SUMMARY property or Exchange event 'subject'

enum.name: description
enum.para: The text description of the event

enum.name: calendar
enum.para: The name of the calendar associated with the event

enum.name: uid
enum.para: The unique identifier for this event

enum.name: start
enum.para: The start time of the event

enum.name: end
enum.para: The end time of the event

enum.name: busystate
enum.para: The busy state of the event 0=FREE, 1=TENTATIVE, 2=BUSY

description.para: Whenever a calendar event notification call is made, the event data may be accessed with this function.

function.name: CALENDAR_QUERY
function.synopsis: Query a calendar server and store the data on a channel

parameter.name: calendar
parameter.para: The calendar that should be queried

parameter.name: start
parameter.para: The start time of the query (in seconds since epoch)

parameter.name: end
parameter.para: The end time of the query (in seconds since epoch)

description.para: Get a list of events in the currently accessible timeframe of the calendar The function returns the id for accessing the result with CALENDAR_QUERY_RESULT()

function.name: CALENDAR_QUERY_RESULT
function.synopsis: Retrieve data from a previously run CALENDAR_QUERY() call

parameter.name: id
parameter.para: The query ID returned by CALENDAR_QUERY

enum.name: getnum
enum.para: number of events occurring during time range

enum.name: calendar
enum.para: The name of the calendar associted with the event

enum.name: uid
enum.para: The unique identifier for the event

enum.name: start
enum.para: The start time of the event (in seconds since epoch)

enum.name: end
enum.para: The end time of the event (in seconds since epoch)

enum.name: busystate
enum.para: The busy status of the event 0=FREE, 1=TENTATIVE, 2=BUSY

parameter.name: entry
parameter.para: Return data from a specific event returned by the query

description.para: After running CALENDAR_QUERY and getting a result id, calling CALENDAR_QUERY with that id and a field will return the data for that field. If multiple events matched the query, and entry is provided, information from that event will be returned.

function.name: CALENDAR_WRITE
function.synopsis: Write an event to a calendar

parameter.name: calendar
parameter.para: The calendar to write to

enum.name: uid
enum.para: The unique identifier for the event

enum.name: start
enum.para: The start time of the event (in seconds since epoch)

enum.name: end
enum.para: The end time of the event (in seconds since epoch)

enum.name: busystate
enum.para: The busy status of the event 0=FREE, 1=TENTATIVE, 2=BUSY

description.para: Example: CALENDAR_WRITE(calendar,field1,field2,field3)=val1,val2,val3
The field and value arguments can easily be set/passed using the HASHKEYS() and HASH() functions

variable.name: CALENDAR_SUCCESS
variable.para: The status of the write operation to the calendar
variable.value: The event was successfully written to the calendar.
The event was not written to the calendar due to network issues, permissions, etc.

function.name: MUTEAUDIO
function.synopsis: Muting audio streams in the channel

parameter.name: direction
parameter.para: Must be one of

description.para: The MUTEAUDIO function can be used to mute inbound (to the PBX) or outbound audio in a call.
Examples:
MUTEAUDIO(in)=on
MUTEAUDIO(in)=off

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: The channel you want to mute.

enum.name: in
enum.para: Set muting on inbound audio stream. (to the PBX)

enum.name: out
enum.para: Set muting on outbound audio stream. (from the PBX)

enum.name: all
enum.para: Set muting on inbound and outbound audio streams.

description.para: Mute an incoming or outgoing audio stream on a channel.

configInfo.name: res_pjsip_phoneprov_provider
configInfo.synopsis: Module that integrates res_pjsip with res_phoneprov.

description.para: This module creates the integration between res_pjsip and res_phoneprov.

Each user to be integrated requires a phoneprov section defined in pjsip.conf. Each section identifies the endpoint associated with the user and any other name/value pairs to be passed on to res_phoneprov's template substitution. Only MAC and PROFILE variables are required. Any other variables supplied will be passed through.
Example:
type = phoneprovr
endpoint = ep1000
MAC = deadbeef4dad
PROFILE = grandstream2
LINEKEYS = 2
LINE = 1
OTHERVAR = othervalue
The following variables are automatically defined if an endpoint is defined for the user:

enum.name: USERNAME
enum.para: Source: The user_name defined in the first auth reference in the endpoint.

enum.name: SECRET
enum.para: Source: The user_pass defined in the first auth reference in the endpoint.

enum.name: CALLERID
enum.para: Source: The number part of the callerid defined in the endpoint.

enum.name: DISPLAY_NAME
enum.para: Source: The name part of the callerid defined in the endpoint.

enum.name: LABEL
enum.para: Source: The id of the phoneprov section.

description.para: In addition to the standard variables, the following are also automatically defined:

enum.name: ENDPOINT_ID
enum.para: Source: The id of the endpoint.

enum.name: TRANSPORT_ID
enum.para: Source: The id of the transport used by the endpoint.

enum.name: AUTH_ID
enum.para: Source: The id of the auth used by the endpoint.

description.para: All other template substitution variables must be explicitly defined in the phoneprov_default or phoneprov sections.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'phoneprov'.

configOption.name: endpoint
configOption.synopsis: The endpoint from which variables will be retrieved.

configOption.name: MAC
configOption.synopsis: The mac address for this user. (required)

configOption.name: PROFILE
configOption.synopsis: The phoneprov profile to use for this user. (required)
Other name/value pairs to be passed through for use in templates.

description.para: This module allows res_pjsip to publish to other SIP servers.
Publish is COMPLETELY separate from the rest of pjsip.conf. A minimal configuration consists of setting a server_uri and event.

configOption.name: expiration
configOption.synopsis: Expiration time for publications in seconds

configOption.name: outbound_auth
configOption.synopsis: Authentication object(s) to be used for outbound publishes.

description.para: This is a comma-delimited list of auth sections defined in pjsip.conf used to respond to outbound authentication challenges.

note.para: Using the same auth section for inbound and outbound authentication is not recommended. There is a difference in meaning for an empty realm setting between inbound and outbound authentication uses. See the auth realm description for details.

configOption.name: outbound_proxy
configOption.synopsis: Full SIP URI of the outbound proxy used to send publishes

configOption.name: server_uri
configOption.synopsis: SIP URI of the server and entity to publish to

description.para: This is the URI at which to find the entity and server to send the outbound PUBLISH to. This URI is used as the request URI of the outbound PUBLISH request from Asterisk.

configOption.name: from_uri
configOption.synopsis: SIP URI to use in the From header

description.para: This is the URI that will be placed into the From header of outgoing PUBLISH messages. If no URI is specified then the URI provided in server_uri will be used.

configOption.name: to_uri
configOption.synopsis: SIP URI to use in the To header

description.para: This is the URI that will be placed into the To header of outgoing PUBLISH messages. If no URI is specified then the URI provided in server_uri will be used.

configOption.name: event
configOption.synopsis: Event type of the PUBLISH.

configOption.name: max_auth_attempts
configOption.synopsis: Maximum number of authentication attempts before stopping the publication.

configOption.name: transport
configOption.synopsis: Transport used for outbound publish

note.para: A transport configured in pjsip.conf. As with other res_pjsip modules, this will use the first available transport of the appropriate type if unconfigured.

configOption.name: multi_user
configOption.synopsis: Enable multi-user support

description.para: When enabled the user portion of the server uri is replaced by a dynamically created user

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'outbound-publish'.

manager.name: PJSIPNotify
manager.synopsis: Send a NOTIFY to either an endpoint, an arbitrary URI, or inside a SIP dialog.

parameter.name: Endpoint
parameter.para: The endpoint to which to send the NOTIFY.

parameter.name: URI
parameter.para: Abritrary URI to which to send the NOTIFY.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.para: Channel name to send the NOTIFY. Must be a PJSIP channel.

parameter.name: Variable
parameter.para: Appends variables as headers/content to the NOTIFY. If the variable is named Content, then the value will compose the body of the message if another variable sets Content-Type. name=value

description.para: Sends a NOTIFY to an endpoint, an arbitrary URI, or inside a SIP dialog.
All parameters for this event must be specified in the body of this request via multiple Variable: name=value sequences.

note.para: One (and only one) of Endpoint, URI, or Channel must be specified. If URI is used, the default outbound endpoint will be used to send the message. If the default outbound endpoint isn't configured, this command can not send to an arbitrary URI.

configInfo.name: res_pjsip_notify
configInfo.synopsis: Module that supports sending NOTIFY requests to endpoints from external sources

description.para: Each key-value pair in a notify configuration section defines either a SIP header to send in the request or a line of content in the request message body. A key of Content is treated as part of the message body and is appended in sequential order; any other header is treated as part of the SIP request.

configOption.synopsis: A key/value pair to add to a NOTIFY request.

description.para: If the key is Content, it will be treated as part of the message body. Otherwise, it will be added as a header in the NOTIFY request.
The following headers are reserved and cannot be specified:
This module provides alternatives to matching inbound requests to a configured endpoint. At least one of the matching mechanisms must be provided, or the object configuration is invalid.
The matching mechanisms are provided by the following configuration options:

note.para: If multiple matching criteria are provided then an inbound request will be matched to the endpoint if it matches any of the criteria.

configOption.name: endpoint
configOption.synopsis: Name of endpoint identified

configOption.name: match
configOption.synopsis: IP addresses or networks to match against.

description.para: The value is a comma-delimited list of IP addresses or hostnames. IP addresses may have a subnet mask appended. The subnet mask may be written in either CIDR or dotted-decimal notation. Separate the IP address and subnet mask with a slash ('/').

configOption.name: srv_lookups
configOption.synopsis: Perform SRV lookups for provided hostnames.

description.para: When enabled, srv_lookups will perform SRV lookups for _sip._udp, _sip._tcp, and _sips._tcp of the given hostnames to determine additional addresses that traffic may originate from.

configOption.name: match_header
configOption.synopsis: Header/value pair to match against.

description.para: A SIP header whose value is used to match against. SIP requests containing the header, along with the specified value, will be mapped to the specified endpoint. The header must be specified with a :, as in match_header = SIPHeader: value.
The specified SIP header value can be a regular expression if the value is of the form /regex/.

note.para: Use of a regex is expensive so be sure you need to use a regex to match your endpoint.

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be of type 'identify'.

description.para: Answers channel if not already in answer state. Returns -1 on channel failure, or 0 if successful.
Interrupts expected flow of Async AGI commands and returns control to previous source (typically, the PBX dialplan).

agi.name: channel status
agi.synopsis: Returns status of the connected channel.

description.para: Returns the status of the specified channelname. If no channel name is given then returns the status of the current channel.
Return values:

agi.name: control stream file
agi.synopsis: Sends audio file on channel and allows the listener to control the stream.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.para: The file extension must not be included in the filename.

parameter.name: ffchar
parameter.para: Defaults to #

parameter.name: rewchr
parameter.para: Defaults to *

parameter.name: offsetms
parameter.para: Offset, in milliseconds, to start the audio playback

description.para: Send the given file, allowing playback to be controlled by the given digits, if any. Use double quotes for the digits if you wish none to be permitted. If offsetms is provided then the audio will seek to offsetms before play starts. Returns 0 if playback completes without a digit being pressed, or the ASCII numerical value of the digit if one was pressed, or -1 on error or if the channel was disconnected. Returns the position where playback was terminated as endpos.
It sets the following channel variables upon completion:

variable.name: CPLAYBACKSTATUS
variable.para: Contains the status of the attempt as a text string

variable.name: CPLAYBACKOFFSET
variable.para: Contains the offset in ms into the file where playback was at when it stopped. -1 is end of file.

variable.name: CPLAYBACKSTOPKEY
variable.para: If the playback is stopped by the user this variable contains the key that was pressed.

description.para: Deletes an entry in the Asterisk database for a given family and key.
Returns 1 if successful, 0 otherwise.
Deletes a family or specific keytree within a family in the Asterisk database.
Returns 1 if successful, 0 otherwise.
Retrieves an entry in the Asterisk database for a given family and key.
Returns 0 if key is not set. Returns 1 if key is set and returns the variable in parenthesis.
Example return code: 200 result=1 (testvariable)
Adds or updates an entry in the Asterisk database for a given family, key, and value.
Returns 1 if successful, 0 otherwise.
Executes application with given options.
Returns whatever the application returns, or -2 on failure to find application.

agi.name: get data
agi.synopsis: Prompts for DTMF on a channel

description.para: Stream the given file, and receive DTMF data.
Returns the digits received from the channel at the other end.

Returns 0 if variablename is not set or channel does not exist. Returns 1 if variablename is set and returns the variable in parenthesis. Understands complex variable names and builtin variables, unlike GET VARIABLE.
Example return code: 200 result=1 (testvariable)

agi.name: get option
agi.synopsis: Stream file, prompt for DTMF, with timeout.

description.para: Behaves similar to STREAM FILE but used with a timeout option.
Returns 0 if variablename is not set. Returns 1 if variablename is set and returns the variable in parentheses.
Example return code: 200 result=1 (testvariable)
Hangs up the specified channel. If no channel name is given, hangs up the current channel
Does nothing.

agi.name: receive char
agi.synopsis: Receives one character from channels supporting it.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: The maximum time to wait for input in milliseconds, or 0 for infinite. Most channels

description.para: Receives a character of text on a channel. Most channels do not support the reception of text. Returns the decimal value of the character if one is received, or 0 if the channel does not support text reception. Returns -1 only on error/hangup.

agi.name: receive text
agi.synopsis: Receives text from channels supporting it.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: The timeout to be the maximum time to wait for input in milliseconds, or 0 for infinite.

description.para: Receives a string of text on a channel. Most channels do not support the reception of text. Returns -1 for failure or 1 for success, and the string in parenthesis.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.para: The destination filename of the recorded audio.

parameter.name: format
parameter.para: The audio format in which to save the resulting file.

parameter.name: escape_digits
parameter.para: The DTMF digits that will terminate the recording process.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.para: The maximum recording time in milliseconds. Set to -1 for no limit.

parameter.name: offset_samples
parameter.para: Causes the recording to first seek to the specified offset before recording begins.

parameter.name: beep
parameter.para: Causes Asterisk to play a beep as recording begins. This argument can take any value.

parameter.name: s=silence
parameter.para: The number of seconds of silence that are permitted before the recording is terminated, regardless of the escape_digits or timeout arguments. If specified, this parameter must be preceded by s=.

description.para: Record to a file until a given dtmf digit in the sequence is received. Returns -1 on hangup or error. The format will specify what kind of file will be recorded. The timeout is the maximum record time in milliseconds, or -1 for no timeout. offset samples is optional, and, if provided, will seek to the offset without exceeding the end of the file. beep can take any value, and causes Asterisk to play a beep to the channel that is about to be recorded. silence is the number of seconds of silence allowed before the function returns despite the lack of dtmf digits or reaching timeout. silence value must be preceded by s= and is also optional.

Say a given character string, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel. Returns 0 if playback completes without a digit being pressed, or the ASCII numerical value of the digit if one was pressed or -1 on error/hangup.

Say a given digit string, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel. Returns 0 if playback completes without a digit being pressed, or the ASCII numerical value of the digit if one was pressed or -1 on error/hangup.

Say a given number, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel. Returns 0 if playback completes without a digit being pressed, or the ASCII numerical value of the digit if one was pressed or -1 on error/hangup.

agi.name: say phonetic
agi.synopsis: Says a given character string with phonetics.

description.para: Say a given character string with phonetics, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel. Returns 0 if playback completes without a digit pressed, the ASCII numerical value of the digit if one was pressed, or -1 on error/hangup.

parameter.name: date
parameter.para: Is number of seconds elapsed since 00:00:00 on January 1, 1970. Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

description.para: Say a given date, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel. Returns 0 if playback completes without a digit being pressed, or the ASCII numerical value of the digit if one was pressed or -1 on error/hangup.

parameter.name: time
parameter.para: Is number of seconds elapsed since 00:00:00 on January 1, 1970. Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

description.para: Say a given time, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel. Returns 0 if playback completes without a digit being pressed, or the ASCII numerical value of the digit if one was pressed or -1 on error/hangup.

agi.name: say datetime
agi.synopsis: Says a given time as specified by the format given.

parameter.name: time
parameter.para: Is number of seconds elapsed since 00:00:00 on January 1, 1970, Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)

parameter.name: format
parameter.para: Is the format the time should be said in. See voicemail.conf (defaults to ABdY 'digits/at' IMp).

parameter.name: timezone
parameter.para: Acceptable values can be found in /usr/share/zoneinfo Defaults to machine default.

description.para: Say a given time, returning early if any of the given DTMF digits are received on the channel. Returns 0 if playback completes without a digit being pressed, or the ASCII numerical value of the digit if one was pressed or -1 on error/hangup.

agi.name: send image
agi.synopsis: Sends images to channels supporting it.

description.para: Sends the given image on a channel. Most channels do not support the transmission of images. Returns 0 if image is sent, or if the channel does not support image transmission. Returns -1 only on error/hangup. Image names should not include extensions.

agi.name: send text
agi.synopsis: Sends text to channels supporting it.

parameter.name: text to send
parameter.para: Text consisting of greater than one word should be placed in quotes since the command only accepts a single argument.

description.para: Sends the given text on a channel. Most channels do not support the transmission of text. Returns 0 if text is sent, or if the channel does not support text transmission. Returns -1 only on error/hangup.
Cause the channel to automatically hangup at time seconds in the future. Of course it can be hungup before then as well. Setting to 0 will cause the autohangup feature to be disabled on this channel.

agi.name: set callerid
agi.synopsis: Sets callerid for the current channel.

description.para: Changes the callerid of the current channel.
Sets the context for continuation upon exiting the application.
Changes the extension for continuation upon exiting the application.
Enables/Disables the music on hold generator. If class is not specified, then the default music on hold class will be used. This generator will be stopped automatically when playing a file.
Always returns 0.
Changes the priority for continuation upon exiting the application. The priority must be a valid priority or label.
Sets a variable to the current channel.

parameter.name: filename
parameter.para: File name to play. The file extension must not be included in the filename.

parameter.name: escape_digits
parameter.para: Use double quotes for the digits if you wish none to be permitted.

parameter.name: sample offset
parameter.para: If sample offset is provided then the audio will seek to sample offset before play starts.

description.para: Send the given file, allowing playback to be interrupted by the given digits, if any. Returns 0 if playback completes without a digit being pressed, or the ASCII numerical value of the digit if one was pressed, or -1 on error or if the channel was disconnected. If musiconhold is playing before calling stream file it will be automatically stopped and will not be restarted after completion.
It sets the following channel variables upon completion:

variable.name: PLAYBACKSTATUS
variable.para: The status of the playback attempt as a text string.

description.para: Enable/Disable TDD transmission/reception on a channel. Returns 1 if successful, or 0 if channel is not TDD-capable.

agi.name: verbose
agi.synopsis: Logs a message to the asterisk verbose log.

description.para: Sends message to the console via verbose message system. level is the verbose level (1-4). Always returns 1

agi.name: wait for digit
agi.synopsis: Waits for a digit to be pressed.

description.para: Waits up to timeout milliseconds for channel to receive a DTMF digit. Returns -1 on channel failure, 0 if no digit is received in the timeout, or the numerical value of the ascii of the digit if one is received. Use -1 for the timeout value if you desire the call to block indefinitely.
Create a speech object to be used by the other Speech AGI commands.
Set an engine-specific setting.
Destroy the speech object created by SPEECH CREATE.
Loads the specified grammar as the specified name.
Unloads the specified grammar.
Activates the specified grammar on the speech object.
Deactivates the specified grammar on the speech object.
Plays back given prompt while listening for speech and dtmf.

parameter.name: command
parameter.para: How AGI should be invoked on the channel.

parameter.name: args
parameter.para: Arguments to pass to the AGI script or server.

description.para: Executes an Asterisk Gateway Interface compliant program on a channel. AGI allows Asterisk to launch external programs written in any language to control a telephony channel, play audio, read DTMF digits, etc. by communicating with the AGI protocol.
The following variants of AGI exist, and are chosen based on the value passed to command:

enum.name: AGI
enum.para: The classic variant of AGI, this will launch the script specified by command as a new process. Communication with the script occurs on stdin and stdout. If the full path to the script is not provided, the astagidir specified in asterisk.conf will be used.

enum.name: FastAGI
enum.para: Connect Asterisk to a FastAGI server using a TCP connection. The URI to the FastAGI server should be given in the form [scheme]://host.domain[:port][/script/name], where scheme is either agi or hagi.

In the case of hagi, an SRV lookup will be performed to try to connect to a list of FastAGI servers. The hostname in the URI must be prefixed with _agi._tcp. prior to the DNS resolution. For example, if you specify the URI hagi://agi.example.com/foo.agi the DNS query would be for _agi._tcp.agi.example.com. You will need to make sure this resolves correctly.

enum.name: AsyncAGI
enum.para: Use AMI to control the channel in AGI. AGI commands can be invoked using the AMI action, with a variety of AGI specific events passed back over the AMI connection. AsyncAGI should be invoked by passing agi:async to the command parameter.

note.para: As of 1.6.0, this channel will not stop dialplan execution on hangup inside of this application. Dialplan execution will continue normally, even upon hangup until the AGI application signals a desire to stop (either by exiting or, in the case of a net script, by closing the connection).

A locally executed AGI script will receive SIGHUP on hangup from the channel except when using DeadAGI (or when the channel is already hungup). A fast AGI server will correspondingly receive a HANGUP inline with the command dialog. Both of these signals may be disabled by setting the AGISIGHUP channel variable to no before executing the AGI application. Alternatively, if you would like the AGI application to exit immediately after a channel hangup is detected, set the AGIEXITONHANGUP variable to yes.

description.example:
; Start the AGI script /tmp/my-cool-script.sh, passing it the contents ; of the channel variable FOO same => n,AGI(/tmp/my-cool-script.sh,${FOO})
; Start the AGI script my-cool-script.sh located in the astagidir ; directory, specified in asterisk.conf same => n,AGI(my-cool-script.sh)
; Connect to the FastAGI server located at 127.0.0.1 and start the script ; awesome-script same => n,AGI(agi://127.0.0.1/awesome-script)
; Start AsyncAGI same => n,AGI(agi:async)
description.para: This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

variable.name: AGISTATUS
variable.para: The status of the attempt to the run the AGI script text string, one of:

description.para: Using 'EAGI' provides enhanced AGI, with incoming audio available out of band on file descriptor 3. In all other respects, it behaves in the same fashion as AGI. See the documentation for the AGI dialplan application for more information on invoking AGI on a channel.
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

application.name: DeadAGI
application.synopsis: Executes AGI on a hungup channel.

warning.para: This application is deprecated and may be removed in a future version of Asterisk. Use the replacement application AGI instead of DeadAGI.

description.para: Execute AGI on a 'dead' or hungup channel. See the documentation for the AGI dialplan application for more information on invoking AGI on a channel.
This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:

manager.name: AGI
manager.synopsis: Add an AGI command to execute by Async AGI.

parameter.name: Channel
parameter.para: Channel that is currently in Async AGI.

parameter.name: Command
parameter.para: Application to execute.

parameter.name: CommandID
parameter.para: This will be sent back in CommandID header of AsyncAGI exec event notification.

description.para: Add an AGI command to the execute queue of the channel in Async AGI.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a channel starts AsyncAGI command processing.

parameter.name: Env
parameter.para: URL encoded string read from the AsyncAGI server.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a channel stops AsyncAGI command processing.
Raised when AsyncAGI completes an AGI command.

parameter.name: CommandID
parameter.para: Optional command ID sent by the AsyncAGI server to identify the command.

parameter.name: Result
parameter.para: URL encoded result string from the executed AGI command.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a received AGI command starts processing.

parameter.name: Command
parameter.para: The AGI command as received from the external source.

parameter.name: CommandId
parameter.para: Random identification number assigned to the execution of this command.

managerEventInstance.synopsis: Raised when a received AGI command completes processing.

parameter.name: ResultCode
parameter.para: The numeric result code from AGI

parameter.name: Result
parameter.para: The text result reason from AGI

configObject.name: globals
configObject.synopsis: Options that apply to every parking lot

configOption.name: parkeddynamic
configOption.synopsis: Enables dynamically created parkinglots.

description.para: If the option is enabled then the following variables can be used to dynamically create new parking lots.

The PARKINGDYNAMIC variable specifies the parking lot to use as a template to create a dynamic parking lot. It is an error to specify a non-existent parking lot for the template. If not set then the default parking lot is used as the template.

The PARKINGDYNCONTEXT variable specifies the dialplan context to use for the newly created dynamic parking lot. If not set then the context from the parking lot template is used. The context is created if it does not already exist and the new parking lot needs to create extensions.

The PARKINGDYNEXTEN variable specifies the parkext to use for the newly created dynamic parking lot. If not set then the parkext is used from the parking lot template. If the template does not specify a parkext then no extensions are created for the newly created parking lot. The dynamic parking lot cannot be created if it needs to create extensions that overlap existing parking lot extensions. The only exception to this is for the parkext extension and only if neither of the overlaping parking lot's parkext is exclusive.
The PARKINGDYNPOS variable specifies the parking positions to use for the newly created dynamic parking lot. If not set then the parkpos from the parking lot template is used.

configObject.name: parking_lot
configObject.synopsis: Defined parking lots for res_parking to use to park calls on

configOption.name: context
configOption.synopsis: The name of the context where calls are parked and picked up from.

description.para: This option is only used if parkext is set.

configOption.name: parkext
configOption.synopsis: Extension to park calls to this parking lot.

description.para: If this option is used, this extension will automatically be created to place calls into parking lots. In addition, if parkext_exclusive is set for this parking lot, the name of the parking lot will be included in the application's arguments so that it only parks to this parking lot. The extension will be created in context. Using this option also creates extensions for retrieving parked calls from the parking spaces in the same context.

note.para: Generated parking extensions cannot overlap. The only exception is if neither overlapping parkext is exclusive.

configOption.name: parkext_exclusive
configOption.synopsis: If yes, the extension registered as parkext will park exclusively to this parking lot.

configOption.name: parkpos
configOption.synopsis: Numerical range of parking spaces which can be used to retrieve parked calls.

description.para: If parkext is set, these extensions will automatically be mapped in context in order to pick up calls parked to these parking spaces.

configOption.name: parkinghints
configOption.synopsis: If yes, this parking lot will add hints automatically for parking spaces.

configOption.name: parkingtime
configOption.synopsis: Amount of time a call will remain parked before giving up (in seconds).

configOption.name: parkedmusicclass
configOption.synopsis: Which music class to use for parked calls. They will use the default if unspecified.

configOption.name: comebacktoorigin
configOption.synopsis: Determines what should be done with the parked channel if no one picks it up before it times out.

description.para: Valid Options:

enum.name: yes
enum.para: Automatically have the parked channel dial the device that parked the call with dial timeout set by the parkingtime option. When the call times out an extension to dial the PARKER will automatically be created in the park-dial context with an extension of the flattened parker device name. If the call is not answered, the parked channel that is timing out will continue in the dial plan at that point if there are more priorities in the extension (which won't be the case unless the dialplan deliberately includes such priorities in the park-dial context through pattern matching or deliberately written flattened peer extensions).

enum.name: no
enum.para: Place the call into the PBX at comebackcontext instead. The extension will still be set as the flattened peer name. If an extension the flattened peer name isn't available then it will fall back to the s extension. If that also is unavailable it will attempt to fall back to s@default. The normal dial extension will still be created in the park-dial context with the extension also being the flattened peer name.

note.para: Flattened Peer Names - Extensions can not include slash characters since those are used for pattern matching. When a peer name is flattened, slashes become underscores. For example if the parker of a call is called SIP/0004F2040001 then flattened peer name and therefor the extensions created and used on timeouts will be SIP_0004F204001.
When parking times out and the channel returns to the dial plan, the following variables are set:

variable.name: PARKING_SPACE
variable.para: extension that the call was parked in prior to timing out.

variable.name: PARKINGSLOT
variable.para: Deprecated. Use PARKING_SPACE instead.

variable.name: PARKEDLOT
variable.para: name of the lot that the call was parked in prior to timing out.

variable.name: PARKER
variable.para: The device that parked the call

variable.name: PARKER_FLAT
variable.para: The flat version of PARKER

configOption.name: comebackdialtime
configOption.synopsis: Timeout for the Dial extension created to call back the parker when a parked call times out.

configOption.name: comebackcontext
configOption.synopsis: Context where parked calls will enter the PBX on timeout when comebacktoorigin=no

description.para: The extension the call enters will prioritize the flattened peer name in this context. If the flattened peer name extension is unavailable, then the 's' extension in this context will be used. If that also is unavailable, the 's' extension in the 'default' context will be used.

configOption.name: courtesytone
configOption.synopsis: If the name of a sound file is provided, use this as the courtesy tone

description.para: By default, this tone is only played to the caller of a parked call. Who receives the tone can be changed using the parkedplay option.

configOption.name: parkedplay
configOption.synopsis: Who we should play the courtesytone to on the pickup of a parked call from this lot

enum.name: caller
enum.para: Apply only to the call connecting with the call coming out of the parking lot.

enum.name: callee
enum.para: Apply only to the call coming out of the parking lot.

note.para: If courtesy tone is not specified then this option will be ignored.

configOption.name: parkedcalltransfers
configOption.synopsis: Who to apply the DTMF transfer features to when parked calls are picked up or timeout.

configOption.name: parkedcallreparking
configOption.synopsis: Who to apply the DTMF parking feature to when parked calls are picked up or timeout.

configOption.name: parkedcallhangup
configOption.synopsis: Who to apply the DTMF hangup feature to when parked calls are picked up or timeout.

configOption.name: parkedcallrecording
configOption.synopsis: Who to apply the DTMF MixMonitor recording feature to when parked calls are picked up or timeout.

configOption.name: findslot
configOption.synopsis: Rule to use when trying to figure out which parking space a call should be parked with.

enum.name: first
enum.para: Always try to place in the lowest available space in the parking lot

enum.name: next
enum.para: Track the last parking space used and always attempt to use the one immediately after.

configOption.name: enabled
configOption.synopsis: Enable/disable the statsd module

configOption.name: server
configOption.synopsis: Address of the statsd server

configOption.name: prefix
configOption.synopsis: Prefix to prepend to every metric

configOption.name: add_newline
configOption.synopsis: Append a newline to every event. This is useful if you want to fake out a server using netcat (nc -lu 8125)

configInfo.name: res_pjsip_config_wizard
configInfo.synopsis: Module that privides simple configuration wizard capabilities.

description.para: This module allows creation of common PJSIP configuration scenarios without having to specify individual endpoint, aor, auth, identify and registration objects.

For example, the following configuration snippet would create the endpoint, aor, contact, auth and phoneprov objects necessary for a phone to get phone provisioning information, register, and make and receive calls. A hint is also created in the default context for extension 1000.
[myphone]
type = wizard
sends_auth = no
accepts_auth = yes
sends_registrations = no
accepts_registrations = yes
has_phoneprov = yes
transport = ipv4
has_hint = yes
hint_exten = 1000
inbound_auth/username = testname
inbound_auth/password = test password
endpoint/allow = ulaw
endpoint/context = default
phoneprov/MAC = 001122aa4455
phoneprov/PROFILE = profile1
The first 8 items are specific to the wizard. The rest of the items are passed verbatim to the underlying objects.
The following configuration snippet would create the endpoint, aor, contact, auth, identify and registration objects necessary for a trunk to another pbx or ITSP that requires registration.
[mytrunk]
type = wizard
sends_auth = yes
accepts_auth = no
sends_registrations = yes
accepts_registrations = no
transport = ipv4
remote_hosts = sip1.myitsp.com:5060,sip2.myitsp.com:5060
outbound_auth/username = testname
outbound_auth/password = test password
endpoint/allow = ulaw
endpoint/context = default
Of course, any of the items in either example could be placed into templates and shared among wizard objects.
For more information, visit:
For more information, visit:

configOption.name: type
configOption.synopsis: Must be 'wizard'.

configOption.name: transport
configOption.synopsis: The name of a transport to use for this object.

description.para: If not specified, the default will be used.

configOption.name: remote_hosts
configOption.synopsis: List of remote hosts.

description.para: A comma-separated list of remote hosts in the form of host[:port]. If set, an aor static contact and an identify match will be created for each entry in the list. If send_registrations is also set, a registration will also be created for each.

configOption.name: outbound_proxy
configOption.synopsis: Shortcut for specifying proxy on individual objects.

description.para: Shortcut for specifying endpoint/outbound_proxy, aor/outbound_proxy, and registration/outbound_proxy individually.

configOption.name: sends_auth
configOption.synopsis: Send outbound authentication to remote hosts.

description.para: At least outbound_auth/username is required.

configOption.name: accepts_auth
configOption.synopsis: Accept incoming authentication from remote hosts.

description.para: At least inbound_auth/username is required.

configOption.name: sends_registrations
configOption.synopsis: Send outbound registrations to remote hosts.

description.para: remote_hosts is required and a registration object will be created for each host in the remote _hosts string. If authentication is required, sends_auth and an outbound_auth/username must also be supplied.

configOption.name: sends_line_with_registrations
configOption.synopsis: Sets "line" and "endpoint parameters on registrations.

description.para: Setting this to true will cause the wizard to skip the creation of an identify object to match incoming requests to the endpoint and instead add the line and endpoint parameters to the outbound registration object.

configOption.name: accepts_registrations
configOption.synopsis: Accept inbound registration from remote hosts.

description.para: An AOR with dynamic contacts will be created. If the number of contacts nneds to be limited, set aor/max_contacts.

configOption.name: has_phoneprov
configOption.synopsis: Create a phoneprov object for this endpoint.

description.para: A phoneprov object will be created. phoneprov/MAC must be specified.

configOption.name: server_uri_pattern
configOption.synopsis: A pattern to use for constructing outbound registration server_uris.

description.para: The literal ${REMOTE_HOST} will be substituted with the appropriate remote_host for each registration.

configOption.name: client_uri_pattern
configOption.synopsis: A pattern to use for constructing outbound registration client_uris.

description.para: The literals ${REMOTE_HOST} and ${USERNAME} will be substituted with the appropriate remote_host and outbound_auth/username.

configOption.name: contact_pattern
configOption.synopsis: A pattern to use for constructing outbound contact uris.

description.para: The literal ${REMOTE_HOST} will be substituted with the appropriate remote_host for each contact.

configOption.name: has_hint
configOption.synopsis: Create hint and optionally a default application.

description.para: Create hint and optionally a default application.

configOption.name: hint_context
configOption.synopsis: The context in which to place hints.

description.para: Ignored if hint_exten is not specified otherwise specifies the context into which the dialplan hints will be placed. If not specified, defaults to the endpoint's context or default if that isn't found.

configOption.name: hint_exten
configOption.synopsis: Extension to map a PJSIP hint to.

description.para: Will create the following entry in hint_context:
Normal dialplan precedence rules apply so if there's already a hint for this extension in hint_context, this one will be ignored. For more information, visit:

configOption.name: hint_application
configOption.synopsis: Application to call when 'hint_exten' is dialed.

description.para: Ignored if hint_exten isn't specified otherwise will create the following priority 1 extension in hint_context:
You can specify any valid extensions.conf application expression.
Examples:
Any extensions.conf style variables specified are passed directly to the dialplan.
Normal dialplan precedence rules apply so if there's already a priority 1 application for this specific extension in hint_context, this one will be ignored. For more information, visit:

configOption.name: endpoint/*
configOption.synopsis: Variables to be passed directly to the endpoint.

configOption.name: aor/*
configOption.synopsis: Variables to be passed directly to the aor.

description.para: If an aor/contact is explicitly defined then remote_hosts will not be used to create contacts automatically.

configOption.name: inbound_auth/*
configOption.synopsis: Variables to be passed directly to the inbound auth.

configOption.name: outbound_auth/*
configOption.synopsis: Variables to be passed directly to the outbound auth.

configOption.name: identify/*
configOption.synopsis: Variables to be passed directly to the identify.

description.para: If an identify/match is explicitly defined then remote_hosts will not be used to create matches automatically.

configOption.name: registration/*
configOption.synopsis: Variables to be passed directly to the outbound registrations.

configOption.name: phoneprov/*
configOption.synopsis: Variables to be passed directly to the phoneprov object.

description.para: To activate phoneprov, at least phoneprov/MAC must be set.

enum.name: max_forwards
enum.para:
R/W Get or set the maximum number of call forwards for this channel.
This number describes the number of times a call may be forwarded by this channel before the call fails. "Forwards" in this case refers to redirects by phones as well as calls to local channels.
Note that this has no relation to the SIP Max-Forwards header.
